description: This is the best pizza in north beach. I might as well come out and say it. I hate that everyone else in sf is finally realizing how amazing this place is because it has been busy all year. Add more tables plz!
author: Cainen G.

description: As good as any pie I've had in Manhattan (and I've had a LOT)! Great service (thanks for the amazing Croatian hospitality, Radomir!). Quiet, relaxing atmosphere...I'll definitely be back when I'm in town.
author: Mark S.

description: Don't be put off by the location right on Columbus. The pizza here is really good. My personal favorite. They also have some nice apps and burrata and mozzarella. Not a huge menu, but what they do, they do well.
author: Nick N.

description:
So... I'm Italian so it's really really hard for me to be nice to pizza places but this place... IS AMAZING!!!The burrata is the best appetizer ever and the pizza you can choose whatever but my favorite is Calzone: full of mushrooms, ham, cheese!  It is simple the best!
The owner is real Italian and can give you great advices and also really good wine as well, try Nero Davola! And also don't forget the awesome Italian desert!
author: Irina P.

description: One of the best pizzas in town. Always busy and with good vibes. Just be prepared to wait a bit for a table
author: Gab P.

description: Have been dreaming of the pizza since we had it.    We devoured the prosciutto and burrata, and the pizza!!  Can't wait to come back!
author: Jess M.

description: One of my husband's and my favorite spot for pizza! I almost don't want to give a good review because I don't want anyone else to discover this great place! The food is reasonably priced and we share a bottle of prosecco, salad, and a pizza. Always look forward to going back!
author: Joanna T.

description:
I don't eat pizza a lot, but when I do I research the hell out of all available options. We ordered Prosciutto Pizza, got it delivered via Postmates, split the pie. 

What I liked - the dough! Chewy, a bit sweet, with a taste of that wood burning oven. 
What I did not like - it was a bit too salty, so I gave half of my Prosciutto topping to my dog. He loved it. I loved the taste. 

Really good pizza, maybe next time I will be convinced to eat it in the restaurant.
author: Anelya S.

description:
1 pizza is enough for 2 people:
Diavola I would say has 6 decent thin-crust slices
Nice waitresses & helpful for Take-out.
Most people ordered pizza & a lot of wine :D
author: Melissa L.

description:
Been to Italy several times... This place is fairly close to Neapolitan pizza.  Crust even though imported from Italy, lacked the crisp wafer crust I found.  Wood oven pizza gave it a nice char.  This place reminded me of pizza in Amalfi coast.  

Very good but not the best I had.  Service for us was non existent until desert time.
author: David H.

description: The best pizza in SF hands down. Parmesan wheel made it just that much better. Worth every dollar!!
author: James C.

description: This place was fantastic. We had a big party so I called ahead and asked to reserve a table. I talked to "Rad" and he came through big time. Our table was all set up the second we walked through the door at 7:30 for a party of 8. Service was excellent. Food was delicious. Traditional Italian pizza was top notch. You have to try the burrata and mozzarella appetizers which are made in house. Out of all the great restaurants in North Beach, there's no doubt in my mind this is one of the best
author: Alex W.

description:
If Vicoletto is your choice for a fancy candlelight dinner, Il Casaro's more casual setting is great for larger groups, couples, and single diners alike. Their open and bright space is inviting and lively.

Best seat: At the bar. And bar means kitchen. You can watch the chefs, see the pizza cook in the stone oven, and make small talk with your neighbor.

Best food: Hard to pick - what's not to like from the fantastic menu! I personally favored the DIAVOLA PIZZA ($14) with salami and jalapenos. The BURRATA ($9), fresh from Italy, was also extremely delightful and creamy. The BUTTERNUT SQUASH SOUP ($6) and the MEATBALLS W/ TOMATO SAUCE ($6) were divine.

Service is very friendly and attentive - Francesco makes sure you're seated and taken care of. A great casual dining experience with fantastic food!
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Greatness in this place. Location, flavor, price, service. 

So nice to sit by the huge window over looking Columbus St. with a cold glass of Chardonnay with delicious pie!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Vicoletto's sibling is making waves on her own.

This is a casual space with a beautiful white marble bar and open prep space. The star of the show is a bright red wood burning pizza oven. That baby brings out pliable, simply delicious Neopolitan pizzas! We chose the pizza Margherita made with Fior di buffalo mozzarella, sweet San Marzano tomatoes and fresh basil. Authentic just like in Italy!

Since it was a bit of a chilly night, the butternut squash soup with shaved parmiggiano warmed me up fast. Then came the arancini which were filled with ground beef, risotto and cheese. You have to try this, it just seems wrong to pass up on deep fried balls! ;-) Speaking of circular shapes, their burratta is creamy and served with a nice side salad and wood fired dough. Total NOMS. And as we were patting our distended bellies and calling it quits, our wonderful server Uriel brought out a heavenly raspberry panna cotta. 

I've been a loyal follower of Francesco and his team, I always leave his restaurant feeling like a welcomed guest in his home. Needless to say, you'll see me frequenting Il Casaro a lot. Congratulations on the new place and see you very soon!
author: Janice C.

description: Mamma Mia  This is one of the best pizzas ever! Located in the fabulous North End, Il Casaro has a great vibe and wonderful staff. There will definitely be a line out the door, but it's worth the wait. The atmosphere was cozy and charming. The staff was courteous and attentive. The burrata was amazing. The tiramisu was amazing. The margherita pizza was amazing. So yeah. This place is amazing!
author: Argelia M.

description: This might just be the BEST pizzeria I've been to! We arrived very hungry, and hesitant to put our name down on what seemed like a lengthy list. We waited around, and tables didn't see to be turning. So we walked across the street to The Stinking Rose, were quoted a short wait. While waiting, I received a text on my phone from here that our table was ready. Without hesitation, we decided to hop back across the street. This was the best decision. Our server was really awesome, loved her personality and honesty when asked about her favorite pizza. We ended up getting the fresh buffalo mozzarella app which came with fresh baked bread, arugula drizzled with evoo and cherry tomatoes. It was beyond amazing, clearly very fresh cheese! It was everything and more. Loved the Calabrian chili oil at the table. We also ordered the four cheese pizza (Mozzarella, goat cheese, asiago, gorgonzola), and added mushrooms to it. It sounds basic--but holy moly was it delish! Regretful that we didn't have room for dessert. I highly recommend this place. Also, great music, and open windows at the front of the restaurant. I will definitely be back!!
author: Nora S.

description:
yes it is the best margherita pizza in bay area

order buffalina
author: Kunal A.

description: Topping ingredients were solid and dough tasted fresh, but our pizza was soggy and service was a bit slow. We got the one with broccoli rabe and sausage to which we requested tomato sauce. The sauce could have thrown them off but there was very little sauce and for such high reviews I'd expect they know how to adjust to a minor change. I've piled on toppings at Blaze pizza and for $8.95, they were able to fit them all and not require me to eat my pizza with a fork due to sogginess. For the price here, I would say this was decent but disappointing.
author: Christine J.

description:
So... It was a beautiful Saturday day and we felt like getting some Italian food.

Buratta was bad

It took them 30 minutes to get our pizza, and they brought wrong one

Pizza was pretty good and the waiter was friendly
author: V V.

description:
Wow ... My daughter told me about Il Casaro yesterday afternoon and after hearing her describe the pizza as "spectacular" we headed straight over last night!  Really good authentic Napoletana style pizza.  Wood fired, soft dough, just the right amount of crispy bits on the outside ... perfect sauce, soft, fluffy, creamy mozzarella cheese - pizza heaven!

We had the buffalo mozzarella and burrata to start .. super delicious!  And then the Diavola pizza (incredible with the Buffalo mozza) - perfect amount of heat in the salami and sauce - and the Magherita with MORE Buffalo mozza (you can't eat too much, right!?).  

Friendly and attentive staff also!

We will put Il Casaro on our regular restaurant stops list!!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: OMG YES YES YES. found this place through google and I was not disappointed. The only thing i was disappointed in was my lack of self control because I ate a WHOLE prosciutto pizza. BY. MYSELF. so worth it.
author: Rachel P.

description: Yum! Terrific pizza and I love the marinated chili peppers that are free on the table! Wine was inexpensive and good. Long line proves that this is a north beach favorite.
author: Tina C.

description: No gluten free option.  Just annoying to go all the way there and then have them have told me they have one and have it be a top pick for gluten free pizza search and I cannot eat.   There are dozens of great crusts from Mirposa or Udis or others.  Shame the owners are so insensitive.
author: Matt H.

description:
One of the best pizzas I have ever had!!! Al about the fresh, good ingredients. If I had to find something negative about this place.... Maybe that they had run out of the beer I wanted (and there was NO need for beer with these amazing pies) 
Love it!!!!
author: Alejandro R.

description:
I really wanted to try IL Casaro for their oven baked pizza. There were 5 of us and I am happy that they have seating for large parties. We were seated at the high tables and were instantly presented with menus and water. We had a vegetarian with us so we decided on the Prosciutto, Norma and Margherita pizzas.

The Prosciutto came with hand cut slices of cheese on top that was very divine. The prosciutto itself was hard to find but were an amazing touch to the thin slice pizza. I liked that the crust was very puffy and doughy with a slight crunch.
The Norma was really nice as well. I felt that the sauce overpowered the dough from the pizza and left it in a swamp. It slid off my pizza and took the cheese with it. Norma was meant to be eaten with a knife and fork.
Finally the Margherita pizza had a sweet touch. There were thin slices of sweet vegetables that were an amazing touch to the cheese and dough. 

The place was lit, open and welcoming. I enjoy the modern design, seating and the large pizza oven. I felt that the pizzas were delicious but I wouldn't have minded if they cooked it a little longer. I felt that my pizzas were hard to pick up and had to be eaten with a fork and knife. I had 3 slices and a shock top and I felt like I was pretty satisfied. I still had room for dessert.
author: Linda K.

description: I had heard quite a bit about this pizza bar and have to say I was quite disappointed.  Pizza was average at best and server couldn't have cared less about his patrons.  Unfortunately, won't be going back.
author: MARIE P.

description: This was a great little out-of-the-way place in the North Beach section of San Francisco. The delicious pizza, olives, and salad were as tasty as the house red wine. It's small; but quaint!!
author: Jeff F.

description: Their queue doesn't work very well on busy nights. you might wait in front of the restaurant for 40 mins even though they told you before it would be a 10-15 mins wait. in the end you get a place at the bar, even though you asked for a table, while large groups have priority.
author: Burak B.

description: By first glance at the menu, you know you are in the right place to have an authentic pizza.  Where else could you find buffalo mozzarella on the menu anyway?  My hubby had been to this place with his Italian friend and wanted me to try it.  On a casual stroll from Financial district towards Columbus Ave- this airy casual place was welcoming us.  We ordered a pizza and pulled pork pasta dish.  The pizza is Napolitano style- thin and crispy.  The dough, tomato paste and excellent cheese on our margarita pizza were simply a marriage of taste and simplicity.  The pasta was well-seasoned with too much of olive oil for my taste- but I'm pretty sure a true Italian would pour some more olive oil on it!  This place is a great destination for small to large casual gathering, very low key yet trendy.
author: Megan K.

description: Nice...clean...upscale...hipster pizza joint. I ordered the quattro formaggi which contained mozzarella, goat cheese, asiago and gorgonzola. Mmmm the pizza was delicious and the goat cheese was so standout ish mmm. Even tho I'm a huge fan of the pizza and ranch combo this isn't the place to display that tendency. The chili oil was a plus since I'm a huge fan of spice. Overall this place gets a thumbs up from me and my next visit the margherita pizza will be ordered.
author: Marcus M.

description:
After walking around Little Italy, we decided to give this place a try based from high yelp rec plus the food looked good front he outside ;-) we were told around the area that they have the closest pizza to Naples style pizza. 

We were seated right away (feeling thankful on a busy Saturday afternoon).  We placed our order and requested for it to all come at the same time. 

We ordered: burrata mozzarella, margherita pizza, marinara pizza, bucatini pasta.

Having just gone back from a trip to Italy we were ready for some pizza and this place delivered. The dough is thin, tasty and the tomato sauce is superb. Why did this remind us of an authentic Napoli pizza? The center is soft, tender and the cheese is soupy in the middle- yummy. We would definitely come back to try all the other pizza. 

The burrata was creamy and soft. My boys devoured it and claimed it to be so close to the ones they had in Italy. 

The bucatini pasta was aldente. The sauce was perfectly balanced by a hint of sweetness from the onions. We cleaned off the bowl with our pizza dough. 

Overall, really good place to eat and experience oven wood pizza Napoli style. The place has more of an upscale, hip vibe to it that we did feel a bit out of place (with 2 boys with us). Seems like the manager was walking and talking to everyone but  never managed to acknowledge us- which is fine, we had a great server (May have been the busy Saturday afternoon too). 

Overall, I give it 4 stars. Our pizza came much later after we've already finished our other 2 meals (we were sharing all the meals). Our meal came to $55. 

Great Napoli style pizzas.
author: Vanessa M.

description: I am not a frequent rater on yelp, but I felt this pizzeria deserved a 5 Star rating.  Fast service and oh my goodness the taste of the prosciutto pizza is indescribably yummy.  Something I'll look forward to every time I come to San Francisco.  Must try this pizza.
author: Kristine K.

description: Enjoyed great lasagne, olive plate and delicious meatball appetizer. Great wine and service to boot. Will return.
author: Matthew C.

description:
First time here....
The employees (including the manager) are the sweetest people you will ever meet!! They took care of my big party of 12 with no worries and conveniently let me call and add us to the waitlist beforehand. Their food was absolutely delicious !!! The dough they use is out of this world and their Mozzarella is just to die for. The employees truly took care of us and made us feel right at home. Also, the bill for 12 people was not even bad at all. 6 pizzas, beers, wines, and some appetizers. 
From start to finish, this place had the best vibes, great music, great people, and ALL SMILES. I will most definitely come back again. 10/10
author: Natalie W.

description: I have been on a hunt for the perfect Margarita Pizza for years. And let me tell you this is one of them. Hands down the margarita pizza here is perfection. This is coming from someone who has been to Italy and ate pizza in Napoli where margarita pizza was invented and I can boldly state that it's just as yummy as in Italy! Must visit.
author: Mira H.

description:
So jealous of people who work in the FiDi because they're so close to this pizzeria/mozzarella bar!

Great service, great location to people-watch, tasty food. Highly recommend the burrata and the pizza crust. Even crust haters will like the crust. Self-pronounced cheese aficionados, you need to come here.

Tip: all pizzas are $10 Mon-Fri, 3-5pm. What a great deal!
author: Joanna J.

description: OK amazing pizza !what would make it 10 stars is if everything was organic and the music wasn't hideously loud and terrible‍ on a mission to try all the pizzas here in North Beach! Absolutely nothing like a woodfired pizza! Didn't  think I'd like the tuna pizza(here's a hint get it with a little spinach and if you like mushrooms great and add a pinch of spicy oil and oregano) but was pleasantly surprised can't beat the prices but disappointed with the ice cream selection come on guys what's with the soft servehelooooo-gelato !! OK waiting for my husband to finish his beer and just so bothered by this music though seriously they want to keep the vibe young and Poppish I guess?
author: Soph C.

description: I wish there were 6 stars! This place is amazing! Our waiter, Satya, was just so kind and thoughtful he got our order to perfection. All the food was just pure Italian deliciousness! Highly recommended. If you go there, get the mozzarella di bufala!
author: gabriella c.

description: Pizza was good but the egg that we had ordered for our pizza was completely undercooked. The egg white was still all jelly and completely raw. It was unacceptable and not safe to eat - we had to send it back. They made a new pizza for us but seemed to struggle with cooking the egg (again!) the second time also! The pizza crust was getting a bit brown and burned, any more and it wouldn't have been enjoyable. They said that the egg was fine when they delivered the second pizza even though there were still some obvious clear whites so we just pulled that off and set it aside. Seems like they can benefit from learning when to put the pizza into the oven if they need to add an egg on top.
author: Kim L.

description:
For those who gave this place 3 stars and below, it's because they appreciate traditional American style pizza. Thicker crust, slices in hand etc and there's nothing wrong with that, it's all personal preference.

After visiting Naples Italy my mind was blown by Napoli style pizza! The crust is soft and the tomato sauce is pure with so much flavor. In Naples, you eat with a fork and knife starting in the middle which is the best part. Il Casaro is as close as you can get to Napoli pizza.
author: Stacey P.

description:
It was a sunny and warm winters day in San Francisco. My wife and I were starving for pizza wandering around North Beach. As we were walking around our heads were bopping up and down as we scoured Yelp for a well-rated lunch place. But we were getting nowhere as everywhere was packed due to the beautiful weather, it being a long weekend and it was Valentines Day...

Then my wife said, how 'bout this place? Showing me Il Casaro, it was higher rated then any other place and only a short walk from the main drag of North Beach. To our surprise they had a few tables free and so we grabbed one next to the open window to the street with the sun shining through. The atmosphere was very laid back, lots of space between tables, a large wood fire pizza oven at the back and the Italian soccer playing on TV distracting the workers between orders.

We ordered the Diavola pizza and the Brocolli+Sausage pizza. They were amazing, the bread was nice and crisp, the toppings were simple but tasty, not too heavy, not too light. Plus the beers were cold.
author: Tristan L.

description:
I went here around a few months back from today. This was clearly terrible food.

For a gourmet place, it's bad, and I've been to italy and it tastes nothing like it.

There is zero flavor, and zero taste. The cheese tasted like spoiled, disgusting, vomit - and I'm not kidding, it tasted like vomit. Then the bread was absolutely plain but tasted cardboardy like the bread you get from a really cheap frozen pizza with absolutely plain sauce that had zero flavor.

The appetizers are not as bad, but they are definitely not above average in anyway. I think it rivals really if you cook these at home and anyone can easily grill their appetizers the same way.

Forget a gourmet taste, there's hardly a decent taste, and if you're looking for a good restaurant, keep looking.
author: James A.

description: Always great to get good pizza. In California its a ongoing challenge to find authentic pizza. In New York city its on everywhere,due to the large vibrant Italian communities. But Northern CA has its one gem for pizza, North Beach San Francisco. IL Casaro is in the big leagues. Small cozy shop, right on Columbus with great responsive service. An considering the competition no eatery could last there unless they deliver big time,and Casaro does just that. They have a wood brick oven that cooks the pizza to perfection. The cheese and sauce are fresh and balanced providing for a pizza delight.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I love this place. Literally out of the over 10 times I've been to or ordered from it's been perfect. The single time time I had an issue with my food order they were not only polite but corrected it immediately! I recommend this this restaurant all day every day. I rarely review but I have to applaud this restaurants amazing food, as well as customer service. I refuse to eat pizza anywhere else in SF. P.S. everything else is amazing too.
author: Courty R.

description: This place has the worst service! There were bugs crawling on the walls, it felt dirty. the food was burnt. No one checked on us after we got our food. The waiters stood around talking while we waited for someone to acknowledge us. The place had an overall bad vibe.
author: Amy B.

description: It was as if I traveled to Italy with the soccer on TV with Italian commentator and of course the tasty food. We got some prosciutto to start and the broccoli Italian sausage pizza after. Overall experience really good. Good service, nice smily waiter. I know where I will go for my pizza now.
author: Morea P.

description: Our wait was long but I'm guessing it was because we were a party of 5. We waited about 45 minutes, however the food and the service by "Red" was fantastic! The food came out soon after we ordered and it was all delicious! The service by our server could not be better!
author: D P.

description: This was my favorite pizza spot in sf because I reminded me of the amazingness that I had in Naples, Italy. Unfortunately my last experience here was by far the worst experience at a restaurant I have ever had, note that I was a waiter for 5 years a could never fathom treating a customer like this waiter treated me. I was seated by the host and told her that 2 friend from out of town were joining ( note the restaurant had at the time 5 tables open). The plan was to meet and eat there but unfortunately they were too hungry to wait until I got off work and arrive late and full. Already the waiter, who is always there, perhaps the manager, was irritated because they were late and didn't want to order. After 10 mi. A coworker of mine said he would join me and I let the waiter know he was coming. He rolled his eyes dramatically and later came back reprimanding me saying that this was not how the business was ran. That I shouldn't have sat down if my whole party was here and that someone can't just show up and order at a later time than the rest of the table. He was clearly angry and taking it out on me. I told him I could order for my friend who would arrive shortly and he answered rudely with a "fine! But this is not how we run our business, there are other people who need the table". I honestly regret even paying for my meal from how horribly I was treated, not to mention the embarrassment from his loud scorns  that the other tables heard. I had recommended this place to a bunch of friends and coworkers but now wont be back and will inform them of my experience. It was clearly about the money and that my other 2 friends didn't order. I can't believe I paid to be reprimanded.
author: Liliana A.

description: Best pizza place ever! I am a huge fan of Calzone pizza and they probably have the best in the city! I highly recommend this place. I found this place thanks to a food blogger in the city, and now I feel like everyone should know about this restaurant!! Their pizza taste like the one you can find in Europe, very authentic, very traditional! I recommend!
author: Looblue L.

description: Very fast pizza, less than 2 minutes to cook in the oven! And when they say fresh cheese, they mean it, there was a giant piece of cheese in the kitchen. Also love that the kitchen is completely open with the oven. It makes it amazing to see the pizza being made and to have it come to your table,. The pizza itself was great, but I came in for lunch by myself and it took a little bit of time for my server to come over even though it wasn't busy. Overall great experience and I would come back for sure.
author: Devika B.

description:
Fast service and good pizza, one of my favorites in San Francisco. Prices are a bit high but ingredients seem to be genuine. Go for lunch to avoid crowds.

I recommend the Prosciutto pizza asking to go easy with the Parmesan. The Bufalina is also quite good.
author: Alessio S.

description: Deliveries and food have gotten better...for now. Keeping my fingers crossed it stays that way!
author: Nora L.

description: This is my go to pizza place in the city! Way better than Tony's, the wait is never too long and the pizza is incredible. I try to restrain myself to go only once a week ;) !
author: Yansou G.

description: Their prosuccuto pizza is top notch. The best I have ever had. The cauliflower and Brussels sprouts appetizer is great too.
author: Ash M.

description: Not a place to go if you're really hungry. While the pizzas are certainly tasty - they're thin and tiny.  We left there hungry - and at the price we paid, that should not have been the case!  Also not the best place if you're claustrophobic - they squeeze as many people in there as they can - very little room to move once you're in your seat.
author: Chris H.

description: This is my favorite spot for italian food. The calzone is excellent and the pizzas are a legendary delicacy. You can have special drinks and a lot of fresh air. It is close to other places, too. These are my reasons for this to be my favorite italian spot.
author: Koko S.

description: The best Pizza in town! Feels good to know where to go when you want a real Italien pizza.
author: Anne P.

description: By far my FAVORITE pizza place in San Francisco. The prosciutto pizza is to die for, the staff is beyond nice, and the wine selection is great!
author: Allison S.

description: One of the best lasagnas I've had in San Francisco, highly recommend it!!! Very cozy place, kind staff and appealing menu.
author: Razvan B.

description: This Pizza is the best you can find in SF... ingredients truly make a difference on the final outcome. Don't take reservations so waiting time can go up to 30 minutes or they may rush dishes to the table (not fun!). Still my fav pizzeria in town
author: Serena P.

description: Awesome pizza.  Waitress was very attentive.  Meatball appetizers were also delicious.  Very lively atmosphere and popular place so expect a little wait.  Best to book a spot through Yelp.
author: Gerardo M.

description:
Ummm yes please! Server was legit Italiano, super friendly and kind and outgoing. 

We started with a half bottle of Prosecco. Perfectly bubbly , dry and not too sweet. We ordered 2 arancinis and 2 croquettes. The potatoe croquettes were delish, crispy on the outside with a spicy meat inside. 

Next we ordered the bufalina pizza and added sausage. We enjoyed watching the pizza man make the pizzas in the wood fired oven. Our pizza took about 3 mins and then handed over to us piping hot. The mozzarella was creamy and tasted great. The tomato sauce was bold and flavorful. Some of the reviews talk about the crust being soggy.... pick up a fork, start in the center and enjoy delicious pizza. This is authentic to Italy! 

We finished with a macchiato and cappuccino. After I gave my server a hard time about needing a creamy cappuccino, he asked me to trust him, (insert Italian accent here) "that I make it a thea Italiano way" Trusting him was best because it was the most creamy and bold cappuccino I've had! 

My husband and I enjoyed the service, atmosphere, food and experience. Hands down a great North Beach find!
author: Bree D.

description:
Best pizza in SF. 
I come here once a month. Love it again and again. Especially the "Il casaro" pizza and the delicious burrata!!!
author: J C.

description: Seriously. If I lived in San Francisco I would walk from one end of the city to this place just to eat here. Everything is stunning.
author: Eric B.

description: We brought our guests from Miami since they wanted Italian. Best pizza ever; thin &  crusty real Italian pizza! Everything we tried was so great; mozarella plate, pizza w/ eggplant, prosciutto pizza, etc. Wine was okay. Tiramisu and panna cota were great to end this incredible dinner. Service was great. We had a nice Turkish student serving us.
author: Merve A.

description: We selected this restaurant by accident when Tony's had an 2 1/2 hour wait and we were too hungry to wait.  We had a party of 8 and managed to try about 2/3 of the menu.  The mussels were good and the sauce they were served in was so delicious that we wouldn't let our server take it away until we had used bread to eat every last drop.  The prosciutto pizza was amazing!  Don't skip out on dessert, tiramisu wears good and the panda cotta was the best one I've ever had.  Avoid the dinner rush and go early or late, but don't miss this amazing place!!!  Can't wait to go back!
author: Chris A.

description:
Easy going Italian place in the center of North Beach. We tried 2 different pizzas - Buffalina and a made-to-order white pizza with prosciutto and burrata. Both were very good. The dough is soft and puffy in the extremities and thin in the middle. One of the best pizzas I had in San Francisco.

For dessert we had Panacotta but in my opinion that was just okay.

Will certainly come back for the pizza!!
author: Nuno S.

description: Really amazing pizza. Cozy and warm atmosphere. Service was a bit slow but not complaining with pizza like this.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Ate:

Norma (margherita with eggplant).  Classic wood-fired, brick-oven pizza.

Golden beat and frisee salad.  The dressing was lemony and very salty, but paired really well with the beats, goat cheese and walnuts.

Standout:

Calabrian pepperoncini.  Un-fucking-believably good.  These plump, little red hotties are served as an accompaniment in a little ramekin of oil.  I bit off the tip of my first, felt the heat... and then the flavor hit me.  Sweet, citrusy and warm.  By the end of my last bite of pizza, I'd finished all of them and was dipping the crust in the remaining oil.

Update (had additional items):

Roasted cauliflower:  they fire these up in the oven with olive oil, capers and a few pepperoncini.  Need you ask?  Of course they were... delicious!

Calamari and zucchini:  tender and juicy squid bites, threaded onto skewers with roasted vegetables, drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with plenty of salt and pepper.  Simplicity and perfection!

Panna cotta:  wow, get it.
author: Sondra H.

description:
This place has it all - location, service, look & feel of the interior, and quality of Neapolitan pizza. This is among the best of its kind in the Bay Area. 

VPN pizza certification hounds - Il Casaro is not yet VPN certified but could be. Caputo 00 flour, hand stretched dough never tossed, and wood burning oven. The pizza is on a par with their competitor 'Mozzeria' in SF but the vibe, location and design inside beats Mozzeria for the feeling you're looking for on a 'night out for dinner'. 

Buffala Mozzerela & Fior de latte + charcuterie options for appetizers. 

Neapolitan heads, come here!
author: David J.

description: The food here is DELICIOUS and the service is excellent. My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on a Saturday, and Il Casaro was more than worth our time and money. The Insalata Romana is such a simple but tasty dish, with perfectly toasted pine nuts and the right balance of lemon, olive oil and pepper. We shared a slice of the lasagna, which offered a delicious blend of tomatoes, spices and meat. Our final main dish was the Calabrese pizza - very yummy, except the sausage was a little too spicy for me. To cool my mouth, I ended the meal with their soft serve ice cream topped with caramel sauce. I loved every bite. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Melanie N.

description:
Service: In the negatives. Marco D. (our waiter) was extraordinarily rude. He mocked my mom to her face and the whole table, in her accent, when he couldn't understand her order. He then snapped at the other adults at the table on multiple occasions. I've never been this shocked at behavior from wait staff. He went as far as to intentionally spill water on the table, when we confronted him about speaking rudely to someone whose accent he didn't initially understand. I strongly recommend that a quality restaurant cleans up its act by replacing careless, rude and lazy waiters, with people qualified to work at their restaurant. 

Food: While the pictures online look incredible, the pizza was served 30 minutes after it came out of the oven - good ingredients but for having the oven right there, it came out soggy and cold - probably more a result of our inattentive waiter than the cooking.
author: Amit A.

description: To be honest they have good food, I just don't like the fact that they charge me 18 dollars for service. Like they don't have a sing saying they will charge us for service. But food is good.
author: Fernando G.

description:
Just had the Americano coffee.
Very tasty and really close to perfect afaiac.

I'd highly recommend. Hard to find it as well done as here.
author: tony z.

description:
There's nothing worse than a limp, flaccid...

Pizza.

Am I right, ladies? And gentlemen. 

What did you think I was going to say? Pervs. 

I visit North Beach as much as I visit my dentist...which is never. Both are pain in the ass for different reasons. Tater Tot had a grooming appointment in North Beach so what better way to kill time than to knock off some of my North Beach bookmarks.

I've had II Casaro bookmarked since they opened in early 2014 so I was super ecstatic to finally pay a visit especially with all the glowing reviews. However, after our visit, I was scratching my head as to where all these glowing reviews are coming from (mainly from tourists). I held off on writing my review in the event our experience was an off day. With some recent bad reviews, our experience is unlikely a fluke so here we go...

Sorry folks, this is another overrated North Beach restaurant for tourists. Their current 76/100 health score is a bit scary as well especially with an open kitchen. 

II Casaro's menu: Antipasti (fried cheese, meatballs, aracini), Mozzarella Bar, Salumi (prosciutto, spicy coppa, mortadella), Piatti (tagliatelle, spaghetti, lasagna, gnocchi), and Pizzas (12+ options). Prices are really reasonable for this touristy area with mains in the $14-$16 range. Reservations accepted. 

We started with the Imported Burrata & Proscuitto San Daniele ($7.75, $8): http://bit.ly/1MKvxPt. The burrata was hands down the best I've had. It was deliciously milky and soft with a tinge of sea salt and pepper to make it pop. I could eat this all day with the accompanying flatbread. I'm totally lactose intolerant (and had no lactaid) which made for a fun ride home with my dining companion. *emoji with medical mask* The prosciutto was ehhh; very salty and very lean.

If you're looking for deliciously tender balls, look elsewhere. The Polpette Al Sugo: Ground Beef Meatballs, Napoleon Sugo ($7): http://bit.ly/1IVSejR was by far the worst meatballs I've had. They were hard, dense, and clearly overworked. I've had better balls at Buca Di Beppo which is pretty sad. Best meatballs ever can be found nearby at Tosca Café. It's $4 for a tiny golf ball sized meatball but they're life changing. 

The biggest disappointment of the night was the pizza. We shared the Broccoli + Salsiccia: Scamorza Cheese, Broccoli Rabe, Italian Sausage ($16.50 + $4 egg): http://bit.ly/1DnpfU1. The pizza was amazing to look at with its alluring leopard spots but it seriously made me want to cry. As soon as I picked up a slice, all the toppings slid off to reveal a bottom crust drenched in liquid. Now, I know Neapolitan pizzas are supposed to be a little soggy in the center but the center was like a wet sponge. We had to tear off the center crust and just eat the outer crust. The sausage was flavorless and very dry (tasted like turkey sausage) while the broccoli rabe was very bitter. Not a good combo. Who doesn't love a little egg porn? Well, there was egg porn in all its glory but the egg white was still translucent and raw (when you cut it). The menu stated it was $3 for "eggs" but we were charged $4 for one egg. WTF. 

Our waitress was really nice which was redeeming and it wasn't crowded so we got our food rather quickly. For the hour we were there, the owner or manager (?) was sitting at one of the four top tables in front on his ipad and talking on his cellphone. This was rather unprofessional. 

We went on a Saturday and reservations were not needed as it wasn't even busy. When we left during peak dinner time, it was less than 1/4th filled with tourists. Plenty of seating (high tops) for larger groups.

Sorry II Casaro, I just wasn't feeling you...even after several drinks at The Boardroom. Maybe, Mr. Viagra can help ya.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
A M A Z I N G. This place is soooo good. We had 2 pizzas and both were incredible. The place is cute and remodeled from the Steps of Rome days. The waiters were very kind and friendly. 
I think I have found our go to place for pizza. Highly recommend them if you are in SF.
author: Kimia R.

description: The pizza is great and certainly tasty. And they serve it fast. But the atmosphere isn't great. As soon as we were done eating the almost claimed our table to rush in new guest. Not a great experienced.
author: Sisse L.

description:
WOW, just WOW! I have been here 3 times in the last couple of months and can confirm, it is not a fluke... this is the best pizza I have had outside Italy itself!! First of all, there is never a long wait, 10 minutes tops (I'm looking at you Tony's... 2 hours!). Second, the space is big and they even have an open kitchen. You can see the chefs cooking over stone oven they imported from Naples. Finally, the food!! My absolute favorite is the Proscuitto Pizza. The prosciutto melts in your mouth and the mozzarella cheese is sliced thinly to perfection generously all over the pizza. Notable mentions: the Diavola pizza + sausage, aranicini balls, and Tagliatelle. 

You have to try it!
author: Jane H.

description:
Burrata is really good. Their pizzas are yummy as long as the delivery isn't messed up.   

 Tip: Don't order food from here for delivery!
author: Elizabeth A.

description: First off id like to say that I'm from Sorrento which is 1 hour away from Naples (pizza capital of the world).  I've lived in l.a. most of my life and I recently moved to sf, I stumbled upon this place and I decided to give it a try (btw I'm very judgemental when it comes to italian food).  Everyone there spoke italian which was very refreshing and the pizza was great, definitely the classic Neapolitan pizza. Certainly is not quite the same as one from Naples , but as close as it gets and I was more than satisfied with it, they use fresh fior di latte on their pizzas which to me is the most awesome part.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
I can't tell if their pizza was good....

 or if it was because I was a hangry bear by the time we got our food because we waited an HOUR AND FIFTEEN minutes before we got any food. I've waited long for food (Paxti's for example also take an hour, but they tell you ahead of time), but my biggest gripe was they didn't warn us or let us know that it was going to take awhile because their kitchen was backed up. We were excited because we came in at 8 and no wait.  Our saga began...

10 min: It started in the beginning when we noticed our waitress taking orders first from other tables that came in much after us.  

40 minutes: she apologizes to a different table how their pizza is taking a long time. We flag her down to make sure that our order is actually in, as now we're also getting concerned- she assures us that the kitchen is just back logged.  

1 hr mark: We watch other tables around us who came in after us get their pizzas as we are slowly withering away from lack of food. An hour after sitting in the restaurant, we ask again as now we're pretty concerned our order was forgotten.  Boyfriend is seething and asks me if we should just leave the restaurant.

1 hr 15 min: we finally get our pizza. It's decent but not as mind blowing as I made it out to be after watching maybe 20 pies go by.

1 hr. 30 min: We gobble down the pizza in 15 minutes and leave

I get that you're back logged and short staffed, but let us know so that we can order other things in the meantime. Also, keep your orders in order. It's infuriating when you see people who came in way before you get served first.  We won't be coming back here.
author: Jenny C.

description: This the best Pizza in SF by a country mile! The staff are amazing too! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!
author: Marc G.

description: I went with colleagues to get them to try the (water)buffalo mozzarella. We tried fiordilatte, burrata and buffalo, plus a few pizzas. Definitely good quality, I'll be back. The (Italian) waitress was overdoing the gesturing. Had she been in Italy, it would have been outright rude; but seeing her trying to impress the local and touristy groups with the most stereotyped and overhyped movements was quite amusing.
author: Riccardo F.

description: One of the best if not the best pizza place in San Francisco. Can't wait to make it back to this place again
author: Luis T.

description: This is the best pizza in San Francisco, and much cheaper than Tony's, which is the second best. The pizza are cooked in a fire owen and you can watch them cook if you sit at the bar. I recommend the margarita or the diavola.
author: Tony A.

description: We were hungry for pizza. Casaro was across the street. Whow! What a find. We'll go back.
author: Ken I.

description:
This is the best pizza I've ever had!!!!!!!! I had the Diavola and the II Casaro. Also, try the mozzarella burrata and calamari skewers. They will not disappoint!

If you're with a large group be sure to make a reservation. The place isn't that big on the inside, but definitely worth the wait.
author: Jody J.

description:
TL;DR:

For the love of tastebuds, have I not been transported to Napoli itself with these familiar flavors!? Yes, brethren & sisters, I've been to the Old Country and supped at its greatest pie houses. This is an experience not less glorious.

THE DEETS:

***IMPORTED BURRATA

Though many a burrata have I ravaged, I do declare that never until today have I experienced burrata as it was truly intended. This celestial dairy must have poured forth from the most holy of golden calves, hand-fed the hand-manicured artisanal grass of an immortal world. The milk & cream from this cow are superior to all before it, and the cheese-making methods employed here are esoteric & second to none. There is no toughness, only gooey joy. When you bite in, the fresh panna flows forth as a divine gift.

The bread strips served with this dish were magnificently charred, soft as silk, and drizzled with potent premium olive oil (no canola blend detected). With it was a simple arugula & grape tomato salad, which masterfully satisfied the need for complexity by offering bitter & sweet notes.

I'd come back for this dish alone.

***DIAVOLA PIZZA - Mozzarella, tomato sauce, spicy salami

I've searched high & low for true Napoli pizza on this continent and have not once found crust so beautifully charred and yet perfectly supple. Surely a sign of doppio zero flour. It was so soft that you could roll it up and wipe your face with it. The sauce was infinitely light & as delicately fruity as can be, enabling you to eat slice after slice without being bogged down by the slightest shadow of heaviness. The fact that they stuck "Mozzarella Bar" as part of the establishment's name corroborates my experience--these were sinfully moist, meaty, & yet somehow light chunks of moo product. And yes, the crucial basil centerpiece was equally toasted & wilted as is the divine degree.

The soft red chillies & spicy salami was a lovely treat, providing just enough heat & flavor without overwhelming the batch. 

***PROSCIUTTO PIZZA - San Daniele prosciutto, arugula, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese

The crust, sauce, & mozzarella were just as meticulous & present as the last pizza; in addition, this pie was topped with delicious prosciutto, arugula, & raspadura shavings. The prosciutto provided a luxuriously moist layer, while the arugula offered some pleasant bitter contrast. The raspadura, while extremely fresh and flavorful, was in my opinion slightly excessive due to the dry nature of the cheese and the copious amounts that had to be consumed to get to the pizza below. Still, if generosity was their fault, the quality of the ingredients made this more than forgivable.

***PANNA COTTA with raspberry sauce

I've had more panna cotta than I can recall, but the consistency of this product (as had become a theme throughout the meal with each additional dairy offering) was much more refined & dare-I-say velvetier that anything I'd previously encountered. It was truly a cream-filled delight, finished gracefully with fresh vanilla bean seeds & tangy raspberry purée.
__

Just remember, you're very welcome.
author: Elliott D.

description: We were  craving pizza during our last evening visiting SF and found this place online and decided to give it a try. The Brussels sprouts with pine nuts were to die for and the pizza with fried eggplant was one of the best meals I had during the trip. The server was a delight to talk to and gave us an excellent wine recommendation that we enjoyed. The food came out fast and fresh. I would highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Amanda M.

description:
I'm sure this would have gotten a 1 star had we not been famished prior to arriving here.  We came because of all the good reviews and it tooled like a place that wasn't going to make us sick, that is tbd.

The restaurant itself is cute, prices aren't that bad for being San Francisco, and the menu isn't huge. Our server started out friendly when we came in, but as soon as I told her that our pizza was a little under done and asked if the toppings always fall off their pizzas, she was no longer so friendly. I did explain that I work in a pizzeria and we do Neapolitan style pizzas too, but that didn't matter. The other server with the pretty eyes and "retro" style was really nice. 

When our pizzas came out, they looked pretty good, but while trying to get a slice of it...not so much.
We also got a side of the marinara because I wasn't sure if one of the kids would eat the Quattro formaggi without sauce and it tasted like they just straight dumped it out of the can and put it on the pizza, hardly any flavor except what the canning company did. I'm sure with as big as San Fran is there are plenty of better places to get a pizza.
author: M G.

description: Their pizza is legit. The doe tastes like authentic Italian ingredients. Highly recommend the Margherita.
author: Stephen C.

description:
TL;DR - Another little gem in SF!

Great food without any pretentious vibes! The only reason this was 4 stars and not 5 was because of the layout. There is only one restroom for the ENTIRE restaurant. Meh. I just needed to wash my hands and waiting for the person in the restroom was no fun. Also, they have some wobbly tables! A lot of the wooden table bottoms were Macgyver-ed into being stable with help from paper napkins. Yikes.

Now, the food!

Lasagna - Yum yum! I love how it was cooked well and well seasoned. Its good, but nothing to write home about. It came out kinda.... lukewarm? But then again maybe it was just the cold of SF haha.
Mozzarella di bufala pizza - WOW. I love the thin thin thinnn crust and the simple but tasty flavors. I wasn't a fan of the over-char on the crust, but I guess that can't be avoided. Haha.

Overall, I'd be back, but not before I check out all the other gems in North Beach.
author: Crystal Z.

description: Yum!  Really friendly wait staff and amazing pizza.  Try to grab a seat at the pizza bar area and watch them make the pizzas, although beware you will be really warm!
author: Stacy C.

description:
Wow, what a pizza! They managed to tick every category:
- Fresh ingredients and pizza made from scratch
- Cue little wood-fired oven
- Amazing toppings and combinations
- Soft pillowy dough that will dazzle any pizza lover
- Crispy fresh-from-the-oven crust
- And the cheese. Oh the cheese. Perfect on the pizza or as a mozzarella side dish

Will come here again (and again). 

---

Distinguishing factor: Super cute North Beach pizzeria that showcases their amazing oven in the middle of the store. And they've earned the bragging rights.

Note: they're not the best with delivery (slow and the pizza doesn't keep well), so stick to dining in.
author: Nick A.

description: The Pizza!  I went here before taking out of town visitors to Beach Blanket Babylon.  This is one of the best pizzas I have ever had and that includes multiple visits to Italy.  It was cooked perfectly, the dough was just right, the sauce delicious, not too much cheese - gooey, yummy, pizza perfection!  The service was great too, I will definitely be back.
author: Cari N.

description:
Pizza: Delicious. Good portion size. Had a good amount of that wood oven burnt taste (I mean this in a good way completely). Worth checking out for this alone

Service: A little slow (they seemed short staffed)

Drink prices: Higher than average

Ambiance: Cool spot, the tables are a bit too close together. The pizza oven looks like a red helmet which is cool.
author: Rob K.

description:
Il Casaro is modern, trendy, and authentically Italian at the same time. Great for dates or just a fun dinner too. You won't miss the flashy red retro wood-fired oven as you walk into the restaurant and you'll also appreciate how cutlery/napkins are placed inside of kitschy tomato paste cans. Snaps for being so hip. 

My friend and I were just walking around North Beach and decided to stop by because the menu looked a bit different from the other more traditional Italian eateries that line up Columbus and Grant. 

We split a 'Norma' between the two of us (Mozzarella, San Marzano tomato, Ricotta salata, fried eggplant) with mushroom added on one half and sausage on the other half. The pizza was absolutely delicious; each ingredient was so fresh and robust. They keep their pizzas pretty simple (maybe a little too sparse) for the most part so you know that whatever IS on it is of highest quality. My only qualm is that the sausage was not evenly added (spilled over to the other half of the pizza) so my vegetarian friend had less pizza slices to eat than I did. 

I'll be coming back here to try the Broccoli & Salsiccia and Capricciosa. A nice change from the really heavy pan-crust pies that are drowning in shredded moz and commercial pepperoni :P
author: Arushi S.

description: We stopped at several pizza restaurants and picked Il Castro. What a wonderful decision. It was spectacular. True Southern Italy pizza that melted in your mouth. The burrata was my favorite. I could have it daily.  The dressing on the Caesar salad tasted outstanding. The carbonara pasta was salty, savory and a true treat. I can't wait to go back.
author: Audrey M.

description: Nothing but great things to say about this place. Came on Tuesday afternoon with my dad, who was visiting. The menu is fairly small but great. We ordered 2 beers, the grilled cauliflower, beet salad and sampler mozzarella plate to start off and let me tell you it was heaven. Then we ordered the Capricciosa pizza but substituted the prosciutto for the salami and substituted the black olives for the green olives. It was incredible. Very friendly staff, good service (could have been a little better but there were only 2 servers so it is understandable why the service wasn't the fastest). Loved this place, maybe the best pizza I've ever had. We also got the tiramisu and the strawberry gelato which was delicious too. will definitely be back
author: Ilana B.

description:
This place has THE BEST Neapolitan pizza. Whenever I visit SF, this place will be my must-go.

Tania was fantastic, the chefs are amazing, the place is cute as a button. Reasonably priced, and the pizza came out quickly and it was PERFECT. I love this place so much! I wish I lived closer I could come here every week!
author: Jen W.

description:
One of the best rated pizzeria in SF.  

I am staying in the Russian Hill area, little Italy with Chinatown adjacent to each other, with Beatnik vibes and titty bars.  Culinary wonderland all within walking distance. 

So I at the pizza.  One of the best pizzas I've ever had...seriously. ..in my life.  I am not sure if it was because of the marathon that made my taste buds extra sensitive to these flavors so I'll need to revisit this.
author: robert s.

description:
Finally got around to reviewing this place, which has my favorite pizza in San Francisco and quite possibly anywhere. It's authentic and Italian run and while the decor isn't much to look at, the food more than makes up for it. You really have to try it. It's just that good. 

Here's what I love to order:

Get a margherita and add prosciutto, black olives, and raspa dura. The result is somehow sweet and salty and savory and utterly delicious.

I've come here more than any other restaurant since I've come to the city and I always enjoy it. They treat their customers right and the food is amazing. You really should come here- or don't, the lines are long enough on busy nights already!
author: Lexi Autumn M.

description:
I'm from Italy and I've been living in the States for one year and a half. Needless to say, I really miss authentic Italian food out here and it's extremely hard to find good Italian restaurants. You'll not go wrong with Il Casaro though. I've been here three times now and it became my favorite pizza place in the Bay area. Since I crave pizza all the time I only got pizza there, but I can tell you it's exactly how we have it in Italy: light and delicious.

i also loved the fact that the staff is actually from Italy, and I got to talk with the waitress in Italian, which was pretty awesome and unexpected. 

I'm honestly taking all my friends one by one to this restaurant because it's simply the best. The wait might be a little long during rush hours due to the limited seating, but the max I've ever waited was probably 30 minutes at 7pm on a Saturday night, which makes sense since every single restaurant in the city is packed at that time.

Go there!! You won't regret it!!
author: Valentina C.

description: They had the best margherita pizza here! My husband loved the lasagna. Can't wait to go back!
author: Susan D.

description: We dined here last weekend after Benjamin F. and I had a lengthy discussion about the best pizza in the city, and this place doesn't disappoint. We made a last minute reservation for 9:30pm and were happily surprised when we arrived at 9:00 and were seated almost immediately, even though they were running a wait. We enjoyed the Diavola pizza and lasagna - both were very tasty. The crust definitely had some intentional char, a little too much for my taste but still the perfect chewy texture I look for in a Neapolitan pizza. My favorite pizza still belongs to Spin in Kansas City, but since I won't be getting pizza from there too often, this will be a great stand in. There's a fun create your own ice cream sandwich shop across the street if you want a sweet ending to your meal!
author: Kendra N.

description:
This place is a wonderful new Italian place, with fresh, flaky pizza and savory, melting mozzerellas.

Do not leave here without trying a pizza, at the least. Their fabulous tile oven is such a treat and i really enjoyed watching the chefs make pizza while sitting at the bar.

This place is such a refreshing take on the North Beach Italian scene, where restaurants can be stuffy, old (though still delicious). This place really feels like a modern Italy, complete with servers dashing outside to catch a cigarette! Molte bene! ...My Italian isn't fabulous
author: Kerry G.

description:
Like someone else here already said: if the name is crust, it should be crunchy, crispy, etc...
Hers, at least was a "hot air balloon" while mine was pure RAW style and very mushy dough.
I confess the pizza looked and tasted really good. I guess the ingredients used are top of the line.
But I got very disappointed when I went straight to the "crust" and couldn't find a way to pull apart one slice. Felt just like INSIDE an [american (not crispy) french bread].

I told the waitress and she said it is how they do it in Napoli. Raw doughy crust??? Really? I highly doubt it...
I could even gather the dough and make little balls! And perhaps prepare another pizza with it...
author: Marco V.

description: Best pizza I've had in my life! The meatballs are amazing and the panna cotta is so delicious! Thank you to our lyft driver who recommended this spot
author: Jorge S.

description: I had the olives, an excellent red wine with a touch of spiciness (Nero Davola), and the Bufalina. All superb ingredients. My pizza, however, was just slightly underdone.
author: Aaron B.

description: Best pizza in NB.  You won't be disappointed!
author: Josh P.

description:
Nice server.
Good service.
Deep fried mozzarella was to die for. 10 out of 10.
Very yummy pizzas with good flavors.
But a bit of a soggy bottom under the crust. #GreatBritishBakeOff #ButNotKidding
author: Michail Y.

description:
They really know how to make an authentic pizza and how to serve a cold cold beer!!!
Service was impeccable and they spoke italian ; )
Going back this weekend to try more goodies even though I'm kinda hook on their Prosciutto Pizza.
author: L. R.

description:
I've come here a couple times now. We'd just come back from a trip to Italy and were hankering for some solid Italian-style pizza. This place doesn't disappoint. 

We ordered the Imported Burrata, the Gnocchi, the Margherita, Quattro Formaggi, and the Capricciosa pizzas. Hard to pick a favorite pizza, but we really enjoyed the Quattro Formaggi. Burrata was fantastic, the gnocchi melted in your mouth.

Service is good and prices are fair, the host of the restaurant is very nice. However, the thing that stands out is the food, particularly the pizza. i'll come back often.
author: Russ N.

description:
Delicious! They have amazing mozzarella choices! Perfect crust and the sauce is to die for. Highly recommend. Friendly staff and an open and clean atmosphere. 

Next time I'm in the neighborhood I'll absolutely swing by. Five stars all around. Thanks for a great experience.
author: Kate C.

description: Burrata was to die for; good music playing; lively; intimate.
author: Brandon W.

description: Ok there are a LOT of choices when it come to Italian dining in North Beach! For me the best option for the real deal Nepalese food you should try Il Casaro. Its not fancy however the servers add a ton of charm. Its a SF must visit for me.
author: Brook M.

description: Really fun place to come sit at the bar, order a pizza to share, have some wine, and watch them turn out delicious pies. Good sides (cauliflower and olives) too.
author: Rachel D.

description: The pizza was amazing and the service was fantastic as well!!!  Just moved to SF and this will be our go to pizza place in the city!!  Can't wait to try everything on the menu.  See you all soon!!!
author: Lisa I.

description: I loved this place!! From the interior to the service to the awesome food. The pizzas here are so good and it seems very authentic. My group and I ordered the Prosciutto, Diavolo, and Margherita. They were all very good. My personal favorite was the Diavolo!! We also tried the Carbonara pasta and it was also really delicious. Usually whenever I order carbonara pastas they are usually just super heavy and creamy, but this one was perfect. I'm already craving this place again. I highly recommend coming here!
author: Priscilla C.

description: The best margarita pizza I've ever had and fantastic service and wine. I love this place and wouldn't go anywhere else for pizza in North Beach.
author: Eater S.

description:
My favorite wood fire pizza place in North Beach. It use to be a local spot but now everyone is catching on how fab it is...which is great for them but a bummer for the locals. 

Their pizzas are thin crust, fresh ingredients and quick out of the oven.  You can basically eat your own pizza it's that thin. 

Try the burrata plate, and roasted cauliflower app. And make your calzone is probably my favorite. Huge!!

Cons- long wait and they don't take reservations.
author: Kerry C.

description:
We ordered some pizza.  Love the crust!  Even on the sides, it's fluffy, moist, has a perfect chew but not chewy, and tasty!    It was a bit soggy in the middle, probably because of the mushrooms..
There was slight char, but didn't make the whole pizza taste burnt.
Yum!
author: Carson L.

description: Dario is phenomenal. Great service and wonderful personality.  He gave us suggestions for things we had not considered before and was spot on.  Now, onto the pizza...Wow.  Authentic, unique and awesome. This will be a place we come back to San Fran for.
author: Cory C.

description: This place came recommended from a local and we are so glad were glad we went! Food was great, tasted very authentic, and the service was top notch! We were not sure what to get so we took the recommendations of the waiter and the things we ate were delicious! Just go in and ask the waiters what they think is best and you won't be sorry!
author: Brandon B.

description: Got the lasagna and bufalina pizza to share, both great! House prosecco was also very good. Very bus but don't be deterred, there were seats at the bar. Friendly waiter
author: Chloé R.

description: The pizza was great, the salad was interesting. The overall ambience was great and the location perfect. The pizza was as good as I had in Italy.
author: Ankit D.

description:
Bravi, complimenti !!!
This place is awesome, the real deal. On top of that, service is impeccable. My compliments!
author: Rick M.

description:
Definitely one of the best pizzas in the city ... But not the best.

Loved the Prosciutto pizza as well as the Diavlo. Next time I'll try the Bufalina ... Yes, it was good enough that I'll be back.

The glass of Sangiovese was quite good for $9. 

The buffalo mozzarella was ok. Not sure why people have been raving about it. Good, but not great.

Ambience is good as long as you can tolerate tourists all over the place:(

Definitely worth a try.
author: Ankur V.

description:
My wife and I visited Il Casaro for an early dinner on a weeknight.  The place isn't fancy, but was very clean.

We ordered a mozzarella appetizer and a pizza.  The mozzarella was fresh and tasty, and the pizza was good, but not great.  Perhaps because we were in Little Italy, we were expecting just a bit more from the pizza.  We found the crust to be a bit too fluffy for our liking and the sauce could have been a bit spicier.  The ingredients were extremely fresh, however, and the cheese plentiful and gooey.

The service was friendly, and the place had a vibe like it was family owned and operated.  We could have received a little more attention from our server, but we didn't feel at all like we were being neglected.  

Il Casaro is a good choice if you are looking for a nice place to dine in Little Italy.  The prices are good, the food fresh and authentic, and the service good.  A solid three stars.
author: Michael S.

description:
One of the worst pizza's I have ever eaten. Ordered the Capricosa which was a huge disappointment, the pizza arrive not just soggy but wet, could not lift a slice up without all the pizza toppings falling off, even the cheese slide off the crust. Also tried the Cavolfiori which was decent but very oily, and could have used more capers to balance the dish. 

Service was lack luster, but given it was a busy Friday night can't really doc too many points for that. 

Perhaps we ordered the wrong dishes, but not sure I would spend the $ to try this place again.
author: Andrea Z.

description:
Since New York, this place can contend for the best margherita. 

After a 2-week pizza hunt in NYC in which I tried over 20 pizzas... Il Casarro is San Francisco's main contender. 

The pizzaiolo is Salvatore Di Stefano, who trained under THE "TONY GEMIGNANI" of Tony's in North Beach. 

But here's the thing. Tony's is not what it used to be. I gave it 3 chances. Each was a flop for the margherita. Especially having tried the best of NY's neapolitan styles, Tony's could not compare. In fact, I can tell if it'll be good the moment I pick up the slice (yes, I eat my neapolitan style with my hands sometimes. I like to appreciate the dough and feel it... and tear the crust to dip into the sauce on the plate) 

At Tony's, I'm bored after the first slice. At Una Pizza Nepoletana, it's better than Tony's, as I could enjoy it to the last slice. But it was still lacking. Both Tony's and Una Pizza have too much blistering on the crust for my taste. 

But finally, I found Il Casarro. Best in town. Hands down. The moment I pick up the first slice each and every time, I know it's good. I know it's properly made. I know the crust is just right, not too burnt and not too plain. It's just right. the blistering ratio is spot on. 

I've brought many people to this establishment and they all LOVE it. 

Oh the burrata is pretty good too.
author: Gregory F.

description:
The entire staff at Il Casero was so accommodating, friendly and wonderful! They held a group of 20 of my friends for a birthday dinner. I let them know beforehand that I needed to be somewhere by 7 PM and we arrived at 5 PM and they made it happen no questions asked. Great service, kind and friendly staff and AMAZING DELICIOUS PIZZA! 

Highly recommend this great place in SF!
author: Lauren C.

description: Excellent!  Reminds me of pizza places I've been to in Italy.  Francesco, the owner, is very personable, friendly, and knows his stuff.  Definitely recommend this place!
author: Heather C.

description: Had the burrata and the prosciutto pizza. Both were fantastic. If I lived closer, I'd eat this meal daily. Hands down best pizza I've had in this city and probably best burrata ever.
author: Tish M.

description:
I am a San Francisco native recently retired and work part time as a delivery person for Caviar for extra cash. Recently, I accepted a Caviar delivery order for Il Casaro on a Monday night.  Legal parking is extremely difficult in North Beach.  Since my app said the order was ready, I parked illegally expecting to pick up the order immediately.  The waiter told me it was almost ready and they they were "working on" my order.  They kept me waiting for about 20 minutes while I was parked illegally.  I asked three times how long I needed to wait. The only answer they would give me is they were "working on it". Around that time I noticed a traffic officer writing parking tickets across the street.  Since the restaurant refused to me give a direct answer about how long I needed to wait, I decided to have my delivery reassigned and move my car to not risk receiving a parking ticket. I immediately informed the Caviar Dispatcher and expected the delivery order to simply be given to another driver. Instead, I was deauthorized for three days without any recourse until the Caviar office contacted me. I lost three days worth of income.

Apparently, the restaurant told the dispatcher that they told me the order had been ready for five minutes before I left. THEY ARE LYING!!!  It doesn't even make sense that they would tell me an order was ready and that I would THEN wait ANOTHER five minutes (after waiting for 15-20 minutes already), while I am anxious to avoid a parking ticket, and then leave WITHOUT the order!  That scenario strains credibility. 

The restaurant, Il Casaro, somehow screwed up the order and refused to tell me when it would be ready.  Then, to further cover up their mistake, they blatantly LIED to my dispatcher with the consequence that I was unable to earn an income for three days. That is an extremely crappy way to treat ANYONE who is dealing with any business or restaurant. I recommend that no one patronize this restaurant that I had never heard of before and instead go to any of a dozen or two excellent Italian Restaurants within a couple of blocks of Vallejo and Columbus. Il Casaro is in a space that used to be called the MDR Cafe (Minimum Daily Requirement) where I used to hang out in the 60s when I was in High School (Galileo). I grew up a few blocks away and worked for many years in the neighborhood and have never encountered treatment like this in any North Beach establishment.
author: Alexander S.

description:
I'm not a typical "pizza person" but I love a thin crust Italian pizza. This place is my favorite pizza place in sf so far.

The prosciutto pizza was amazing.

Burrata from the mozzarella bar was to die for. 

Affogato was such a good end to a perfect meal.

Wine was relatively cheap as well!
author: Ann B.

description: Awesome pizza and a great atmosphere.  Authentic and really fresh ingredients.  Crust was perfect
author: Tom O.

description:
This place is a neighborhood gem. The people were friendly. Food was amazing and the atmosphere great. We sat at the bar were we watched the dough being pulled, the Parmesan shaved and the prosciutto thinly sliced. 

We had the mussels, burrata salad, and olive cesaro pizza. All were fantastic.  We will definitely return.
author: Adrienne P.

description: i would eat here for the hot pepper condiment alone, but throw in the pizza and the cauliflower dish, ii'm hooked.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I've heard much about the food at Il Casaro; most notably the burrata & pizza being outstanding.

My first attempt to dine here was about 6 months ago.  Went by early on a weeknight to check out the menu & the space.  Problem was the lighting.  It was so bright that I said pass.  I do not want to sit down for dinner in a place that's lit like Walgreen's.  

I guess they heard me, because they've fixed that.  The lighting is dim & inviting.  Win.

Our picks...
The meatballs.  The burrata.  The diavola pizza.

The meatballs.  2 & 1/2 stars.  The sauce was zesty & flavorful, but the meatballs were very dry.  Pass.

The burrata.  5 stars!  Imported from Italy every week.  It was creamy divineness.  The dressed arugula it's partnered with was delicious.  Full of flavor.  Simply perfect.  Win.

The diavola pizza.  2 & 1/2 stars.  A spicy pie, thanks to the addition of chili oil.  Sauce & flavors on point, but the crust was majorly soggy.  This really surprised me considering all of the stellar reviews.  With an appropriately crisp crust, this pie would be outstanding.

Our server was delightful.  Personable & warm.  Win.

A great casual neighborhood spot.  

3 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: The pizza was delicious, as was our side order of grilled asparagus. However I wouldn't order the asparagus again because the portion was so tiny for the price charged.  We were the only ones in the restaurant when they opened for lunch.  Our server was definitely not focused on anything we spoke about. We needed to request that he bring our beverages because they never came to the table.  We ordered the cauliflower and that never showed up. Our pizza was supposed to have peppers on it but there were none. So overall, the rating is for the delicious pizza only.
author: Lilikoikitchen M.

description: My boyfriend and I were in San Fran for a few days and walked around north beach looking for some good Italian. It was a Wednesday evening and we walked past several places which were partially full and then came across Il Casaro which was packed. The majority of people seemed to be locals so we went for it. We ordered the tagliatelle and Il Casaro pizza. They were both amazing. The tagliatelle was made in a fresh tomato sauce with perfectly braised Pork belly. The pasta was incredibly fresh. The pizza was also perfect. The crust was coal fired to perfection and the cheese, prosciutto and mushrooms complemented each other very well. Our service was mostly ok but our waitress could have checked on us a few more times. Other than that I would totally recommend this north beach gem!
author: Alexa P.

description: The service and meal was fantastic. I got a fantastic diavola pizza with some of the mozerrella starters. Pricing was amazing. Nice Italian wine with a pizza and some starters came out to be a nice and not too filling meal. Best pizza ever
author: Vivek P.

description: had to try some san fran pizza and decided on here due to yelp reviews over others in the area. plus I hate places that take cash only! this place doesn't so yay. had the 4 cheese pizza and if I hadn't eaten the delicious buratta before I would have enjoyed it more lol. my hubs loved it and still is talking about it days later....
author: Crystal P.

description: We love trying new places, especially places that have margarita pizza. Their Bufalina pizza was as authentic and tasty, from the crust to the sauce to the cheese.  We also had the beet salad; it was crisp and refreshing, on a beautiful warm day. We have found a new favorite in our favorite city!
author: Melissa L.

description: Extremely authentic woodfired pizza. Range of small vegetable dishes and a few other simple options.
author: c n.

description: Excellent dinner! We had aranchini and prosciutto for entree. Our pizzas were Diavola, Broccoli and Prosciutto. Very good! Ask for some chilli oil to liven your tastebuds up too. We finished off the meal with affogato. The wait staff were attentive. We began our meal around 6pm and could see how busy they  became to the point of people waiting in the street for tables to become free.
author: Sue L.

description:
Located on the major North Beach thoroughfare can be a blessing and a curse.  Can mean a lot of traffic but the traffic are loyal through convenience rather quality of food and service.  Il Casaro is different, modern looking restaurant where the food is excellent.  We tried two appetizers (calamari and rice balls) both worth having again, and two pizzas both again worth a retry.

Staff are good and on hand.  Restaurant is highly recommended.
author: Des D.

description: Ordered online and went to pick up with baby stroller. They asked me to wait outside because baby stroller was too bulky. Not very welcoming and not kid friendly...
author: Julie D.

description: I'm a food buyer, in town for the Winter Fancy Food Show. Bar had about 10 empty seats, guy wouldn't let me sit down for dinner because "he has to clean it". It wasn't dirty at all, so I waited by the door for a couple minutes... Nobody could care less, so I left. They could have cared less that I left. I rarely leave bad reviews, but this was just terrible customer service. I'm going to go check out this other place across the street. Hopefully they'll want to take my money.
author: Jason F.

description: Best ITALIAN pizza in San Francisco! If you wanna try really Italian pizza that's the right place!!
author: Clara T.

description:
this place is so so soooo legit! came here a while back and really enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto pizza.  then came back last night and had basically the same thing - plus the kale and sausage, and a bottle of wine.  as good as i remembered it if not better! the ingredients are so fresh, and the crust is to die forrrr! seriously so good...!

now, if only their floor isnt so slippery... sigh...
author: Christina L.

description: Great pizza and apps. Good for kids and we had no wait earlier in the evening. The waitstaff is courteous but efficient. If you are looking to have authentic pizza in the North Shore, this is a really good option.
author: Lori M.

description:
Birthday dinner for my daughter here.  No reservations on line until 945 but got a 730pm by phone. Yes on line is notoriously bad for peak time reservations everywhere. 

Seated immediately at waiting table.  Waiter attentive.  Took our appetizer and drink order quickly.  Back for our dinner order before apps came out. Told him worried our food would be too quick but he assured us it would take awhile. 

Apps were good especially the cauliflower and son loved he meatballs.  Fennel salad needed more robust dressing with some acid and panzanella had croutons instead of bread.  

Food came out before we finished the apps and before my daughters burrata had arrived (not fair for the birthday girl whose drink had to be requested twice). Would have liked the meal spaced better. 

Pizzas were delicious. Around the table we had magherita, Norma, prosciutto and mushroom and balbera and all were devoured.  

Three stars for service, and four for food.
author: Binx J.

description: My sister and I stumbled upon this place on our last trip to SF. We originally had our hearts set on going to the stinking rose across the street but it was an hour wait so we crossed the street (sad about the rose) and spotted this pizzeria. I was so pleasantly surprised at everything we ordered. Honest to god they have the BEST pasta and pizza I have ever eaten in my life (and I've tried a lot). The PSAT is home made and literally melted in my mouth, it was so soft. The pizza was mind blowing! I cannot wait to get back to SF just to eat here again. Seriously, try it.
author: Bianca G.

description:
We came here for dinner on a recent trip to San Francisco. 
The pizza is simple, authentic and delicious. We were actually full but considered ordering another one! We also had a wonderful salad and some yummy pasta. We left feeling full and happy. 
Excellent and friendly service.
author: Jill P.

description: We started walking in the wrong direction, but decided to walk back uphill to this wonderful gem of a restaurant.
