From the flavorful roasted Brussel sprouts and cauliflower to the freshest lasagna and cannelloni we've ever tasted, all the way to tiramisu and panne cotta, the service was first rate. The ambiance was casual and chic, loved every bite. Will come again and again.
author: Xavier E.

description: We walked in per our reservation we did online. We were told there was no dough left a few couldn't eat there. So much for that.
author: Krizia C.

description:
Extremely friendly staff. Apps and vino only this visit. Burrata cheese melts in your mouth. Cavorlfiori (roasted cauliflower) had capers and a little chili oil.... Excellent!

A must if you're in the area.
author: A L.

description:
I made a reservation through Yelp just to be responsible but we arrived so early (around 4:30 pm) that there were plenty of available tables. We were sat by the open windows which was so nice because there was a cool breeze once in a while. 

Ordered the burrata, wild boar salumi, asparagus and marinaded castelveltrano olives to start with. Burrata is my absolute favorite and is the whole reason I booked this reservation. It did not disappoint. It was served with a couple of slices of bread and a light arugula salad. Everything was so good. I'm usually not an asparagus fan but they were roasted and stacked with grated cheese, how could I NOT like it! 

We ordered two pizzas - the buffalo mozzarella margherita and the broccoli and sausage. The buffalo mozzarella gave off a lot of water so it made the pizza kind of soggy. But the creamy mozzarella with the freshness of the basil was very nice. The broccoli and sausage was my favorite - no sauce so just cheese, broccoli rabe, and fennel sausage. The broccoli rabe was a little bit bitter but complimented the fennel sausage and cheese. OH, and don't forget to use the chili oil on the table! It was just a nice kick to the pizza but not overwhelming at all. A little goes a long way! 

We ended dinner with cappuccinos and espresso shots, it was a nice way to end it all. 

The only thing I didn't like about it was the cleanliness of the restroom. It felt like everything that didn't fit outside was stuffed in there (like high chairs) and the entire toilet seat was wet.
author: Chyng H.

description: Must have baked calamari with zucchini on skewers: tasty! Awesome soft crust pizza from fresh ingredients.
author: K T.

description:
We are big fans of il Casaro. We live in the neighborhood and it is our go to sit down pizza spot in north beach. Our go to order is one margarita pizza, burrata, and prosciutto. It's typically plenty for my husband and I. The owner and the employees here are all super sweet and very Italian. We recommend this neighborhood gem to tourists and locals alike. Our extended family has been here too and they ALL love this spot as well. 

We also LOVE that they always have soccer/futbol on but if there is a specific sporting event they'll have that playing. 

Again this spot is our fave!! We prefer to go here over Tony's. Good, high quality pizza without the wait and at a better price. It also has great light. It's our happy spot haha

You can order delivery through caviar if you are too lazy to go (even though I'd rec going to the restaurant). Use this code and you'll get $10 off your first two orders https://bnc.lt/W9Qc/YyjfCD33Nt
author: Meg C.

description: Delicious pizza. Ordered margherita pizza and prosecco. No wait, no hype, and in my opinion, just as good as Tony's pizza or even better. Great service and atmosphere! It's our new favorite hidden spot in little Italy
author: CHristine J.

description:
Hands down the best pizza we have eaten in the USA. They have wood fired thin crust pizzas. We had the tuna and prosciutto pizzas. Both of them were excellent, the dough has a magical quality and the tomato sauce is out of this world. 

Go and eat here if you like pizza. Go even if you hate pizza. Their pizzas will convert you.
author: Rajkumar J.

description: Amazing food as well as amazing service! Went last night with our 3 young children and had a great time as well as great food. Everything from the appetizers to the pizza was a hit with all of us.
author: Richard C.

description:
This is a great little pizza place in North Beach area of San Francisco

I found this place on Yelp and it was phenomenal. The wait staff was excellent and the food was AMAZING. I got the lasagna and my friend got a calzone and we shared them. Definitely one of the best calzones I've ever had. The portions were reasonable but we decided to get a 4 formaggi pizza after that. The mix of cheeses was delicious!

We sat at the bar in front of the pizza oven, it was a little warm but you could watch the pizza maker make pizzas, cook other appetizers and stroke the fire. I would definitely suggest sitting there, it's like a show with dinner!

I am sure I will come back soon!
author: Pablo R.

description: Loved the Calabrese pizza (with spicy calabrian sausage). The margherita was great too. Interiors have good light and the staff is warm and prompt. Will definitely return.
author: Cria S.

description:
A very nice little restaurant with high quality pizza and mozzarella.
Serving sizes are decently sized.  The pizza is large enough to share with one other person and still be full.
Overall, this is a great little place that's definitely worth a try!
author: Stephen Z.

description: Must try one of the burrata mozzarella starters and any of the pizzas ! We have tried them all and they rock! Service is great even when it gets busy. Even though it is in north each it is not kitschy and touristy but filled with locals that know good pizza . The atmosphere is very Modern Italian and comfortable. Enjoy!
author: Bianca R.

description:
I used to go there often when I lived in San Francisco.
The appetizers are all AWESOME! My favourite is burrata with prosciutto crudo.
The pizza is great as well even if sometimes is spongy. My favourite is the norma.
The Tiramisu' at the end of your dinner is a must!
The servers are super polite!
author: Anastasia B.

description: The Prosciutto Pizza was Amazing!! I can't to come back to San Francisco and have it again.
author: Liz D.

description:
Best pizza in town!!! Great service,great wine and inexpensive!
If you are in little Italy you should try their pizza and don't forget to get the burrata.
author: Luis V.

description: I came here on a recommendation and was not disappointed. The pizza and mozzarella were absolutely delicious and the service was excellent.
author: BR C.

description:
I am a tough critic when it comes to pizza mainly because I was born and raised in Italy. I like simple pizzas with great ingredients and a dough that I could keep eating even plain. What I like about this place is the tomato sauce which tastes really well which makes a good base for every pizza you'll choose but I am not 100% sold on the pizza itself.  

This Neapolitan pizza (thick crust) is better - more authentic- than Tony's but there is something about it that is not convincing. I'll need to go for the third time to figure that out. 

 Il Casaro has very good mozzarella and prosciutto and they serve them with some "white pizza". I'd go back just to eat those!
author: Flora F.

description:
I have this friend (who's also a brewing partner & fellow Yelp Elite) who is borderline obsessed with finding an outstanding, classic, traditionally-prepared pizza. He's from the Old World & he's had the good stuff from over there. I guess it makes sense that he'd want to find that here.

Well, his search led us (along with his wife) to Il Casaro Pizzeria & Mozzarella Bar after a YEE in SF. Parking was typical SF, a total CharlieFoxtrot. But we eventually got lucky & squeezed into a street space a few blocks away. Walking in, the place was about 1/2 full & we got a table right away.

Service was sort of friendly & fairly attentive. We ordered Burrata & Asparagi to start + Margherita & Diavola pizzas. Our starters were served in short time. Both were excellent & seemed to be a good sign of things to come.

Our pizzas, curiously, took a while. When they finally did make their appearance at our, they looked fine. But were just OK once we started chowing down on both. The general consensus around the table was that both pizzas were average, not the best, not the worst.

Altogether, eating at Il Casaro Pizzeria & Mozzarella Bar was OK. As far as finding the New World's best Margherita pizza in the SF Bay Area, the search goes on. There's certainly no shortage of pizza joints around here, so my friend still has lots of choices to fuel his obsession.
author: John M.

description: I'm always really happy to come to this spot...it's one of the real Italian experiences. They have a wonderful woodfired pizza oven that produces fresh pizza in no time. I usually get marinara pizza with fresh Parmesan cheese and olives. We also sometimes get carbonara pasta which usually has fettuccine. True Italians and they have a somewhat laid-back attitude toward service, but they are always friendly and willing to help. I've never had a bad meal here. I noticed the last time we visited they added asparagus cooked in the pizza oven, talk about delicious!!!
author: David A.

description: Take the Il Casaro Pizza. It's stuff dreams are made of.
author: Florent C.

description: Amazing. The pizza was finger licking good and the burrata was the best I have ever had!!
author: Lana H.

description: Wow just wow!!  Family and I came across this restaurant by chance and it was amazing! The mussels were delicious I wish I could have eaten more. The pizza was also vey good. The panna cotta and tiramisu were outstanding. I will definitely going back soon.
author: Mariana G.

description:
Outstanding food and service. Nice atmosphere and the pizza is so good.
Good wine list, salads Loved this place.
author: Kath U.

description: The arrancini were delicious and crispy.  The pizza from the wood fired stove was excellent! It really makes a difference in the taste.  Loved it!
author: Carla G.

description: Solid, good pizza.  The crust was pretty authentically Italian around the edges.  The center got soggy as they put a little too much topping on the pizza (compared to what you would typically get in Italy).  Arancini are very good, authentic.  Croquette I did not love, a little too much going on.  I LOVED the pepperoncini calabrese!   Calamari was very good.  Being this is CA, it would be nice to have an arugula salad on the menu for those who want a little fiber... overall, very good. Closest thing I have had to true good Italian pizza in SF!
author: Adam U.

description: Wow! This place is a little gem. The meatballs and burrata appetizers are really good. We had the 'norma' pizza that had eggplant and it didn't disappoint. Priced just right for SF. Highly recommend this place.
author: Patty T.

description: I was checking out various pizza restaurants in the North Beach area along with their libations.  I arrived here, and I was sort of full, so I was going to just have a beer.  That would have been a huge error.  I saw they had a wood fired stove, and that all pizzas were $12.50 for happy hour, 2:30-4:30 I believe.  So I ordered a half Margherita and half spicy saleme.  My son and I split the pizza and it was awesome.  The crust was extremely flavorful with the right amount of crispiness.  The sauce was very tasty, and the saleme on point.  I may have liked it better then Pizzeria Delfina, and I loved Pizzeria Delfina.  This restaurant is closer to the hotel I stay at near Fisherman's wharf.  I can't wait to go back.
author: john h.

description: It was delicious!! The waitress was super nice and the service was quick. I will definitely come back.
author: Vince S.

description:
Best pizza in the Bay. Pizzas are made with fresh ingredients and gourmet cheeses. 

Grab a seat at the bar to watch your pizza being made. They have a stone oven. The service is fast and the staff care a lot about the customers comfort and happiness. 

Instead of squeezing us in at the bar - the host gave us a lot of room and said - it's not how many people we fit in here, it's how they enjoy themselves.  

Come here for amazing pizza and great service!
author: Maude B.

description: First time in San Francisco and I am so glad I decided to walk into this place. Pizza can easily be compared to the ones I ate in Italy. Amazing service, pleasent atmosphere. And for us sugar junkies, don't go there without trying pana cota. Tiramisu is usually my go to dessert in Italian places but my server recommended pana cota and I am so happy he did. This is one of those places where I wish there is a sixth star as an option for true greatness.
author: Srdjan T.

description: Perfecto! Just came back from Italy and wow! this pizza does not disappoint. The crust, sauce, cheese, and texture of the pizza is spot on. The Italian homeland would be proud of this spot, with the thin airiness and brilliance of the crust. The location is also top notch, they have a great kitchen with a trademark brick oven imported from Italy!! I am from SF and in my opinion this is the best classic Neapolitan style Italian pizza in the city.
author: Jacob B.

description:
Best pizza of my life. Get the crust with tomato sauce and basil cooked, then cold buffalo mozzarella after its out of the given.
From the east coast and haven't found edible pizza in SF yet. This is it!
author: Anna H.

description:
I don't know where the other reviewers get "better than Italy" or "best pizza in the states"... That's kind of misleading IMO.

I came here to order the margherita pizza ($13), which is my benchmark for all amazing pizzas. From creeping on the other tables' pizzas, I could already tell they had a major flaw: bad dough. Not to say their dough is bad tasting per se, but I could see it was going to be rather chewier and doughier than I would have liked. Sure enough, that is what we got. It lacks the flavor and thin/crispiness that I want from a napoletana pizza. The cheese atop the pizza was decent but not your melt-in-your mouth mozzarella.

However their one redeeming quality was their tomato sauce. It's better than most around and it's soupy pink. I know that sounds gross, but my favorite pizza in NY also has a similar sauce. It must be the way the tomato sauce mixes with the mozzarella cheese. Oh, and it appears they use San Marzano tomatoes for their sauce, if that distinction makes any difference to you.

All in all a decent pizza joint, but if you're looking for the best, keep on looking...
author: Joanne Y.

description:
We came here for lunch with the kids. We ordered two pizzas, a lasagne, and parts. As the kids are fussy eaters, we asked the waitress if we could order spaghetti with passion tomato sauce (off menu) for them. She said no problem.

The food was fine but unexceptional. The service was generally inattentive and it felt like one of our waiters was having a bad day and taking out his grumpiness on us.

The unpleasant surprise came when we got the bill and saw that they had charged us $16 for each plate of spaghetti. We're talking about a not-large sized portion of pasta with passion tomato sauce, possibly $2 worth of ingredients.

Not coming back here.
author: Shai T.

description: That place is great, I tried the mozzarella and a pizza, both were great and tasty. It is at the heart of the italian neighborhood, the service is great and fast. I will definitely come back. It is everything but a tourist place!
author: Sara-Fleur S.

description:
came here for late dinner and glad they were able to seat us this time around before last call. they're open until 11 on weeknights and 12 on weekends

ordered:
-arancini: good but i've had better ones
-croquette: liked this better than the arancini
-il casaro: mozzarella, grana padana, cremini mushroom, proscuitto crudo
-broccoli and salsiccia: scamorza cheese, broccoli rabe, itialian sausage

we were able to get half and half pizza.. the pizza is great for 2. full but not uncomfortable. if you're super hungry you can eat one pizza by yourself, almost a personal pizza size. there are 6 slices. 

great food and everything is really affordable. 

i liked that i heard a several different groups speaking italian. always a good sign when italians are eating at a italian place. 

if you can't come in, they deliver through caviar and postmates. 

can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu
author: Raquel T.

description:
This place is phenomenal. We seriously come here once a week. 

Everything is made to order and all the ingredients are top notch. 

We always get the burrata with spicy coppa to start. It comes bread they made right in the brick oven. The burrata is drizzled with olive oil so pure you can drink it. If you've never tried burrata, it's like eating heavenly pillows of cheese that gently caresses your mouth. Must try.

My favorite favorite pizza here is the Prosciutto. They shave fresh parmesan on top and watching it melt slightly but still hold its structure is one of my favorite things to see in the world. I would frame it in an art installation if I could - if I didn't eat it first. Every bite is a perfect balance of meat and cheese and sauce and crust. 

My second favorite is Capricciosa because the olives, artichoke, and mushroom add a lot of extra flavor but is so simple still.

The crust on their pizzas is so light that it doesn't over power any of the other ingredients. It's not too salty or oily or thick. And I love using the crust to mop up the extra sauce and oil. And because the oil they use is so good, you don't feel disgusting eating it.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is great, too. I like sitting at the bar so I can watch them make the pizzas. They also have three TVs that always have some sort of games on, which tones down any sort of pretentiousness the scratch made nature of the place might get.

I'm only scared that this place will get too popular and I won't be able to get a seat right away on a Friday night.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Just walking around North Beach being a tour guide for my cousin visiting from England and we saw this happening place with people hovering outside. It used to be Steps of Rome so I was pretty curious on this "mozzarella bar."

We waited 30 minutes for our table which was cool because we walked around for bit checking out the local bars. We were finally seated at our table and ordered the calamari, the burrata, prosciutto, the spicy salami pie and the pizza with the artichokes, olives, and prosciutto. The small plates arrived fairly quickly which was surprisingly only because they were very busy. 

The burratta was like butter. Dayam, it was to die for. The arugula and bread served with it was heavenly. The pizza was just as perfect. Spicy salami? Can't go wrong, especially if you love nitrate laden meats!

The service was perfection. He was very warm and friendly and quick to attend to our needs. Definitely a hit!
author: Sharon B.

description: Great Place. The staff is very friendly, and this is a fun spot to watch them rock pizzas "Vera Pizza Napoletana" style. It's a great addition to North Beach.
author: J E L.

description:
Decided to take a break from working late last night and walked over to NB.  We ordered two pizzas and asked for extra eggplant on the Norma Pizza and extra sauce on the Capricciosa Pizza.  The Norma was excellent.  The other was tasty but with the extra sauce, it got soggy fast.  Note:  Don't be greedy and ask for extra sauce.  It'll ruin your pie.  For the extra sauce and extra eggplant, they tacked on an extra $2.50.

I must admit that the novelty of the restaurant has worn off.  I like it and have frequented the place about 5 times.  Now I'm moving on.  I may come back in 6 months to check it out but there are just so many pizza joints out there.

Arrivederci!  See you next year!
author: Veritas V.

description:
I'm pretty picky about pizza these days after having eaten amazing pizza all throughout Italy. With that said, the pizza I had at Il Casaro almost made me feel like I was back in Italy; the pizza was THAT good.

Il Casaro took over the old Steps of Rome spot in North Beach and offers a very simple and to-the-point menu consisting of pizza, small appetizers, and some pasta dishes. We shared the arancini, which were filled with cheese and rice and came with some marinara sauce for dipping - these are great for sharing. For pizza, we had the capricciosa pizza which comes with tomato sauce, black olives, artichokes, mozzarella, mushrooms, and prosciutto cotto. It was delicious and all the ingredients were extremely fresh. The artichokes gave the pizza so much flavor!

Service was friendly and efficient - we came during lunch on a weekday and it was fairly busy for the late afternoon. Our server was really nice and always checked on us. I definitely want to go back to try the other pizzas.

If you're looking for a spot to grab a casual and quick meal, or just in the mood for pizza (which for me is always), Il Casaro is perfect for that.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
LOVE!  So delicious, so adorable!
We came here after the Craft Spirits Carnival at Fort Mason and it was everything we hoped for and more.  We even had an opportunity to make a reservation since it was before 5:30pm.
Very small tables, we were sat next to the wall of italian words right next to the window, walked right in for our 5:15pm reservation, and had a delightful server (not the most attentive but the food masked any disappointing service).
We started with the burratta, oh my lord, the best I've ever had!  Perfectly crafted, the EVOO on top with a mixture of pepper was scrumptious and the pairing with the soft-yet-crunchy crostini and the spinach leaves... perfection!
We both ordered our own pizzas and finished them!  I got burratta on mine and I expected the dollup in the middle but it was cooked on the pizza instead, a little disappointment but it did not distract from the amazing flavor.  My friend got the precuitto (sorry for the spelling) and it was divine! 
Overall the food was fantastic and we really enjoyed our meals, it was definitely worth the trek from fort mason. It would be the most dangerous establishment if I lived in the area due to how amazing it was, no other venue I've experienced can compare to the quality ingredients and fresh taste of Il Casaro's pizza.
author: Sara N.

description: got a quick seat at around eleven on a weekday for lunch after seeing the line for tony's down the street. got our pizza very quickly and it's the best margherita pizza i've had in the bay so far! i know it's hard to pick out of the sea of italian restaurants in north beach, but i would recommend this one if you're in the area.
author: Delaney G.

description:
Pros: Excellent pizza. They accommodate half pizzas in one style, with the other half in another. It's also cool that if you sit at the bar, you can see the staff make the pizza.

Cons: We walked in at 8p on a Saturday and got our 1 pizza at 9:15p!! To make things worse, they seemed to have mixed up their food orders because several tables who came in after us were served their pizzas first. Our server also appeared to have somewhat forgotten us, as we heard her apologize for the wait to other customers, and those customers arrived later AND got their food earlier than us. We received no such interaction or even any check ins from the server over the entire 1 hour 15 minutes.. until we flagged her down to check that our order had not been misplaced. My water glass sat empty for over 45 minutes.

What a terrible experience and blemished start to a Saturday night date with the girlfriend.
author: Andrew C.

description: Loved this little Italian restaurant in North Beach. Fantastic pizza and great meatballs. The crust was incredible. Also, very smooth Italian beer and attentive service. Even my finicky teenage daughters loved this place.
author: Steve C.

description:
Excellent!

I grew up eating wood-fired pizza exclusively and have always had a hard time finding that crisp/burnt taste in San Francisco. Well, the search is over, Il Casaro is it!

We were seated immediately and started off with prosciutto and fresh mozzarella. As soon as we took our first bite, we knew we'd found our new favorite pizza joint. The prosciutto was delicious and mozzarella so fresh and creamy I'm still thinking about it five days later.

Then came the true test. I ordered a sausage & anchovy pizza and could not have been happier. The crispness of the dough, the freshness of the toppings, delicious! My girlfriend called it the best pizza she's had in the States... And she's half Sicilian!

Great spot and I will definitely be back when my next wood-fire craving hits, most likely before the end of the month.
author: Teiki K.

description: New favorite lunch spot! The Margherita pizza was really simple, light, and delicious! The crust is on the thin side so you're able to finish a majority of the pizza by yourself. I love that the food isn't greasy so you don't feel gross afterwards. Highly recommend trying this place when you're in North Beach.
author: Caroline Z.

description:
Two words- super service!
We had spent the afternoon biking through tourist spots in San Fran...and then the rain came.
Despite being peak dinner hours, the staff had us seated in minutes.
We started with the Cauliflower, which had a little spice to it, and the Burrata...YUM.
The imported cheese was so smooth and creamy. It paired perfectly with the charred bread, herb seasoning, arugula and tomato.
We shared a capricciosa pizza and the tagliatelle for our mains. Not so sure how I felt about the pork with pasta pairing but the naples style pizza did not disappoint!
The restaurant itself is small but they have a good seating layout and fast service. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!
author: Victoria R.

description: Feeling bogged down by dating and life woes, my sister and I went out in search of pizza past 8 pm to get a breath of fresh air. Luckily, we're located in Chinatown and the many pizza shops of Little Italy / North Beach are just a step away. We were tempted by a few pizza by the slice joints on our way to check out Il Casaro, but we're glad we opted to discover the pizza here. We got the $13 margarita pizza which was a good amount to share for two. The cheese was fresh, sauce was dribbling, and the basil was aromatic. It's authentic Italian pizza with a wood fire stove that reminded me of Gusta Pizza from when I studied abroad in Florence. The service was friendly (cute waitress!) and I liked that the staff spoke Italian. It's not a super pretentious place, but since it was a bit loud inside we opted to take our pizza to-go and eat it out on the streets while walking around.
author: Electra C.

description:
Excellent new pizzeria in the neighborhood (which says something since it's North Beach, home of Tony's and BaoNecci's among many others). This spot is casual but feels elegant still. With an open kitchen where you can see the pizza made, the place feels warm and lively but not loud.

The burrata is excellent and comes with some of their delicious fresh cooked bread (same dough as pizza I believe). The margherita pizza is great as is the Prosciutto pizza. 

My only complaint is that the place can be slightly understaffed during busy times and therefore service can be a little slow but once the food order is in, they're pretty fast.
author: Victor W.

description:
The imported burrata, prosciutto pie and a glass of pinot. Soooo good, i can't even. 

The burrata is silky, buttery and rich paired with the smokey, charred flatbread. The prosciutto pie is thin, perfectly crisp and holds a nice balance of earthy shaved raspa dura, salty pork and tart marinara. Rocket greens (perhaps dressed in lemon & oil) provide that nice bitter pungency that rounds out both of these superb dishes.

Get these and thank me later!
author: Katie O.

description: Good food at a good price for San Francisco, reasonable size portions, pleasant staff.
author: R H.

description:
This place is so yummy. We went here after Tony's gave us a 2hour wait time. SO HAPPY we ended up here. It was fresh and delicious. We got two pizzas and sat by the window with some beers. The prosciutto was delish. 

We also had the gnocchi as an appetizer, which was very good.

It was a very pleasant evening. Our waitress was sweet and attentive. The food was affordable and again, very good. The atmosphere is nice and I would very much recommend.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Sure the wait was long, but what can I expect from a place that offers not only homemade pasta, but also gluten-free homemade pasta?? The food was YUM! The pasta dishes are wonderful (the pesto was GREAT) and Il Casaro does not monsterous portions (a good thing). The margherita pizza was gobbled immediately-I recommend trying out Il Casaro when you're in the area.
author: Thalia F.

description: When you enter this place you can already smell its authenticity: that slightly sweet smell of fresh pizza dough, fresh tomatoes, basil, hmm. I recommend the prosciutto pizza!
author: Stefan S.

description:
I have never written a review for Yelp before but I had to after eating here.  This was simply the best pizza I've ever had!

SO, let's get the basic, but important stuff out of the way.  The staff was kind, the place cozy and inviting, etc.   I have 2 kids and the place was great for the family.

My husband and I ordered the buratta---food for the gods!  The salmon pizza and marguerita pizza were fantastic. 

AND HERE'S THE BEST PART: usually after I eat pizza I feel disgusting---too carb and salt overload. I ate 3.5 pieces of pizza and feel like I only ate veggies.  The quality of the pizza is that good. This is the way it's meant to be made---not to kill your digestive system but to work with it in harmony. Don't miss!!!!!!
author: Julie R.

description:
If you are looking for the ITALIAN pizza (not American) then Il Casaro is your place. Located in the heart of little Italy I consider this pizza place the best in town (being italian I was looking for a great pizza and finally have found it here).

Serving pizza cooked in wood fired oven with delicious ingredients such as Prosciutto San Daniele and Mozzarella di Bufala, the prices are so reasonable.

The host is super nice and would entertain without being aggressive or noise (other italian restaurants in the area are famous for the opposite behavior) and let you enjoy your hot pizza once it comes (fast and precise service).

Never given 5 stars to a restaurant but Il Casaro and his owner definetely deserves that!
author: Sergio C.

description:
Hands down favorite pizza place in the city. Have tried every pie on the menu, and would recommend the Diavola. 
Can't go wrong starting with Burrata. 
The pizza is very thin with a great crust - as such the food does not travel great (applies for delivery), though is still my go to. 
Owner is super friendly and the staff is great. Take out is the move as they fire the pizzas up in just a few minutes. 
Definitely not a North beach tourist trap
author: Greg D.

description:
Absolutely incredible food and experience. We came on a Sunday night and got sat immediately. We sat at their beautiful bar so that we could watch the pizzaiolo make the pizzas. We started with the Buffala mozzarella and the green olives. The mozzarella tasted fresh and exactly like it would taste in Italy. We ordered the margherita pizza and the uovo pizza and drizzled them both with their homemade pepperoncini oil. This is the most authentic pizza you're going to find outside of Italy. It was incredible, and the dough was chewy and puffy, just the way I like it. The ingredients were fresh and simple, all of the flavors came together perfectly. I was in pizza heaven. They also have a really interesting wine list, with a lot of Italian wines that are worth trying. 

I really like what they did with the space and the food can't be beat. The pizza is incredibly authentic and the prices are so reasonable. I will only be ordering pizza from Il Casaro from now on.
author: Regina L.

description: Ugh not enough words to write about how truly amazing Il Casaro is. Located in the heart of little Italy right behind Chinatown, this small Italian joint serves up some authentic and delicious italian food. My BF and I came here based on a recommendation from my sister and brother in law. We busted a mission from our hotel to come here for dinner right before our flight and they were totally accommodating and super quick. The customer service was out of the this world and they were so attentive and did everything they could to make sure we had the best possible dining experience without missing our flight. We ordered the brussel sprouts and burrata for appetizers. Both were PHENOMENAL but the star of the show was the prosciutto pizza. The crust was soft and chewy, prosciutto incredibly fresh and the flavors of the cheese with the light tomato sauce just balanced everything out. Amazing amazing pizza. We will definitely be back!
author: Amanda M.

description: Had dinner here tonight for the first time. Everything was incredibly fresh, the pizza and service were fantastic! The location is small but well run. Better to come at 5pm than 7p if you don't want to wait.
author: Claudia H.

description:
So, found this place totally due to other Yelpers.  What a discovery.  Feels super authentic.  We sat at the bar because there was a line out the door.  With good reason.  We started with the Mozzarella bar.  3 varieties to choose from left us choosing the traditional and most used.  Served with Arugula, good olive oil, grape tomatoes sliced in half and pizza crust points.  All gently seasoned with salt and pepper.  So simple and so amazing.  We also split a prosciutto pizza.  The crust is so light and delicate.  It was served with the fresh arugula, fresh shaved Parmesan and beautiful sections of prosciutto lay atop this pizza.  (I may have called it food porn on my social media site...)

Go now!  You won't be disappointed.
author: Nikki W.

description:
In the old Steps of Rome space, Il Casaro (Italian for "cheesemaker") puts out some top notch thin crust pizza. 

With polished concrete floors, the sparely adorned dining room is highlighted by a large marble-topped counter that surrounds a giant, red tiled Stefano Ferrara wood-fired pizza oven. 

There is no mistaking that pizza is the star here. The menu is short and to the point: one salad, a couple of antipasti, and a selection of mozzarella are only a pretext for the main attraction, the pizza. 

With chicory, dandelion greens, and shaved fennel, the insalata ($9.50) is topped with raspa dura (young, full flavored Lodigiano cow'a milk cheese) and dressed with a red wine vinaigrette with fierce acidity. The Napolitana pizza arrives with just the right amount of blistering on the crust. Neither too crispy, nor too chewy, it is just right. With mozzarella, tomato sauce, and spicy sausage, the diavola ($14.75) is pleasantly piquant. Piled high with San Daniete prosciutto, the aptly named prosciutto ($17) is a sight to behold. 

Service is friendly and well-meaning, but a little slow and confused.  The pizza arrived before the insalata, but otherwise everything else went smoothly. The all Italian wine list is short, but contains ample red and white selections to pair with the cuisine.  With  falanghina, Fiano di Avellino, and Taurasi, to name just a few, there is something for everyone.

Peter Fazio of Vicoletto and chef Francesco Covucci are doing good things at Il Casaro.
author: CJ G.

description: My go-to lunch place when I'm in the area! The fried eggplant pizza is absolutely delicious, price is right and very attentive staff. Love it
author: Andreea C.

description:
Pizza for DAYS.  Carb-o-licious.  Mozarella madness...

Things to try here that are Italian gym-buddy approved (yes, my gym-buddy is a hottie imported from Italy...like PERONI... *wink*):
-the diavola pizza (my fave)
-the prociutto pizza (my 2nd fave...I love the shaved parmesan on top...yummers)
-Il Casaro Pizza 
-Quattro Formaggio

This is THIN-CRUST pizza (who needs to get fattened up with DOUGH???) - Gym-rat approved.

So, the owner is truly Italian.  Several of the waitresses speak Italian.  The Burrata is as fresh as the 20 year old kid that hit at me at The Cigar Bar... hahaha.

The food is good.  The service is fast.  

The ambiance is North Beach...

The crowd...eh... a mix of tourists and locals...and of the tourists, some not so pleasant ones...but, the owner and servers do their best to be pleasant, keep out riff-raff and keep the unpleasant customers at bay.  All around YAY!
author: Hiromi N.

description: Delicious pizza's! Also gluten free pasta. Very good mozzarella tomato salad as well, the buffalo mozzarella and meatballs were amazing. Always very busy so expect some waiting time.
author: Christy V.

description: We came across this place while looking for restaurants to have dinner in little Italy. It has a very modern look, with a rustic feel. The food was good, a little heavy on the Olive oil but nonetheless very delicious. Me and my hubby will definitely be back to try something different next time. The spaghetti and meatballs were awesome, and the pizza looked tasty! Love the window seats and our server was nice as well. The whole staff assisted in pre-bussing and refills. The service was up to par with the food and atmosphere. Bravo!
author: Homa K.

description: remarkable, so very good.  there really isn't much to say, because if you know how to make a real pizza correctly it just is what it is. Seems like it's vera pizza certified, or it might as well be. Lovely ingredients, prepared correctly.   reminds me of a pizza I had a long time ago in milan, which I never forgot
author: Eric L.

description: I feel like I'm in Italy! The waiter even says, "buon Giorno!" The pizza was delicious! My friend and I ordered a salad, prosciutto pizza and the buffalo mozzarella! Yum!
author: Jane P.

description:
Hit and miss. Went there twice, once ate at a table, had an appetizer, a real and good pizza and a beer, all with good service. So far so good. 
The second time I tried the Quattro Formaggi as take out. Total DISAPPOINTMENT after waiting 20 min (I was told it would take 10) in the cold weather outside. The pizza looked bad, the 4 cheeses couldn't be seen, the slice slices varied a lot, and the pizza was noticeably smaller. The price for take out is the same. 
Establishments should pay attention to consistency and to serve customers with $20 bills the same as $40. Luckily for them I had the good experience first. 
It wouldn't hurt that they make a website, they opened in 2014...
author: Matthew C.

description: Came here with 9 girls- was told by hostess she had a table of 6 ready just waiting for a table of 3 to leave. She said max 10 minutes. 15 minutes in we see her give the table to a 3 top. Really???? She didn't even tell us- we could have been long gone to a place that actually cared about their local customers. Bye Felicia.
author: Ashlyn R.

description: We choose this place because yelpers had it as kid friendly and it was rated very highly. It is indeed kid friendly. Loud and active. Very family oriented. In a good way. The servers were very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We got a mozzarella appetizer. So creamy and delicious. The crust/bread is to die for (same bread/dough that is the pizza crust). We got 2 diavolo pizzas, 1 Quattro formaggio and 1 calzone. The crust is so good. The pizzas were very good. The reviews are right. They're just big enough to almost share. Definitely plenty for one person with a strong appetite. 2 pizzas can probably feed 3. Would definitely come back to this place with the family. Not the place for a quiet and romantic date spot.
author: Ted T.

description: Best pizza experience in San Francisco. Best value/price ratio. Expect an authentic Italian atmosphere.
author: Maurizio T.

description: One of the most amazing meals I've had in a while. The pizza was delicious as well as the mozzarella bars. Service was great and it's obvious love is put into every dish, simply amazing!
author: Jennifer M.

description: The best pizza in the area alot better  than Tony's.  There is no wait and the service is amazing. i stongly recommend Il Casaro.
author: Guy L.

description: I'm not sure how this place got 4.5 stars. The service was terrible (rude waitress who had to separately be asked to bring silverware and later plates). My beet salad was fantastic but the pizza was oily and mediocre.
author: Ben D.

description: Sorting through all of the places in North Beach, we ended up in Il Casaro and could not have made a better choice. It was literally the best pizza we've ever had and we've had no shortage of taste testing through the years. Charming and delicious -- we'll be back!
author: Kimberly L.

description: The prosciutto pizza is amazing! One of the few places that can makes a decent pie in Cali.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
Amazing place!  If this spot was in my neighborhood, I'd be there all the time.
Made a point of seeking this place out, and will do again next time we're in SF.
Staff was super friendly.  Pizza was ridiculous.  Great place.
author: Blaine S.

description: Great little spot with delicious food. The penne, burrata, arancini and beet salad were all so good. The staff were super friendly with our kids and my daughter really enjoyed sitting at the bar watching the pizza making.
author: D K.

description: Had a day date with the fiancé on 12/30/15. Walked in with eager stomachs. The margarita was pretty good. Love the brick oven!
author: Jen H.

description: Great pizza and pasta, with friendly service, no wait to be seated, and quick food delivery to the tables. 10/10 would recommend going here.
author: Emily B.

description: One of the very few authentic italian pizza places in the US and in the SF area. As an italian born and raised in Italy I'm definitely suggesting this place to anyone who wants to try real pizza. Service was also very good. Grazie per aver portato la vera pizza anche qui!!
author: Anna A.

description:
You HAVE to order the Imported Burrata! It's really really really awesome. 

We also ordered the Calzone pizza, which was pretty good too (but not nearly as heavenly as the Burrata).
author: Yu Sheng T.

description:
We were going to go to the Cliff House but looking at the menu it was ordinary and just that the restaurant has that tourist-trap food price. We would have waited but the host told us they've stopped taking orders.

Thank goodness we went to Little Italy and checked out IL Casaro! 

Have you ever really had "real, authentic" pizza? Get the prosciutto pizza - it's to die for laden with mozzarella, araguls and prosciutto!

Ask for Augustina, she's friendly  he's the owner and he's very accommodating. Calls you Mama and Papa, very original. The server was awake, cool ink on her arms, and Ricky, he won't let your drink run dry.
author: Manny D.

description: Hmmmm, still not sure how I feel about this place. I had been wanting to try it for months. Had a bunch of appetizers and a few pizzas with family but I left feeling unimpressed. I think there are way better pizza options in North Beach. I'm a huge fan of Tony's pizza but if you want this style of pizza Piccolo Forno has similar options but in my opinion is way tastier. The only thing I really liked was the pizza crust/dough was really soft!
author: Christen N.

description: I absolutely loved this place. I have to give it 4 stars because I save my 5 star reviews for a few elite spots, but it's super good and you should try it!  We split the burrata, Caesar salad, and Margarita pizza between the two of us and it was excellent. Good prices, great food, and great modern yet still rustic atmosphere. There are so many places in north beach we are so glad we chose Il Casaro.
author: Brittany D.

description: Bad service,food was ok! The pizza was too wet and soft. Manager was self-centered and unprofessional (i.e. Singing as he walked around the restaurant, checking out female customer's behind as she left, standing over me after I got the check so that I would leave faster). Definitely low standards for a business owner
author: Ash Y.

description:
Great, cheap, simple, Italian food in North Beach? This hasn't happened in ages. Get there before the lines get ridiculous. 

Their pizza margherita is currently better than A16, Delfina and Zero Zero. No kidding.
author: John M.

description: We got the margherita pizza & cannoli. Both were delicious! I loved being able to watch the chefs make the pizzas while sitting at the bar! Probably the best cannoli I've ever had.
author: Noelle M.

description:
Awesome food, especially the mozzarella plate and the seafood pizza!

Couldn't speak more highly of their service and owner, as a local resident I will surely return!!
author: Cole L.

description: Best pizza in north beach! Also a plus my bf and I can usually get a table on a Friday night with no wait ++
author: Erin W.

description:
Absolutely fabulous. Simple and delicious.
Didn't realize they also owned Vicoletto as well down the street and around the block until we were walking out after eating. Another great place to eat REAL Italian!
Pizza cooked in a 900 degree oven is the only way to go.
author: Nicole S.

description: Our pizzas, especially the ingredients, were very good. Would have liked them a bit more crispy but maybe that's Chicagoans expecting it was a cracker crust. The Burrata with Calabrese peppers was great. Service was good. Upbeat staff. Be sure to sign in on the list hanging outside the doorway and not waste your time waiting for the busy hostess to tell you to do the same.
author: George P.

description: The place, the feel, and the pizza. The best!! It's not like an American pizza, it's a true Italian pizza. Also, the waiters and waitresses are really nice. To us, best pizza in America. Ella 10 years old and pizza lover
author: julien b.

description: Servers were great, atmosphere was great, however the food was plain. Ordered the Salmon Pizza dish (don't recall the actual name) and tastes like a ham and cheese sandwich... no flavor no special sauce.. very disappointed.
author: Joel S.

description: We were so impressed by this little spot! The menu is small, but perfect! My husband and I shared the Norma pizza and Spaghetti Carbonara, delicious. The best part of our meal was the mozzarella appetizer! I will dream about the perfect balance of olive oil, saltiness, and texture. We almost returned the next day, but had other reservations! We will definitely return!
author: Lindsay Y.

description:
Just ok .  Not anything to right home about. Did not even have salad dressing for a ceasar salad!
Definitely go to Tony's pizza slice!
author: Kate V.

description: If you want to taste real italian pizza without going to italy, here is the best place. We've ordered margarita pizza and dough was soft and tasty and top of the pizza was perfect with the fresh sauce and chesee which comes from italia.
author: Semi F.

description: After the nighttime Alcatraz tour at 10pm, I was starving and did not want to deal with the crowds along Fisherman's Wharf. Luckily I found this gem! It was a Saturday night and the entire neighborhood was busy, Casaro being no exception, but our party of 6 was immediately seated. We ordered the calzone, prosciutto pizza, spicy coppa plate, and a plate of burrata. The spicy coppa and burrata were my dishes and I was worried it wouldn't fill me up, but they came with a generous helping of bread and a tasty arugula tomato salad on the side, so I was definitely stuffed by the end. The burrata was amazing. I had never had it before- it's so light, creamy, and buttery. I could eat it everyday! The calzone was HUGE. Much bigger than I expected, but sized so a grown man can finish it no problem. Pizza was also good. They come in one size (18" I think) and are perfect for sharing OR just enough for a grown man to eat on his own. Not a big space, but a great place for you and few friends to grab some great food!
author: Khrysten T.

description: BEST Mozzarella I have ever had in my life. Pizza was delicious as well, my boyfriend and I shared the Margherita pizza it was so good but it was missing some seasoning. Absolutely love this place can't wait to go back.  Giving it 4 stars because of the pizza lacking some flavor and it was super hot in the air. When they would open the door every now and then it felt. Leave the door open when it's packed and you have the brick over going!!
author: Nicole S.

description: This place was relatively decent. The service was decent as well, but it could've been better. I ordered the prosciutto pizza, the margherita pizza, and the burrata plate. The one negative this place had was that they served relatively warm water to us, and we had to constantly ask for glasses of ice. The pizzas took a while to come out of the oven. The burrata was good, but it was way too small of a size. The prosciutto pizza was more of an acquired taste, and I found that the taste got old after a couple slices. Not to mention, the pizza was very messy. The margherita pizza was decent. Overall, this place is just okay.
author: Michael Q.

description: Tha carbonara is one of the best I've ever eaten had. I also tried the Calabrese pizza and the dia sage was really delicious.  I would have 5 starred this place except for that all 3 ppl got their dinners at different times - awkward.
author: Dan A.

description: Excellent!  Great pizza!  More expensive than what it should be - $13 for a simple margherita, but other than that, a true neapolitan pizza.
author: Alex P.

description: The best pizzeria in SF! They use very Good products and it is the real Italian pizza it is also cheaper than others place. Recommend from an ITALIAN
author: Luca S.

description: I love this restaurant!!!! The food amazing.  When a restaurant can make a dish better than the one you grew up on....... I never ever thought I would ever say someone else's spaghetti Carbonara was better than moms.. ( glad she won't see this post lol) I ordered it just as a side, I always compare to the one I grew up on and usually it's a big fat Heck no.  Not this one.  I only wished they shipped :)
author: Kris B.

description:
No better way to sample SF than coming here. A Lagunitas IPA (an acquired taste, for sure) and the 4 cheese pizza hit the spot after a long day of walking around the North Beach festival. 

The burrata is quite literally to die for, and the quattro formaggi is simply fantastic. Wash it down with my first Lagunitas, and in a very cool environment, and you have a winner.
author: Vinay M.

description:
We came here after many italian friends raved about this place: I need to be careful, cause italian restaurants in North Beach tend to break my heart!
It wasn't the case here. We had BURRATA pizza and PROSCIUTTO pizza and they were both incredibly good.
The crust was soft and crunchy, the burrata was fresh and the prosciutto was so tasty!
Also the beautiful mosaic tiled red brick oven in the middle of the room is such an eye catcher.
The service is fast and the staff very nice.
If I have one suggestion for the owner, would be to add a second door at the entrance. I was exposed to a freezing wind every time a new costumer came in.
I am Italian, so you can trust me when I say you are going to eat good pizza here!
author: Amira T.

description: Delicious pizza diavolo. Great mozzarella! Get there on the early side. Got crowded past 6:30.
author: shana k.

description: Best thin crust wood fired margherita in the city that I've tried. Better than Tony's, zero zero, longbridge, del poppolo; though I'm not sure what type of ovens they use. Neck and neck with una pizza napoletana but at a much better price point ($13 versus $25)
author: Chinthrilla M.

description:
A few nights ago, I found myself home alone, hungry, & lazy. I was searching for something, & I thought the Internet could help me find my true match. I opened up my favorite site, Caviar, hoping to find the answer to my dilemma. I began to scroll through the photos, focusing on the "type" I was looking for tonight - Italian. Gorgeous photos of pizza were everywhere. But I'd been through so many of them before. Sure, they were fine, but I was sure that tonight I could do better. Some were clearly gold-diggers (Tony & his $45 pizza - yikes). I started to despair. Maybe this whole internet thing just isn't for me. Maybe I should just go old-school and call an old regular.

But remember, I'm lazy so I persevered. Suddenly, I came upon Il Casaro Pizzeria & Mozzarella Bar. The pictures were all I needed to see, not to mention the elevation of amazing mozzarellas in the very name. It was love at first sight. I could see us in Italy in a beautiful, romantic restaurant. I could use all the Italian words I know: per favore, Grazie, delizioso, formaggio, etc. 

Arriving early, and not the worse for wear after the indignity of being shoved in a cardboard box for the trip across town, I was blown away by what came through my door. Always wondering if the photos would match the reality, and ladies (& gentlemen!) did it ever. This was the real deal. So, I'm here to say, do yourself a favor & spend an evening with il Casaro.

P.S. I ordered the calzone (San Marzano tomatoes, smoked mozzarella, ham, & mushrooms) and the imported Burrata. Both were outstanding. The arugula & cherry tomato salad w the calzone was a wonderful touch. My only gentle complaint: two small bread pieces with the Burrata was not nearly enough. Maybe at least double that for take-out?
author: Fran C.

description: Probably the best pizza I've ever had. Yummy!!! The menu is basic but that's a good sign because what they have, the do well!!! They definitely made my wife and I's 1 year anniversary memorable in San Fran.
author: Dwane M.

description: My daughter and I had a delicious meal here while visiting San Francisco.  The fresh burrata is amazing! We shared the calzone and pasta carbonara for dinner. Both were fantastic. The service was very good-- friendly, professional and efficient. We will definitely eat here on our next visit to the city!
author: Kristin H.

description: Loved the pizza, ordered a ceaser salad and had a glass of Lambrusco wine . Very tasty together ! Very small place tho. Loved that they had the basketball games on as well. Only thing was we got pizza before our apps due to lack of service.
author: Ricardo M.

description: This place is just wonderful. People are very friendly and the food is spot on. Everything you see on the menu is hand made and the they have an open kitchen, so you see how everything is made.
author: Rose A.

description:
The best authentic Italian pizza in San Francisco; after all, the owners recently arrived from Italy. Don't waste your time waiting in the line at Tony's pizza and go to Il Casaro instead.

Personal favorite: Prosciutto pizza
author: Kazan B.

description:
The food and service was outstanding. Augustina was very welcoming and informative. Her wine recommendation was excellent. The imported burrata was excellent and the prosciutto was even better. The Buffalina pizza was the best Neapolitan pizza we've had since Ciccia Bamba in Rome. 

One small issue -- we had dinner at 6:00pm and they were out of lasagna and tiramisu.
author: Shawn G.

description: Great pizza & hands down in my top three I have had in my long life! Go here or miss one of the best pies ever!
author: Phil N.

description: Was in town and had to stop by.Nothing has changed same amazing pizzas and the ice cold Peroni.The meatballs may be even better than my last visit.I'd love to recommend a specific pizza but they are all great and I hate to limit anyone from trying them all LOL.ENJOY!!!
author: Andrew S.

description: I really enjoyed the service and food. Love the salami dishes that are more than just meat, especially the wild boar. Delicious, defiantly will be back
author: Soul B.

description:
Great pizza spot in busy North Beach.  Pizza was delicious--crust is tasty and cooked just right.  Got the Diavola and Il Casaro pizzas.  Very fresh ingredients, good portion sizes.  Also, got the burrata dish--creamy and fresh.  Food was good portion for four people.  

Additionally, the service was quite good.  Very attentive and friendly.
author: Angelica B.

description:
We loved the food - we ordered soup and fried mozzarella for starters, pizza, pasta and lasagna for the main course. Good espresso for the end of the meal.
The service was friendly and efficient.
The prices are $7 for soup, 15/16 for pasta/lasagna and all very good-  we will definitely recommend this place.
author: Amit F.

description: I visited here for lunch. The dining area was light and airy, with a view of the kitchen integrated into the dining area.  The burrata was tasty and nicely presented.  I chose the prosciutto pizza, which included arugula in the toppings. The crust was crisp and light with a hint, albeit not an overwhelming one, of the wood - fired oven in which it was baked. Service was food. If I were looking for a pizza on my next trip to San Francisco, I'd come back.
author: Robert M.

description: It was ok. We ordered cheese pizza with bazil and proshutta pizza. At first we really liked the taste and the crust but then in 10 minutes the pizza became so soggy that we had to fold its slices and roll them into rolls in order to taje a bite. The crust was just too thin, almost paper-thin in the middle of the pizza and got very wet and soggy from the cheese and juice of the topings. I hope they adjust the thickness of the crust to match the consistency of the induvidual pizzas. Otherwise pizza becomes a soggy mass.
author: Kim L.

description:
Mozzarella Bar. So you should go for that reason. Small menu, but what they offer is delicious! They have yummy cheese plates for under $10. The pizzas are between $12 - $18 and are perfect for sharing with a group. My only complaint is that the crust was burnt on both of our pizzas. 

Seating is limited, so make a reservation. The service was great!
author: Kristin F.

description:
Great service! Came for a girls dinner last night and we had to wait a few minutes for the previous group to pay and clear the table. Franceso, the manager (?) gave us a taste of wine while we were waiting. 

Ordered the burrata, salumi, salad and calamari (not fried) for appetizers. We shared 2 pizzas - margherita and proscuitto - which was more than enough. Francesco overheard that it was a bday and brought out 3 pieces of tiramisu with a candle for us to share. 

Lovely time here and will definitely be back.
author: jet l.

description:
Everything about this place was fantastic, the food, the service, even the lady walking by yelling at us through the window added some excitement to the meal. She was probably just upset she wasn't enjoying the delicious meal that we were.
We ordered the burrata since let's be honest you can never go wrong with cheese. The Prosciutto and Diavola Pizzas and a pasta dish. We LOVED everything, the prosciutto was my favorite and the Diavola had a really nice spice. 
Everyone there was so nice and very attentive; this was by far our favorite meal while visiting San Francisco.
author: Nikki G.

description:
**3.75**

Cozy little pizzeria in North Beach with good food and very reasonable prices. The setting is low key and casual, so if you're winding down from a busy Sunday or weekend, then Il Casaro is a good option. We got there around 5:30pm and it was pretty quiet, but there was a line to be seated by the time we finished our meal.

The appetizers came out fairly quickly, but the pizza took some time even though there weren't a lot of customers at the time. 

Other notes:
- Their windows open up so it feels like you're eating outside.
- Their burratta was so creamy and delicious, and the marinara sauce used for the prosciutto pizza was really good. The only gripe I have is that they burnt part of the crust... I mean, these pizza portions aren't large to begin with, so I felt like we wasted some good crust there!
- Parking can be a challenge, as it's located amongst a bunch of other restaurants/bars, and Chinatown.
author: Diana K.

description:
Getting a table takes forever. They keep
telling it is almost ready but you can stay in an endless wait.
author: Luca B.

description: This spot combines two of my favorite things on the planet: neapolitan style pizza and authentic burrata. I highly recommend starting, as we did, with the burrata plate. There will not be enough flatbread, and you will ask for more. Even your basic margherita pizza here will blow you away. Not much more to say that 400+ people haven't already said about this place!
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I really enjoyed my dinner here last week. The service was very friendly (and we even had a baby in a highchair and they were accommodating!), and the food was great.

We ordered:

Buratta -amazing
Meatballs - pretty good, although I probably wouldn't feel the need to order again
Margherita pizza- Delicious! although I'd still take Tony's over it
Diavola pizza- Good, but I'd probably order differently next time
author: K. D.

description:
So, two things.
#1. Great food. Some of the best marinara sauce I've ever had on a pizza. Delicious crust. Flavorful cheese.

#2. Terrible service. And not even to my party. Saw the owner absolutely lose it and scream at a woman with a small child in front of the whole restaurant. Kept yelling, "You're the worst customer EVER!" to her as her kid cried. He was very close to her face and kept making these violent hand gestures. Now, I couldn't hear her part of the conversation as she was sitting down and speaking in a calm voice. Maybe she was an awful customer but his behavior was unacceptable and abusive. We wrote a note on our receipt to the owner. Normally we would say something but this guy seemed way too hotheaded and we weren't in the mood to throw down. I almost felt like I was watching an episode of Kitchen Nightmares.
author: Daniel K.

description: I ate most of the (real) Italian pizza of the Bay Area, and by far this is the best one! Not only a great quality, but also a reasonable price: as Italian, I refuse to spend $25 for a margherita (I.e: Una Pizza Napoletana) and so should you.
author: Alessio Z.

description: I discovered this place thanks to my Italian classmate, who said to me, that she had had the best pizza here since her arrival to the US. So i gave it i try and i loved it! First of all: The dough! My god with this pizza you really wanna eat the whole thing even the crust cause it tastes different from other kind of pizzas you might had in the past, which is soft, artisanal, and carefully made. Second: I love the simplicity here just three or maybe four ingredients that you can actually taste and enjoy in your pizza. Third: You can feel the quality of the ingredients the olives, for instance, have this mediterranean strong taste, or the cheese so soft, fresh and creamy. Finally, the size of the pizza is enough for two people and the prices are fine considering the quality! Even though I'm not supposed to eat gluten as a daily basis cause it gives me allergies, im willing to take the risk once in a while and come here for more delicious pizza, so i'll come back!
author: Janet S.

description: True italian dough. Best pizza place I ever been. And Im originally from Brazil, which has a huge Italian colony. Just amazing fresh dough.
author: tennyson p.

description: Super mega excellent place!!! A+++ The taste of food and the prices are great! It seems that its the best italian restaurant in the city! I recommend to every body!
author: Vladimir T.

description: Ordered on Postmates on a rainy day and it was 200% worth it. From the deliciously moist Tiramisu to end from the soft mozzarella to start or pizza thin cryst melting in your mouth, definitely worth trying.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: This place was so, so good. I am not a pizza lover but my husband is and on our anniversary trip to SF I wanted him to have a great pizza. We had the prosciutto pizza and it was divine. It's because of amazing pizza joints like this that I can't get behind eating at chain places. I will be dreaming of this place until we return.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I've been craving a thin wood fired Italian style pizza for weeks now.  After spending the morning at Cal Academy, I decided to head to North Beach.  Nothing completes a nerdy day in SF for me than visiting City Lights bookstore.  Judging by the pictures on Yelp, I could tell this was the pizza I wanted to try.  

My husband and I split a Prosciutto pizza and a Diavola pizza.  Both were really delicious.  The highlights were the dough and the mozzarella.  Although both were good, we both agreed that the Prosciutto was our favorite.  The flavor combination of mozzarella, arugula, prosciutto, and shaved parmesan made for a delightful pizza. I would definitely recommend this place and might even be back next time I'm in North Beach.
author: Amelia V.

description: Good. Great pizza and the pasta carbonara was just like what I've had in Rome. Service needs some straightening. You shouldn't have to witness servers yelling to the kitchen angrily from across the room. I'm just saying.
author: Lauren D.

description: Best pizza I've ever had in my life! The service is amazing and the atmosphere is even better! 10/10
author: David T.

description: The pizzas are excellent! The crust is perfection. They take their pizza making seriously. The owner/manager is on top of everything. I would do it family style order a few pizzas and share on the table so you get the different tastes. Will be back.
author: Eli B.

description:
Took my daughters for dinner last night and the food was amazing! From the pizza to the burrata. The meatballs too. 
My new favorite place in the city
author: King A.

description: Too noisy, lousy service, very busy but by the time you want a 2nd drink of water or whatever, your pizza is eaten
author: Bob G.

description: I lived in the east coast my whole life.  I've had pizza all over NY and DC/MD/VA and this is the best Neapolitan-style pizza I've had so far.  Pupatella's in DC comes very close.  They both use a very similar oven.  Flown in from Italy.  Doesn't get more authentic than that.  I'd suggest eating at the bar, watching the pizzas being made and seeing your own being put together adds so much more value to your dining experience.  If I ever come back to SF I probably will return to this amazing pizza joint even though there are so many other places I haven't tried.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: The best pizza I've ever had in my life!!! It cooks in 90 seconds in their wood burning oven. Nice crust and the freshest ingredients. Calamari is the bomb. Really nice staff who will do their best to get you seated when it's busy. I went their 3x in a month with various friends. Real Italians at the helm in our beautiful North Beach.
author: Katrena M.

description: The margarita pizza and burrata appetizer are my go to and are simply amazing. The service is also always great here.
author: H K.

description: Margherita pizza was as good as I've had in Rome, Milan and Naples.  Cheese, sauce, basil, dough: all top-notch.  My daughter loved her Il Casaro pizza.  Server was attentive without being overbearing.  Spiedini di Calamari starter was so-so.   Calamari bordered on rubbery, perhaps overcooked.  Music was a little loud.  Will return and try another appetizer.
author: Steve B.

description: This place was fantastic! Great food, great wine. the only downside is that it's so close to a main street and it gets pretty loud. But the people that work there are hands down amazing. Will definely venture back.
author: Ariana L.

description: We're italians and while craving for good authentic pizza we found this place. After a short wait we got a table and..one of the best pizza of our lives. Really. It is like they do it in southern Italy, with great ingredients and still a reasonable price. We cannot recommend this place more!!
author: Matteo B.

description: Wow - I think I've found my new pizza place.  I ordered delivery via Postmates and everything was delicious and extremely well priced (aside from PM upcharges).  Highly recommend.  Can't wait to go in person.
author: Ellen H.

description: THE. BEST. PIZZA. The wife and I have made this somewhat of a go-to spot for Sunday night dinners. Pizza is excellent, authentic wood-fired Italian style. In fact everything we've tried here from the Burrata, the roasted cauliflower, and the pasta is very well done. And the service is always friendly. Looking forward to many more meals here.
author: Jonathan E.

description: With a million restaurants to choose from this one is a must. The pizza is delish and the beet salad was fabulous. Great service too!
author: Deanne B.

description: There wood fired prosciutto & arugula pizza and the sautéed calamares are absolutely fresh and delicious! Go. Now.
author: Kristy M.

description:
It really doesn't get much better than this. If you want some really great brick oven, authentic thin crust pizza for a great price, go here. Everything I tried was amazing. I tried a couple different pizzas which were all amazing. I loved the crust and the sauces for each unique pizza flavor. I would have to say however, the best tasting thing i put in my was the calzone. Possibly the best calzone i have ever tried. 

Next time you're in SF, give this place a try
author: Christian G.

description: Most authentic Italian Pizzeria in the Bay Area. I'm a very credible source as I'm full Italian. Trust me it doesn't get much better than this place! Nothing fancy but just great food!
author: Robert A.

description:
Rarely. Rarely do you go to a restaurant that hits all the right notes, so much so that it sweeps you away; away from the hustle and bustle of city life, away from the noise that is your cell phone ringing with weekend, work emails.

The food was fresh and worth twice the price. The wine was the perfect pairing. 

The service was attentive, kinda, patient and knowledgeable.

The ambiance was understated and yet charming none the less.

Thank you, IL Casaro.and our server Agustina.
author: Cole T.

description: I am addicted to this place. I eat here once a week-twice if I am lucky. The employees are all very friendly and I never have to wait long to get my food.  I get the prosciutto and arugula pizza with no cheese. The roasted cauliflower is so good, I think it has chili oil mixed in to it. My mouth is watering as I type this ....Five stars for sure.
author: T A.

description:
We were here on opening nite couple years ago and were so impressed that we had to go again on this visit to SF. Sadly, we aren't inclined to go again.
We were there around 5pm tonight when we were rushed through our meal despite the mostly empty restaurant. Our undercooked and not memorable (soggy in the middle) pizzas arrived before we had finished our appetizers: roasted cauliflower (good) and frito mare (not a repeat; the 3 little sand dabs were ok but the fried zucchini was more like a tasteless garnish). And the glass of Primitivo was good, but a little expensive at $8 given the small size of the pour.
Sad to see a restaurant with promise go downhill.
author: Don N.

description: Got the burrata, Castelvetrano olives, and a glass of Fuedi Zitari Nero d'Avola. It was all delicious and their wine expert gave great advice on a full-bodied, earthy red.
author: Bronwen A.

description: Excellent wood buring oven pizza and the mozzarellas were melt in your mouth! Service was very fast! Try the homemade pepperoncini oil on your pizza. Molto buona!
author: Jacque S.

description: Looking for authentic Italian pizza? This is your place. The margherita pizza was delicious. Airy and crispy with a mild wood smokey flavor.  It was soft in the middle from the sauce, cheese and olive oil but is to be expected in that type of pizza. The staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions and it was entertaining to watch the tossing of the dough. The pizza and a glass of wine came to $22 and worth it. I suggest sitting at the bar and watching the food prep. I will be back to try the calzone!
author: Sue Ann F.

description:
Delizioso...yes...with a z, in Italian!

Given Il Casaro is still a new comer to the North Beach scene, and is situated in arguably the most competitive Italian eats spot in the city, I was slightly skeptical.  

What unfolded on my first visit was pure bliss! A cozy setup with a spacious bar area, a few communal tables, and several two and four-tops. A couple TVs scattered throughout too. We gobbled up the arancini, burrata, and a pizza.  The housemade burrata was legit! They pride themselves on the homemade cheese, so this was a must-try. Delicious, creamy, and paired excellently with arugula and toasted bread. The food was rich, but nothing a little wine couldn't fix. Well-priced options by the glass, carafe, or bottle. Service was on point and super friendly. 

Definitely a very authentic spot, with pleasant service and a well-rounded, fairly price menu.  Plus...burrata!! Will for sure be back for some more Italian eats.
author: Brianna M.

description: The thin crust pizzas remind me so much of the pizzas I had in Italy. The classic margherita was delicious and the prosciutto had a whole lot of cheese and meat on it. The servers were super nice and you can watch the pizzas be made right in front of you! Only downside is the size of the place and it took a while for the pizza to come out. Pizzas are about $14-$18 and it was perfect for three people to split two.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I've been here several times with my girlfriend as our go-to pizza place and once in a while with other friends or family. We love it and always impresses our out of town guests. 

The service is prompt and friendly. We never run out of water / drinks or wonder where the check is.
My favorite is the Diavola pizza but it is definitely spicy. That water helps. I've come here during a wait list and we were seated within 15 minutes or so, not bad for SF.
author: Micah S.

description: Great pizza, great service! We got two vegetarian pizzas, and the quality of the ingredients was obvious. Two pizzas were enough to feed 3 people.
author: Vishnu R.

description:
Love this place! North Beach is obviously the best neighborhood to go to when craving Italian food. But you don't always want just a slice of pizza and you don't always want an expensive sit down experience. This is the perfect in-between. A friend of mine and I just wandered in one day and have been back a few times since! They do simple Italian pizzas that come out pretty fast. Have a decent wine and beer selection. The Buffalo appetizer is soooo yummy. 

The service is great too! Everyone is really friendly and laid back. We went in once right before a Giants WS game and ordered a Margarita pizza. The chef made the cheese into the SF logo because we were clearly big fans. So sweet! 5 stars all around :)
author: Mandy A.

description: Excellent pizza. The burrata is to die for. Best in the city so far.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Just got blown away by the food here! Definitely some of the best Italian I've had.

I went in around 3pm and it was very quiet so service was not lacking.

I ordered the bruschetta and the imported burrata, and was surprised by the portion sizes of each - together it was more than enough food for one person.

The bruschetta was lovely, sweet red onions, and soft red capsicum and zucchini over velvety ricotta. The crispy, chewy bread was the perfect texture to accompany the soft toppings and wasn't soggy at all.

I would recommend coming here for the imported burrata alone. Absolutely gorgeous. I thought I'd died and gone to heaven. It was creamy and silky soft with still a little elasticity. One of the most wonderful things I've ever put in my mouth.

Everything was well worth what I paid and the staff were friendly and efficient. Highly recommended.
author: Katy M.

description: Went here for date night and it's a great spot on north beach. No queue and we walked in and were seated straight away. We ordered the cauliflower, meatballs and salad to start. We didn't need the salad as was a bit too basic but the meatballs were on spot and the cauliflower made me see it in a new light! We shared a pizza and the base was dough-licious! Service was efficient and friendly and we each had a pint of peroni and shared a scoop of creamy chocolate Italian ice cream... Bringing our bill to $64! Was worth it and reasonably priced, I would recommend.
author: Nicola T.

description:
We came here for an early dinner while near Chinatown, and just loved the place! We almost came back for a late dinner, but then figured two pizzas in a day would be too much. 

We started off with the fennel and orange salad which was very light and fresh, and also the fried mozzarella. The fried mozzarella were soo perfectly golden brown and served with a delicious marinara on the side. 

The buffaletta pizza (essentially normal mozzarella) was just amazing. It had just the right amount of cheese and sauce, and you could tell it was baked in a real brick oven. I was craving another slice all day!
author: Sara A.

description:
Early Friday night dinner and we searched Yelp for a good Pizza around North Beach and up came Il Casaro.  We got there early so there was no wait.  We ended up sitting at the bar stools which was fine.  The facility is very inviting, looked very clean and had a great atmosphere.  Staff was friendly, helpful and attentive.  We had a light dinner of Fried Mozz and a Margarita Pizza.  Both were delicious.  Price was reasonalbe.

Very happy we came by and will go back.
author: Drew M.

description: This was amazing.  Perfect thin crust, small fresh mozzarella, limited basil and wonderful light Olive oil.   Wonderful service, extremely clean atmosphere with a good low volume of trendy, positive music.  A great place to share, or devour alone and walk out feeling wonderful.
author: Drew W.

description: If your in little Italy and your looking for a great experience and good food and considerate priced menu than this is your spot. We ate at the bar top right next to the pizza oven and we had a blast watching the pizzas being made. We tried a mozzarella dish as an appetizer and loved it. We really had fun in the atmosphere they provide here and the pizza was great too! Great service as well. Perfect little Italy experience!
author: Kasey A.

description: The food was perfect and the waitress was the nicest. Totally worth every cent spent there. Amazing
author: Filip S.

description: We had the burrata cheese appetizer and pizza...everything was so fresh...straight from Italy!  I highly recommend it!!
author: Lynn G.

description:
Quite frankly this place has better pizza than Tony's (yup I said it). The owner is a very nice guy and also owns Vicoletto which is an equally awesome restaurant across the street (just slightly upper scale). 

Very authentic Italian (and I know Italian) pizza. The restaurant is literally full of Italian people who go there to get a memory of what good food tastes like. 

They have mozzarella di bufala and burrata that is also hard to find in surrounding restaurants, despite being North Beach. 

A pizza staple, I approve.
author: Michelle A.

description:
