The burratta is to die for and the pizza dough / pizzas are heavenly. Great new spot from a SF veteran. 

Also very reasonably priced!
author: Scott M.

description: Searched for San Francisco restaurants that had tables available on Christmas Day. Landed on IL Casaro based on reviews and availability that day as listed through Yelp reservations. Made a 330 reservation which we received confirmation about and even received a text asking us to re-confirm the day before, which we did ("Don't forget! You have plans for tomorrow at 3:30PM for 2 at IL Casaro Pizzeria...Reply 1 to confirm"). Imagine our surprise and disappointment when we walked across town after a movie to find the place closed. Is it too much to expect a modern reservation system to accurately reflect what is actually available on any given day, including holidays? We realize many restaurants are closed on Christmas Day, but certainly not all (The Stinking Rose across the street was open, for instance). We were so looking forward to spending part of our Christmas Day at Il Casaro Pizzeria, but were left with a very bad taste in our mouths instead.
author: bob b.

description: I've just eaten here once but I'm definitely willing to come back: best pizza ever.
author: Lea G.

description: I am italian and I have tried soo many pizza places. I can finally say I have found great pizza, Napoli style! I suggest you to try the burrata too, it is amazing!
author: Micol R.

description:
Environment: In the heart of little Italy! The tables were a little small though especially if you're all eating pizza. Definitely somewhere to grab a quick bite.

Food: Very good! Pizza diavolo and calzones were both good! If you're thinking about ordering the lasagne you should order 2 because they are bite-sized!

Price: A little steep at around 13-18$ a pizza depending on what you get. 

Occasion: We were a group of 7 friends meeting up in San Francisco. Came to sit down and have an early dinner together.

Overall: Sadly one of our orders didn't go through and ended up never coming out. But the owner comp'd ALL of our meals for us! That was like 200$! Grazzi!
author: Ryosuke K.

description: Great pizza place! Very authentic and not pretencious. Quality and well set with a good atmosphere. I come here regulary and always have a great time.
author: Gonzalo C.

description: Best place to eat around North Beach! Cozy atmosphere, our server Yasmin was very nice and friendly to us her excellent service made our night a memorable one, definitely coming back with more friends next time. Burata plate, prosciutto pizza and Panna cotta is my favorites but I'm going to try the carbonara pasta next time!
author: Ilker C K.

description: They do not offer the seafood pizza anymore. That was one of the reasons why we went there . The pizza was tasty but very soggy. The waitress was very nice. I won't recommend it.
author: Angelica D.

description: The owner has great attention to detail with the food quality, presentation, and the ambiance in the store. The margherita pizza was fantastic and the wait staff attentive. Overall extremely pleasant experience -- quick food prep and delicious pizza -- just what I wanted. Probably going to Postmate some more of it to my house tomorrow!! Awesome place.
author: Bridget P.

description:
Very tasty 
I enjoy from the pizza!
The olive oil also great taste
Price is OK .
Good place to Chile and eat!
author: Aviv H.

description:
Went to this place after the Beach Blanket Babylon show and holy cannoli were we ever THRILLED!!!

The imported burrata -- $9.75 for one of THE MOST INCREDIBLE bites of food I have EVER experienced!  Creamy, smooth, with a touch of olive oil and salted to perfection leaving it ridiculously delicious... Served with yummy freshly toasted bread, arugula, and cherry tomatoes that make the whole thing taste fresh and balanced.  I am NOT kidding -- this is an item NOT to be missed!!!

Prosciutto pizza -- some of the best tasting prosciutto I have ever had the privilege of putting in my mouth, again with arugula and tomato for freshness, and mozzarella and parmesan cheeses worth coming back for. This one was a huge win.

Bufalina pizza -- their most popular pizza, with tomato, buffalo mozzarella, EVOO, and fresh basil. I'll be honest -- while tasty and clearly made with high quality, fresh ingredients, this one's pretty plain/standard tasting and I would definitely recommend going to the Prosciutto instead.

Great service. Casual, clean, modern feel (which happens to be my style so I was obviously a fan).  And the price is RIGHT!!! All the food above plus a bottle of Primativo left three of us just $85 in the hole -- a complete value in this fine city!
author: Alicia K.

description: Oh my, this is great! Had the Diavola (mozzarella, tomato sauce, spicy salami), Polpette Al Sugo  (meatballs, Napoletean Sugo) and a glass of Nero Davola, Feudi Zitari (red)... Transported to Italy...!
author: Michael M.

description:
Simply the best pizza in town! If you love Neapolitan pizza, you probably already know Tony's pizza, Mozzeria, una pizza napoletana, Del Popolo, etc... I love them all but Il Casaro is THE best!

I'd recommend to order a Buffalina with a Spritz! This is without a doubt one of the best restaurant in SF!
author: Dimitri S.

description:
In my opinion this pizza restaurant is better than tony's - value for money in any case! We come here a lot and it's perfect and cozy whether alone, with one friend or ten. They take reservations and make things happen for you - even last minute. 
When you come here next, try their starters too - we love the mozzarella, meatballs ...
author: Larissa S.

description: Delicious margherita pizza! Great for lunch, sat by the window and enjoyed the weather.
author: Victoria B.

description: My two friends and I went out on the town to find a good place to eat in Little Italy. We saw some good reviews from this place, saw they were known for pizza and mozzarella, and were instantly sold. We walked in and were instantly impressed with the feel and ambience of the place. It was very contemporary and I guess you would say "trendy". We were put on a short wait and were seated. Our server was incredibly Italian and we loved her. She told us to order an appetizer and two pizzas. Loving her the way we did, we followed her advice. We chose a Affettati Di Salumi Mortadella and Mozzarella Fior Di Latte and were incredibly satisfied. They have a delicious pepper oil for dipping that we needed seconds of. We then ordered both the Diavola and the Prosciutto pizzas. After enjoying the deliciousness that were those pizzas, we were stuffed and couldn't enjoy dessert of coffee. But I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and look forward to returning to try their dessert and coffee! Please check this place out.
author: Alex C.

description:
I am always on the hunt for a great wood fired pizza place, as they are very hard to come by amongst the slew of mediocre pizza in SF. This is one of my favorite finds. The crust is chewy, bubbly, and thin, yet puffy and flecked with charred edges from its trip into the wood fired oven.

We shared two pizzas, the Il Casaro (a white pizza) and the Prosciutto. I couldn't decide on a favorite. Both were perfect, with bubbly crust and fresh, authentic Italian toppings.

Bonus: I loved the Calabrian chiles that they brought to the table, for FREE! They are served in oil, are tangy, and have quite a kick (not for people who are sensitive to spicyness!).

Happy Hour: They also have a happy hour with $10 dollar pizzas from 3-5!!!!!!!!!!!

I will definitely return soon.
author: Chloe A.

description:
Absolutely delicious and authentic ITALIAN pizza. (Not American). Their Bufalina pizza was pricey for the size but absolutely delicious. Surprised at the jump in price since a regular  and delicious Margherita pizza is just $13 but if you get the buffalo mozzarella on it instead (making it a Bufalina) it is bumped up to $18!!! But absolutely fantastic pizza that is incomparable in the Bay Area. 

Also, the pizza comes out super fast. After they make it, it only goes into the oven for like 1 minute !
author: Shay S.

description: This is authentic to Italian Pizza as it gets.  We felt like we were back in Florence, Italy.  Our whole family loved it!!
author: Marshall F.

description: We came  il casaro with a party of 8 and service was excellent! We had three amazing pizzas: margarita, Proscuito and capriciosa and the three of them were delicious! We definitely recommend this place!!!
author: Yvonne M.

description: It's all its cracked up to be. Authentic  food, authentic service.  All fresh ingredients.  It doesn't get any better in North Beach. There may be "just as good" at some of the other premium North  Beach eateries. But this one is definitely up for your To Do do list.
author: John K.

description:
I have never been somewhere that made me feel so compelled to write a review on yelp. 

My husband and I recently moved to CA from Italy. We miss the fresh cheeses and prosciutto, the pizza dough with two day rising times and the simple quality ingredients.  It was so wonderful to stumble upon il Casaro on our trip to SF. 
    
   Il Casaro has the best pizza we have had since moving here, and it is better than many a pizza in Italy.  The atmosphere is perfect, staff fantastic. 


Saluti a Salvatore e Francesco! Grazie per una serata meravigliosa.
author: Amanda G.

description: Very nice pizza,basicly like at home! Too bad the egg plant were a bit burned. I appreciated a lot that they have the original chinotto from Liguria. Nice people working there. Defenetly worth a stop!
author: Giù C.

description: So good! Pizza that took me back to what we had in Rome. The prosciutto pizza is fantastic. We also had a margherita pizza and a tuna pizza that were very good. The burrata mozzarella and grilled calamari were also nice. My one year old gobbled the squid! It was served grilled with vegetables and delicious olive oil and tomatoes.  The service was friendly and quick without making us feel rushed. Good wine also.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
I've eaten at all the SF pizza places: Una Pizza Napoletana, Zero Zero, Delfina, Del Popolo, etc, and this is place is now tied with Una Pizza Napoletana as my favorite pizza spot in the city. 

My Italian friend (from Venice) and his Italian friends claim this is the best pizza in San Francisco, and I think they probably have a good baseline for pizza. I was lucky enough to dine here with my Italian friend and really loved everything. I was surprised for such an unassuming place on Columbus Ave., and delicious, that it wasn't more crowded. I normally dislike a lot of the super touristy Italian places along Columbus, but this place is a gem and the food is delicious.

We started out with the burrata, which is super fresh and delicious, and comes with 4 slices of bread (basically pizza dough without any sauce or cheese). The margherita pizza had fresh mozzarella on top, tomato sauce, and basil and they did the crust just right - not burnt, not too soggy, and just plain delicious.

Great tiramisu and prosecco to round out the meal. 5 stars for an authentic experience that isn't stupidly crowded with long lines, all at reasonable prices. I'm looking forward to the next time I can come back here, and have been recommending it to my friends.
author: Christina L.

description: The service and ambiance was fantastic (got a table much sooner than expected), but the pizza was just okay. This pizzas we ordered came out underdone, so we asked if we could have them baked for a little bit longer. When they finally came out the crust was a bit burnt, and the flavor was nothing spectacular.
author: Umeet S.

description: I would not give the place the same high rating others have. A little lax about online orders. They had not started my order when I showed up 10 mins late for pickup time. The pizza was undercooked and plain. Nothing special.
author: DB R.

description: Loved it!  Went here for lunch with some coworkers, there were seven of us and we shared three of the delicious pizzas.  It was the perfect amount and they were all really great.  Service was friendly and lunch was really affordable.  Will definitely be visiting again soon.
author: Rachel J.

description: Just wooow  one of the best pizza in SF. They are so friendly and they have the yummiest pizza ever. You should definitely try the prosciutto pizza which was  so so good and super tasty
author: Sara K.

description: I came here with my friend after a long day of walking. We were famished and craving pizza. Il casaro not only hit the spot with fresh ingredients, our personalized pizza was ready in less than 10 minutes. I will be returning ASAP!!!!
author: Samantha H.

description: I expected more, and it definitely fell short of 'wow'. We ordered meatballs, and 2 pizzas - the Il Casaro, and the Broccoli sausage. Ingredients were fresh, and i love that they provide a house made chili oil as a condiment. Meatballs were fine, although i've had more moist/tender. The price point was very good.  The downfall for me, was that both pies tasted noticeably "off"... I could only trace it to a burnt/untasty crust on both. Without this unpleasant burnt flavor which overpowered the intended flavor profile of the pizza, both would have been  ok for me, even if i prefer a crustier, less pillowy dough.  It just feels as though there are some fundamentals still lacking here. I prefer other pies in North Beach.
author: Mel W.

description:
I went to Il Casaro a few weeks ago and I being from Europe I have to say this is probably as close to original italian pizza as it gets! 
Crispy and flavorful thin crust yummy pizza at a great price!

The menus is small but that's actually a plus because they can really focus on making those dishes they serve perfect! 
The service staff was very attentive and friendly. The kitchen/pizza oven is part of the restaurant so you can see the whole preparation process of your meal and the ingredients they use are fresh and of good quality. 
We had the Pizza Tonno (actually this was part of the reason I went there because this type of pizza is hard to find in SF) and the Pizza Diavola and they tasted soooo good. 

I will definitely go back!
author: Angua U.

description: We ordered two pizzas for delivery. The crust was burned completely on one of the pizzas. While the sauce and toppings were nice, the taste of burned dough was overwhelming. The first pizza was okay but the second was very disappointing.  We won't be ordering again.
author: Peter S.

description: If you crave good neapolitan pizza and find yourself in North Beach, look no further. I've been there several times, for both lunch and dinner, and the pizza is always excellent. Service is always good as well, I like that the waiting staff doesn't stop by the table every 5 minutes asking if everything is alright.
author: Ana K.

description:
We wanted a light meal and had noticed this new place that featured mozzarella. So we tried a couple of antipasti. The fritto misto was beautifully done calamari with fried thin ribbons of carrot and zucchini and fresh rucola. (arugula) An unusual presentation and very light. The other thing was a puozzolo. (spelling- not sure w/my terrible Italian)
It was a sort of sandwich/wrap using their pizza dough with mozzarella, prosciutto, fresh basil, rucola, and I think a bit of tomato in it. Fabulous and filling!

The table next to us had all Italians making quite a racket as they talked to the staff. Every one of them had a pizza in front of them which they ate with knife and fork. It must have been nice to talk w/people from the homeland. My wife overheard that the owners of this place own another restaurant up the street but we didn't hear which one.

We'll be back to try pizza, there wasn't any wait to get in here on a Sunday afternoon.
The price was also outstanding: $20 for these two antipasti + tip.
author: monk f.

description: authentic oven cooked pizza.  i had the quattro formaggi the cheese just melts in your mouth.  super tasty. a bit pricey though.
author: Giselle G.

description:
Great atmosphere, inviting layout, attentive service and delicious pizza...the only pizza in the hood that even comes close to rivaling Tony's, and with no wait time (yet) or surly hostess to deal with. We had a few different Italian wines at the table, which all complemented the dinner well. 

Started with the asparagus and had a prosciutto pizza. Both were great, though the asparagus was a total rip at $9 (and 6 asparagus spears on the plate). As a NB local who plans to eat here frequently, I hope they adjust some of the pricing -- I'd be willing to pay an extra few bucks for the pizza rather than a ridiculously small appetizer that's $5 anywhere else.

In a neighborhood filled with crappy Italian, Il Casaro is a winner. Will be back often.
author: Alan C.

description: The pizza doesn't get any cooler than at This place. But lest that dissuade you from trekking out from Piers at the bay, let us ease your fears: while this italian made haven continually makes headlines with head-turning stories like the time they unrolled a authentic Italian mozzarella and imported cheeses, to their prosciutto crudo more than lives up its own pizza hype. Wood tables and stone counters by the kitchen lend an air of casualness to the atmosphere here, and their wood-burning oven is prominently displayed. As for the desert? Italian gelato desert feature onsite, and have cemented themselves as a must-eat on any Trip to the city. Absolutely fine Italian cooking!
author: Carlo K.

description:
Holy sweet fuck that Four Cheese Pizza is still on my mind months after eating it. I need to get my pizza loving ass back to Il Casaro because their food is seriously heavenly. Being the pizza enthusiast that I am I take pizza very seriously and I must say that Il Casaro is in my top two favorite pizza places ever. 

The crust is dusted with a bit of flour, delicate crunchy on outside and pillowy soft on the inside. So much delicious cheese on that pizza. I also got the asparagus and goddddddddd damn it was good. And my server Steven WAS THE FREAKING BEST! 

Great service. Great food. Can't go wrong there. I am dying to try their mozzarella next time I go. Which should be today now that I think of it...
author: Haley M.

description:
We stopped in for a quick pre show dinner and thoroughly enjoyed our food.  The pizza buffolina I think it was called and the lasagna. 
I loved the pizza but the lasagna was off the charts.  Without question the best lasagna I've ever eaten!  It was food that you get as a diner and feel gratitude for afterwards.  
The flavor of tomato was so warm and welcoming and the bolognese mixed with it perfectly.  
Bravo!
author: ari b.

description: Pizza made in an old fashioned wood burning oven is the way to go. Every style of pizza I've had here has been amazing. This is the best pizza in the city in my opinion.
author: Kareem S.

description:
Easy to get seated, fairly prompt service. The food, however, was disappointing given the great reviews we read about. We had a couple pizzas, mozzarella, and a panzanella salad. 

The mozzarella was good and the best. The pizza was okay - nothing to go out of your way to try particularly with the plethora of options around you. The panzanella salad was nothing but few greens with the stingiest amount of toppings possible and a few croutons. How is that a panzanella salad and how are they not embarrassed to serve that?  The great reviews mean you're going to try the place anyway, but I'd go elsewhere for Italian food.
author: whatever I.

description: You can't go wrong here.  Salad is good.  Sand dabs were meaty, sweet and tasty.  Burrata is must have - so creamy...  Pizza is the star.  Go!
author: Gloria H.

description:
Was recommended over Tony's and the other great pizza insf.

Went for dinner on a Friday night. Didn't have to wait. Shared fried mozzarella app. Very cheesy and not at all greasy. Tried diavola pizza. Spicy and delicious. A little greasy. 

Great pizza and fun atmosphere.
author: Adam G.

description: We were studying the menu on the window after following a Yelp review. Owner, Francesco, invited us in. Staff was friendly and welcoming and the Neapolitan pizza was amazing! Crisp, yet chewy crust with just the right amount of sauce and cheese. Delicious!
author: Stacy R.

description:
Best new addition to the neighborhood. My husband and frequently dine-in and carry out. I enjoyed it so much that I did a buyout two nights in a row last December. It was a success. 
I don't have kids, but it's nice to see a family friendly spot in the neighborhood. I brought my 2.5 and 4 year old nieces here for dinner one evening, and we were welcomed with a smile. 
Keep up the great work, folks!
author: Heather M.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars.

Whenever we go to Italian Pizzeria, we order Margherita to compare Margheritas.

Their Margherita was so much better than the over rated (in my opinion) Tony's Napoletana down the street, but not even close to Delfina's. 

We'll be back to try some other items on the menu.
author: Wakaknee J.

description: Great fresh ingredients! Had the $18.75 Prosciutto Pizza with delicious fresh prosciutto San Daniele, arugula and Parmigiano cheese. Yum!
author: Staci A.

description:
Came in on Wednesday March 26th, 2014 around 9:45 PM and got an empty seat at the bar. My server, David Y, came by to take my order of an Anchor Steam for $5 plus Proscuitto Pizza for $17 for $22 overall plus tax or $23.93 plus tip.

I sat at the counter for awhile awaiting my drink as numerous employees passed over a 15 minute period. Finally, one of the kitchen staff members who was cooking right in front of me asked if I had placed my order and I mentioned that the server had taken it. It appears that the server forgot to put in my order which was a reason for the decline in stars in this review.

Overall, the pizza was quite tasty and spot on especially compared to Una Pizza Napoletana for example at the price point. I'd recommend if in the area.
author: Brian D.

description:
Very disappointed. A friend said there was this new pizzeria and it was OK. Not great, OK. I agree. They have a wood-fired oven which is good.

I got a seat at the counter and enjoyed watching the pizzaiolo make the pizze. It took a while to get a menu and order. I ordered the pizza magrherita and a beer. They have like six beers on tap and two in bottles but the waiter said they were out of all the beers except for Sierra Pale Ale. How can you be out of seven beers?

I saw they were slicing the pizze before delivery. How odd, I thought. So, I leaned toward the glass and told the pizzaiolo that I didn't want my pizza cut. So, naturally, he cut it and handed it to me over the glass. I should have refused it, but I didn't. Big mistake. The reason you don't cut the pizza is so that the soggy middle doesn't seep under the crust and make it soggy and that's exactly what happened. 

Also, for my taste, it was a little too undercooked and doughy. They have a marinara pizza listed with ingredients other that just sauce and garlic. HUH? What kind of marinara pizza is that? 

The price was OK at $13.00 for the pizza and $6.00 for the beer.

The search continues for authentic Napolitano pizza in San Francisco. Obviously, it's not here and I will never go back.
author: Tom T.

description: Delicious pizza and amazing, amazing, AMAZING burrata. Everything is perfectly flavored. Reasonable prices and quick service. Just ate there but already craving more.
author: Nethra V.

description: High quality really authentic Italian food. I have lived in north beach for three years and  have also traveled to Italy and this restaurant stands out in the bunch. Come here if you love and admire the simplicity of Italian cuisine- the way it should be. AMAZING mozzarella!!!
author: Andrea F.

description: Short staffed but the one waiter did a phenomenal job single handedly to keep the operations going. It was quite busy. The service is great, food is fresh and ....... Highly recommend for a wholesome pizza and salads. We had pizza, burratta and asperagi.
author: Ayaz L.

description: You know when sometimes you choose a place because of how it looks and later check the review? Il Casaro pulled us in by its curb appeal. We stayed and ate more than just the appetizers we planned on because the food was so good. Mozzarella and calamari apps led to prosciutto mushroom pizza. What a great find on our walk around SF today.
author: Kat M.

description: My favorite spot in North Beach. In a sea of cheesy/touristy Italian joints, Il Casaro is an oasis of authenticity and deliciousness. Everyone I have ever brought here has raved about it and asked to go back. The prosciutto pizza is a must; the sausage pie and pasta with ragu are right behind it.
author: John D.

description: Love the food here.  We usually go when it is early afternoon so less crowded.  That being said, we really enjoyed the food and the service.  My daughter absolutely loves the mozzarella and prosciutto.
author: April M.

description: I have literally had dreams about their burratta. I went while visiting San Francisco and was so impressed by the food. Service was pleasant but forgetful... Maybe it was an off day?
author: Sara H.

description:
partially scared to write such a glowing review of this place, because i love how i can pretty much always get a table in 15-20 mins max, even on a saturday night.  however, everyone must know about the best pizza in SF!!!  

this place crushes delfina, beretta, tonys and zero zero.  the crust has the most perfect texture - both light/fluffy, yet chewy at the same time.  and the san marzano tomato sauce is super fresh, bright and flavorful.   

OMG the proscuitto pizza with san daniele prosciutto, arugula, tomato, mozzarella, raspa dura is probably my favorite.  i have also had he broccolini/salsiccia and the norma (fried eggplant), which are both delicious and perfect.  although i typically  prefer my burrata a little glammed up (with honey and hazelnuts), i still think the burrata here is also some of the best i have had in SF (served with arugula, olive oil, pizza crust triangles)

I also like how they are very generous with the toppings, unlike delfina.  their wines are pretty good too!
author: Olivia T.

description: This is the best pizza in San Francisco. Trust me, I'm italian!
author: Selena S.

description:
If you want to experience a pizza, that is even better than most places serve in Europe/Italy - this is the place to go! Simply amazing, thin, crispy, flavorful! Also the burrata is a MUST try (add some nice cold cut meats and share as a starter, you will not regret it...)!
Service is great, I was there a couple of times and always welcomed very warmly. Steven is a great server!
Only thing I would recommend is keeping it open a little bit longer than 9:30 for new seatings!
Summary: forget the americanized, mediocre tourist pizza at Tonys and treat yourself with something that truly deserves this name!
author: Luca E.

description: If you're looking for authentic delicious pizza this is the place to visit. Great customer service and affordable prices.
author: Tamra S.

description: This place is the closest thing to Italy we have found in the US. The owner is Italian and takes great pride in his food. It has delicious pizza and appetizers. We were so impressed with our authentic and how similar the food was to the Italian food we had in Italy. This is a must eat in San Fran! Great service, friendly, and a must do!
author: Kaysi B.

description: Mmmm so delicious! Some of the best pizza I've ever had! Definitely a keeper!
author: Chelsea H.

description: Excellent spot.  Their appetizers were fantastic. I got the calamari and the burrata with salami. They both came with a flat bread and were garnished with arugula and cherry tomatoes. The pizza was great as well. The crust was chewy and the sauce had very good flavor. Our waitress was fantastic as well. She new the menu very well. I will definitely go back.
author: Jack M.

description:
Please see bomb items below:
Quartto formaggi
Fritto misto (super bomb)
Peroni
Cannoli
Service

Respectfully,
author: Jared R.

description: Honestly the food was great.. I had the pasta and it was delicious. This is a review of the owner. It is an open kitchen where you can watch the pizzas being made in front of you.. One of the pizza makers I guess made a mistake or was going too slow (myself and two other tables were there- not crowded at all). The owner started screaming at him in Italian- so embarrassing for the chef- and the owner didn't stop.. He kept going and going until the man making the pizza walked out.. I have no idea what they were saying but it was incredibly unprofessional and ruined my experience. I understand they want things in a orderly manner but to scream at the man in front of everyone was humiliating and straight bullying. My waitress apologized for my bread being delayed and I said the man yelling was more of a disappointment then my bread taking a few minutes longer. I appreciate good food, but I appreciate the treatment of employees better. If you cannot handle your employees in a kind and curious manner (especially in public) you have no business running a restaurant.
author: Megan P.

description: Very slow service and brought us soggy clod pizza!! Waitress came to our table saying you finished your pizza?? But we never got it and then brought us an old cold soggy pizza!
author: Claire B.

description: Yum!!! We are here now and sooo happy that we listened to the other Yelp reviews and came!!  Great vibe and service backed by excellent food!!!
author: Shay C.

description: Amazing pizza! Hubby and I had the margherita pizza and  spaghetti carbonara which were both delicious. Hands down, best wood fired pizza in Cali.
author: Angie R.

description: The dreamy burrata appetizer comes with a delicious focaccia bread. Il Casaro pizza with mozzarella and prosciutto was very good. Service was good. The only thing I think was lacking a bit was the atmosphere. It was a rather stark, modern decor. Not unpleasant, just not particularly charming.
author: P S.

description: Really a wonderful place.   We have been here many, many times.  Tania is a great and attentive server and the two many Pizza Chefs are great, although there is a difference in there pizzas, they both are quite good!  We love the calamari as well...  We always leave with a smile.  One of our favorite places in North Beach...
author: Capra C.

description: Great pizza with a crust that makes you crave for your next bite like a perfectly chilled rose on a warm summer night. Good prices and fresh flavor all while watching patrons pass up and down Columbus. If you want pizza in North Beach, pul in here. The Diavola pizza was awesome!
author: Gary P.

description: Carbonara was perfect!! The pizzas really good and tasty. The yellow beets salad is cool and refreshing. But, the music is so loud. This is the reason why we didn't ranked 5 stars. Highly recommended!
author: Pau C.

description:
Excellent pizza ! Our group had some burrata with prosciutto to share, one of the best I've had.
And the pizzas... I've been looking for a good calzone for a couple years now in both NYC and SF, and the calzone at Casaro blew them all out the water, the last calzone I had that can compete was in Roma. Kudos to the chief !
The other non-calzone pizzas were also excellent, great crust and ingredients.

Il Casaro is one of many reason that makes me want to move to SF once and for all !
author: Charles M.

description:
Great addition for Napoli style pizza lovers in town - and it's in North Beach! 
Forget about the 2hrs line to get to Tony's, few blocks away, and enjoy a yummy pizza with a reasonable price (at the time of this review a classic Margherita is just $13). I love the tables next to the main window, because it's almost like being outside, without being in the way of people walking by. 
Definitely worth a try!
author: Steve E.

description:
We ate a marvelous margarita pizza that matched or might even be more delicious than delfina. We paired the perfect pizza with a plate of mortadella. All of this for a reasonable price. The service was friendly and attentive. 

My wife also enjoyed the sounds of her favorite bands that set an authentically cool ambience. 

We'll definitely be back.
author: Cheester O.

description:
As others point out, IL Casaro has tasty food. Compliments to ownership and staff. Wait staff groomed and polite.

And I want to say it is a very cool - architecturally organized - space in which to dine. Compliments to the designing architect(s) and decorator. I was walking by on a beautiful day, passed it, light went on in my head, stopped, turned, and knew it would be a very nice space in which to have lunch. It was, and I highly recommended it.
author: Steve G.

description: If you are a pizza lover, you might want to try this place. Great pizza, great appetizers, good wine and coffee. The staff is friendly and easy to talk to. Just ask for suggestions when you don't know what pizza to have, they are all great pizza!
author: Vitalie S.

description: Best woodfired pizza in North Beach. You will not be disappointed! The combinations are delicious and the bases are perfect.
author: Sarah B.

description: The food gets 5 stars. The slow service gets 3 stars. The owner or manager keeping the door open on a 40 degree day, even reopening it after a customer politely closed it:/ was really rude! I would order out from here but wouldn't go in to get treated badly.
author: Marissa H.

description: I work in the neighborhood and Il Casaro is my favorite spot to grab  a bite before I have to work in the bar all night. I usually come with my coworker and our usual order is, asparagus, olives, burrata and we usually choose a different pizza every time. Never disappointed. I think the Tonna (tuna)  is my personal favortie.  Great service,affordable and  great food every time.  Keep up the good work guys!
author: Karlee D.

description:
I really don't understand why tripadvisor rates Il Casaro #3 in San Francisco. My experience was ok. We had Margherita pizza which was not bad, I would give it a good rating if it wasn't for the huge amount of crust on the edge which is not very tasty and just fills up your stomach and makes you fat. There are no pictures on the wall so it somehow feels empty not finished. Service was friendly and very fast.
I might go back to try out other menu items.
author: Guido W.

description: What's better than a great restaurant? A great restaurant that's great CONSISTENTLY. I hate it when I hype up a restaurant and bring someone there only to have it serve subpar to my expectations. I brought my family here at the most random time - 3 pm and it was just as good as it always is! Probably the best pizza in the city.
author: Margaret L.

description: Pizza is delicious! Love it! Service was awesome too. I will be coming back to the city best pizza in town.
author: Glenda G.

description: Was great the first 5 vists.  then not so great last time. Can't explain what happened, just lacked flavor.  What happened to the happy hour?  Did they discontinue it?  Waitress said the happy hour sign was broken, so no more happy hour???  What?
author: Dna h.

description: 90 seconds flat - yes, that is how long it takes to make your pizza.
author: Natalie S.

description:
By far my favorite pizza in San Francisco! The food and atmosphere take me back to Italy. The owner is very nice and his attention to detail is obvious between the food, presentation and overall ambiance. 

Whenever I have friends or family visiting, this is the first restaurant I think to take them. I always leave il Casaro satisfied. My favorite pizzas are the Norma and the Margherita. This is also my favorite place to get an espresso. Very good quality. 

Enjoy!
author: Tyler E.

description: The owner has some serious attitude issues! I would not recommend coming here, there are much friendlier places that can make good pizza! The staff is very rude too...
author: DVolt B.

description: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!! Great service, very fresh ingredients and you can beat freshly made pizza and pasta! Try the prosciutto pizza and the beet salad! YUMS
author: Gabriela H.

description: Another great dinner at my favorite place in North Beach. My favorite pizza is the Norma, with mozzarella, tomatoes, ricotta salat a and fried eggplant. Good seeing my friends, Francesco and Paulo.
author: Tommy L.

description: No taste, no flavor, serve cold, pizza cook in 45second and burn. In real pizzeria, pizza are cook in 10 min slowly. The atmosphere of the restaurant look like good but the food is not.Dessert (tiramisu) taste of water and no taste of coffee.
author: Pierre-nicolas R.

description: We shared the calamari, roasted cauliflower and prosciutto pizza and all were wonderful! Calamari was oven roasted and so tender it melted in your mouth! Pizza was amazing and the toppings were top notch! Highly recommended for an excellent pizza in SF!
author: Cristin C.

description: I loved the burrata appetizer, but the margarita pizza was a bit too soggy in the middle.
author: Amin S.

description: I had some misgivings about getting pizza in San Francisco just because of the sheer quantity of dining options, and I don't think of the city as a pizza Mecca. But, when The Oracle tells me that is a must try, try it I must. Got the burrata mozzarella and the il Casaro pizza. Beautiful clouds of gooey, delicious mozzarella. Perfect wood fired pizza. So good.  One of the best pizzas I've had and well worth the trip.
author: Ed S.

description: This was an outstanding choice for our pick for lunch on our first day in SF, after sightseeing for the afternoon and so many choices the amazing smell from this adorable small, but very well kept restaurant drew us in. We enjoyed a fantastic Margherita Pizza, the fresh cheese was amazing and the service was impeccable. When we return to SF we will be sure to drop by again.
author: Cindy V.

description: Waited 45 minutes for no food. Waitress rarely checked in on us and kept promising for food to be coming. Then it was the printer's fault on why the food wasn't showing up. Then it was the wrong order. Larger parties arrived later than us and got their food quicker. Somehow we drew the short straw with our clearly inattentive waitress. The food is fantastic, as I have eaten here previously.
author: Shelby C.

description: Excellent family dinner. We had the pizza and pasta. We went on the early side with our kids and it was a great, lively environment. Wish they had child size portions with child size pricing for all the pasta. Service was nice, we will return.
author: Summer B.

description: Great pizza, everything tastes really fresh and delicious. They had a good selection of Italian beers also the burrata was a great portion.
author: Vincenzo C.

description: Enjoyed a delicious pizza with some girlfriends. The dough was fresh and delicious. I love how they make everything right in front of you.
author: Kelly K.

description: First: finding a good pizza (at a level you can have in Italy) is not easy in SF. Second: Even if you find one, does not necessarily means it will be consistent over time. Many started ok and dissolved in few months. Il Casaro is different, not a tourist trap despite being in Columbus, but a truly italian standard pizza with interesting alternative options. And in the past 12 months kept the level. By far the best to me,easily tops Farina, Delfina etc.
author: Elena V.

description:
A hipper, younger more club-atmosphered North Beach Italian eatery than Francesco's A++ restaurant, Vicoletto, a couple of blocks up on Green Street. 

As one of the biggest proponents of Italian buffala cheese and burrata as a host of private dinner parties, I love Il Casro's branding around esoteric and fragrant cheese:

The "Mozzarella Bar"

Gotta love it! :)

The centerpiece of the restaurant is a tiled dome that gleams like a mosque. It is a wood burning oven imported from Naples, Italy -- designed by Stefano Ferrara. 

It took Francesco months to code, ship and get that object of foodie art through U.S. Customs. 

A passion project which a whole city has come to love.
author: Paul A.

description: Pizza was burnt on the crust, bland, flavorless. $60 for two pizzas and one pasta. I honestly wouldn't mind if it was good. Definitely not worth it, go someplace with flavored food. Nice interior and playlist though..
author: J N.

description: Great service and casual dining ambiance. They serve 12 inch pizzas and they are all made very thin (typical of traditional Italian pizzas). Get the burrata cheese!
author: Lucy Y.

description: Went here last night for dinner with a few friends. We were immediately greeted with a warm smile and seated next to the window which made for some great people watching. We started off with some delicious vino and a salad that was lightly dressed and made with very fresh produce. Next was the burrata. Amazing! Then the Quattro formage pizza and the prosciutto pizza. The crust is chewy and thin and so flavorful. You also have to drizzle a little pepper oil to give it a spicy kick! For dessert was the Nutella and banana pizza. Unfortunately they didn't have any bananas so they gave us strawberries instead. They made up for it by following up with tiramisu that was incredible. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for pizza in north beach and I will absolutely return again soon!
author: Kelly B.

description: It was either my bad luck that I didn't go there in the right time or I simply did not pick the right dish. I tried two pizzas here and am really amazed by how this place got so many high reviews....perhaps they got those stars not from their pizzas
author: Omid A.

description: The best pizza this side of Naples. Go with something simple like the margherira or the buffalo to really taste what pizza should be like. So simple but when the best ingredients are used you can really taste the difference. Had the buffalo mozzarella with prosciutto appetizer.  Again they use the best ingredients with simple preparation and that's all it needs.
author: Steve N.

description: Such a great place to eat and have some drinks. Pizza was perfect, wine was great! They had the front windows open which kinda made us feel like we were eating outside. Service was great too!
author: Kristin D.

description:
Mozzarella Bar?? How can you resist? I had been waiting for this place to open! Finally tried it out and went for a late dinner on a Friday night. I can definitely see it being added to our North Beach rotation.

We started with the buffala mozzarella, which was delicious, as expected. Next time, I would try the burrata. For dinner, we got the spicy salami pizza, which was SO good. The flavor of the sauce was perfect. Salami isn't my typical order of choice, but it had a good level of spiciness and was slightly crispy, so it made the simple pizza really flavorful and satisfying.

We were feeling dessert, though they were out of cannolis so we went for the nutella+bananas pizza (it has a fancier name that I can't remember). It turned out they were out of bananas, so they basically brought us a full sized pizza covered in nutella... Not the most elaborate dessert, but we tried a piece (which tasted good, of course) and boxed up the rest to go. Slightly disappointing, but they did comp the dessert on the bill, which was nice. 

Add in a few glasses of wine and it was an excellent semi-casual North Beach meal!
author: Katie E.

description: Fresh food and friendly service, nice setting.  We had the burrata and a basic cheese pizza for the kiddos.  YUM!
author: Kelly H.

description:
In short: this is the best pizza I've had in the States! Went here with a few friends, so we grabbed a few things to share.

We had: the plate of olives, fried asparagus, lardo, wild boar salami, burrata, and the margherita pizza.

The asapagus and burrata were good, but not as amazing as the other items (e.g. the burrata was creamy but not as creamy as other burratas).

-The olives were absolutely to die for! They've clearly been marinating in an absolutely fantastic olive oil with a single red pepper. We were practically licking the oil up after finishing the olives.

- The lardo was amazing! It melts in your mouth and is so fully of flavor.

- The salami was wonderful but let's talk about the star! 

The pizza! The best margherita I've had in such a long time. The ingredients are clearly high quality, the sauce was perfect. The mozzarella is beautifully creamy and flavorful. The crust was wonderful and most importantly...they cooked it beautifully. Just a bit of char on the bottom of the pie but not overdone.
author: Vincent B.

description: Fantastic! My husband and I had appetizers, pasta, pizza, and some wine. Everything was amazing, must stop!
author: Kristina K.

description:
Had a great first time experience here on a Saturday night.  Food was nicely prepared, served quickly and delicious.  Yes the burrata is a must, and the pizzas are all worth trying.  Good choices of beers and a decent wine list with reasonably priced bottles.

Francesco and the other server Andy were great!  Very attentive, friendly and enjoyed making us feel extremely welcomed.  They themselves took this review to Five Stars!  

We will definitely be going back!
author: Peter J.

description: Authentic.  Fabulous experience.  Excellent service by people passionate about their restaurant and food.  Great atmosphere.  Fresh, delicious food!  We'll definitely be back and will recommend IL Casaro to our friends and acquaintances.
author: Margo L.

description: Here with 3 other people during a street festival. Pretty good pizza, good crust, our service was good. I'd come back.
author: Will D.

description:
The best! Everything about this place is amazing. Been living in the neighborhood for 4 years and absolutely my new favorite North Beach Italian restaurant.

Recommend the meatballs, asparagus, tagliatelle, spaghetti carbonara, and diavola pizza! But you can't go wrong.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Inviting sit down restaurant that we just happened to walk into while coasting down Columbus St and were not disappointed!

Walked in to see Italians at the tables, eating dinner. Not too shabby!

The ambiance is a bit modern but not over the top. Inviting but not pretentious. The service itself was attentive and thoughtful.

We had an appetizer, two pizzas and a glass of wine each. 

The asparagus appetizer was very nice (though a bit overpriced) but the kicker was the shaved parmesan that it was served with. That was OUTSTANDING. They even serve a plate of parmesan shavings for $4, I will get that next time. Never knew parmesan could taste that good!

I asked if I could have some Calabrian chiles with my margerita pizza and the server as confused. She went to ask the kitchen and they nodded yes. When the pizza came out it had two chiles in the middle and a side dish of whole chiles in oil. So delicous!

The pizza itself was very good. Good sauce, generous fresh fior de latte cheese and the crust while not full of char and bubbles had decent flavor (just how I like it). If I had a gripe I'd say that the sauce was heavy on liquid so caused the center of the pizza to sag and flop - bit of a fail.

All in all, a very enjoyable experience. I will be back!
author: Raj K.

description: Great pizza and wonderful staff. The wood oven is a marvel sight and the restaurant is clean. Would definitely go back.
author: Sira L.

description: Simply awesome Neapolitan style, wood fired pizzas. In the heart of north beach, so great nightlife vibe surrounding
author: Amar R.

description:
I really enjoyed eating here.  Not only is the food delish (had a simple margherita pizza) but the design of the place is great.  You really get a great idea of how the food is cooked as the cooking surface extends right into the bar's dining surface.  very cool.

definitely a cool new spot in the beach.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Ill keep this brief.  They just opened so they have a few things to work out, nothing major.  
We started with the arranchini (spelling) and another app with the salad.  The salad was the standout.  Really light and good.  
We also shared 4 pizzas.  All of which were great.  I would say the prosciutto pizza was our favorite.  The service was good, they are still running around a bit, but that is too be expected 2 weeks after opening.  If there is a wait, I would recommend waiting, the pizza was really good.  Chewy crust, definitely very fresh, and everything was what you would expect.  I will be going back.
author: Mike G.

description: You. Must. Go. Here. We waltzed in with a party of 11 (7 of which were kids aged 3-11) around 530pm on a Tuesday and this restaurant handled it like a BOSS. No stink eye, no problem when we spilled a cup of lemonade, lots of extra forks/napkins on the table and so on. AND the food is amazing.  I thought about licking the olive oil off each plate- it was so delicious. We ordered several different pizzas, gnocchi, pasta de mare and some prosciutto, mozzarella and burrata. All were amazing and served in generous portions. Usually restaurants will give you like three or four slices of prosciutto, but this place does it right and heaps it on the plate. We will definitely be back.
author: Jori M.

description:
If you want to eat a much below average pizza, experience slow service and be yelled at by the owner -- check this place. Otherwise, for your SAFTY -- skip it. The owner is trully hot-tempered to the point that I felt unsafe. 
I got yelled at, in front of my 2 years old, because I asked to check on the status of our order... I was later told, in front of other costumers, that I'm his worst costumer ever.
Well... He has not been in business long, and will not be for much longer!!!
author: Hadar B.

description:
I order 2 pizzas for pickup. They tell me 20 minutes. 20 minutes later i am there. I say to the weazily looking person in front "hi. i ordered 2 pizzas for pickup." he hisses "mmmm yes it will be finished soon."  But I can planly see that there are no pizzas in the oven and that there are two pizza boxes stacked right there on the counter with a reciept ... Then he starts mincing about, wiping off a table, looking at the register... and i am just standing there politely.... finanly he just arbitrarily says "mmmm yes can i help you?" i said "are those the two pizzas i ordered on the counter over there?" he says " that is not what i asked you! I asked you what is your name and what kind of pizza did you order!!" , then i just said "well the name was xxx and i am pretty sure i ordered those two pizzas sitting right over there...." then he flips out "what kind?? what kind??!" so i just said "you know what i dont like your attitude." then he responded "just leave...just leave!"  so i strolled over to Tonys. Got two much better pizzas without the heavy dough (i know it has overly heavy dough because i have ordered pizza there before. I kind of liked the olives though...Come to think of it maybe its all because i didnt tip very much the last time like 6 months ago, but its take out... you walk over, you pick it up i dont think you have to leave a huge tip to the host...).

anyway i would not recommend the place -- certainly not for pick up! unless you want to be confronted by an angry weazel that power trips the hand off of the pie!!
author: vivace K.

description: Exceptional food, especially the pizza. The staff is very friendly, the guy making the pizza behind the counter even gave the little guy in my group some pizza dough. Anyways, 5 stars, not disappointed at all.
author: Mariano P.

description: Great pizza and beautiful women bring the food..no complaints about this spot at all..beer is cold and the food is on point
author: Terry E.

description: True Pizza napoletana. We shared Norma, Bufalina, Prosciutto and Salsiccia and Broccoli and they were all delicious!
author: Davide P.

description: Stumbled on this place after the theatre. Great vibe restaurant.    Lively with music.   The food was amazing.  Pasta with the rib meat sauce was incredible.  Would go back in a minute.  Two things really stood out to me....  1.  Service was excellent.   I mean excellent.   2...  the place was full of Italians.     Cool spot.  You must go
author: Matt B.

description: Best pizza ever! Thin and light dough like heaven! Eggplant pizza was delicious! Better than in Italy ;) good service too
author: Anna B.

description: This small pizza restaurant in Little Italy is a common visit when touring friends throughout the area. There's a good variety of pizza choices as well as other Italian food. It's also across the road from the famous garlic restaurant, which makes for great table talk about how much better the food you're eating likely is :)
author: Michael H.

description: My fiance and I stopped by here and loved it. An impromptu dinner, after we decided to walk around. I've come to find I really love this area of San Francisco. This restaurant was a hipper version of the more traditional Italian restaurants around it. Much more casual as well, but it was nice. We started with the burrata and spicy coppa. Both absolutely flavorful and well paired. Included was a delicious flatbread to accompany the soft mozzarella cheese. It was all wonderful, I could have just eaten that all night. Then we finished with a piizza, the diavola. Very simple, a fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella and spicy salami. it was perfect, the crust flavorful and the toppings as well. We were very happy with our decision!
author: Ashley B.

description: Sooooo good! We tried a couple of the fresh mozzarellas and the prosciutto pizza. Super fresh and really some of the best pizza around! The crust was just about perfect, crispy on the outside with a slight char, and soft and chewy on the inside. The arugula and prosciutto were great together. Good service. We will definitely be back, since Tony's seems to be serving soggy pizza lately!!!
author: Ann H.

description: Great stone oven pizza. You can watch the great chefs prepare the pizza. The panna cotta to round off the delicious prosciutto pizza complemented with a pinot Giorgio makes especially a first date a night to remember!
author: Lisa H.

description: This is the kind of place visitors to North Beach are looking for - go here! It's become one of the go-to places for locals because they do everything right. Perfect 00-thin-charred-crust pizza, perfect burrata/mozz/meats appetizer options, just the right (and right-priced) wines to go with everything, and always friendly service. Love this place, it's what North Beach is all about.
author: T B.

description: Great atmosphere. Cozy. Neighborhood feeling. Casual. Ordered off menu. Sandwich with ricotta toamto ham arugula. Delicious.
author: Noelle B.

description: Sit at the bar. The guys behind the counter make the pizza right in front of you. Fresh ingredients and they even explain the process if you ask. Considering the size of the restaurant is really small and many of the waiters had too many tables at once, the service was still great.
author: Kyle C.

description: Seated quickly, and the food was excellent.  The selection of fresh mozzarella made for an excellent appetizer.
author: Daniel V.

description: One of the best pizza places in the city. I am never disappointed with the food and service is good! Fun environment. Great casual place with excellent food.
author: Crystal T.

description: The prosciutto pizza was amazing! Agostina was a fantastic waitress! We had an amazing dinner and fantastic time! Would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Ariah B.

description: Decided to stick with the basics and try a Margherita pizza. We ordered it to go, because the restaurant was packed (for good reason as it turned out). They said it would take ten minutes, we waited outside for about 5 and our pizza was brought out to us. Fast, easy and delicious. Crust was soft and flavorful, the cheese was just right, and the sauce is what you wish you had for the pies you try to make at home. Worth a trip if you know your pizza.
author: Pete M.

description: The flavors of my pizza were delicious but I have to say just because the crust was singed from the oven I would have liked my pizza to be served crunchy on the bottom and hot!!!!
author: Valarie O.

description: Not a bad place.....had a mushroom, sausage pizza. Good taste but somewhat soggy crust in the middle...could of been due to the toppings though. Girlfriend had the pasta carbonara which was really good. Service was so-so. There was no wait on a saturday night around 7 45 so that's always nice.
author: Scott K.

description: I ordered one of their vegetarian pizzas, the toppings was perfect but the pizza base was so thin that it got really soggy with their tomato sauce. But overall the topics were good, just if they could improve the base.
author: Sarun S.

description: Solid every single time. Not only good food and friendly service but one of the best bangs for your buck in the City.
author: VJ S.

description: Visiting San Fran from out of town, and looking for a good place to eat.  This place had great reviews and was recommended through our hotel, so we made the walk.  Showed up around 9 and the place was crowded! They told us the wait wouldn't be long as big party was leaving.  We were seated quickly and the service was super fast. Everyone was really nice. The food came out quick and was delicious! Best pizza I've had in a while. We left after 10 and it was still crowded, good to see.
author: Cyndi R.

description: Surprised this place has such a high rating! we ordered 2 draft beers and they came out warm. Ended up getting bottled Italian beer, which was pretty good so I gave 1 star for that. The barrata cheese was delicious and so was the olive oil drizzled on it. This is where this restaurant gets another star. The pizza was ok... Just ok. It was super soggy and lacked true authentic Italian flavors. The owner/manager was cocky and full of himself. Shaking his head in front of everyone when one of the runners dropped a glass. When we finished our food, the owner stood and stared at us and had his employees rush us so we would pay. He wanted to push our table together with available one next to us in order to accommodate a large party. I get it and am not hating on them being busy, but have some respect for your customers. Unfortunately, another small restaurant in SF, where someone thinks he knows how to run a place but it just ends up being mediocre.
author: Sherri A.

description: Found this spot walking around the neighborhood and it was meant to be. My god, best pizza I've had in awhile. Everything tasted so fresh! Had the Norma pizza (eggplant!) and added an egg on top, Salami plate, and short rib pasta... sososos good!!!! Sit at the bar as you'll have the best view in the house watching the chefs make pizzas. Love this spot!
author: Joanne O.

description: Went there for lunch today - great server and food.  Has a delicious prosciutto pizza, friends had some lasagna that was good tasting but a bit light on the serving size.  Only negative was the gangsta rap blaring through the meal.
author: Jay A.

description: Best pizza I have had on this side of the Atlantic? May very well be! Simple, yet delicious appetizers and pizzas. Awesome decor! Service was excellent. A little on the pricy side, but worth it! If/when I am back in San Francisco, I will be back!
author: Alex E.

description: Great pizza! Good atmosphere and set up,  although it can get a little loud at times. The calamari is not fried and it is very tasty.  The service has always been on point too.  I like this spot.
author: Justin P.

description:
I ate a dinner here. The food was fine. The bill came to $41 and change. I tipped $10.00 putting all of this on my credit card. A week later I checked my credit card charges online and saw that this restaurant charged me $141 - making it a $100 tip. 
I called the restaurant they looked up the original receipt and agreed the amount I wrote down as a tip was $10. They never have given me a credit (chargeback) nor did they return my call when I called again. 

BEWARE of using your credit card at this place!!!!!
author: Scott S.

description: seriously, the BEST pizza napoletana around!!!! and their mozzarella is fantastic too! we used to go to Tonys, but the pizza there is always soggy lately. after trying this, we are NEVER going to Tonys again, this is our new spot!!!! love love love it. :)
author: stacy a.

description: The burratta and the Diatola pizza were amazing. I plan on eating lunch at your restaurant every Tuesday.  See you tomorrow
author: Jeff S.

description: Brilliant wood fired pizza - orders of magnitude better than most pizza in the area. Prosciutto was amazing. Great beers too. Highly recommend.
author: Lucas F.

description: Lively atmosphere -- good music, good food (: thank you for great service. My brunch was delicious.
author: Bri E.

description: Very casual! Quick service and delicious pizza! Had the spicy salami and fried eggplant and both were delicious and very quick. Tagliatelle with pork sauce also delicious! Manager was super friendly. Wine was good and had reasonably priced options. Will definitely be back!
author: Ann P.

description: Authentic from the help, atmospheric and especially the food - thoroughly enjoyed- get the owners homemade Pinot Gregio with your pizza  too - outstanding
author: DP F.

description: EXCELLENT eggplant pizza and Buratta Italian Cheese!  Yes you have to a wait a little but the service was great, what an incredibly beautiful meal and wonderful evening!
author: RW B.

description: I've been to many Italian restaurants but this is truly hard to beat. Food, service, price, everything.
author: Aakash P.

description:
A truly delicious Neapolitan pizza.  Perfect crust both in consistency and deliciousness.  Crusty and seasoned to perfection. Just the right amount of homemade tomato sauce and imported mozzarella and the highest quality prosciutto.  If you crave an authentic Neapolitan pizza from a wood burning oven this is a really good one., and it's accessible(no lines), easy to find on Columbus ave, and appropriately priced.  Friendly staff from Italy, with no attitude.
This was a real surprise star pizza.
author: Stu F.

description: I went to Il Casaro last night, after my Italian class at the Istituto nearby. I sat at the counter and did some work on my laptop while enjoying a fabulous pizza hot from the woodturning oven a few feet away and a Coke (and then an espresso). I sat there about an hour and a half, asking at one point if that was OK, did they need my seat, and was made to feel very welcome.  There was lots of Italian flying around, which is increasingly rare in North Beach and generally a friendly, lively atmosphere. This was my second pizza at Il Casaro, and would rank it among the best of the best.
author: Beth W.

description: I came here last night with a group of people and it was so great! We shared some appetizers and some pizzas that were amazing. I love cheese, and there was plently of it to love. It is so nice to go to a restaurant on Columbus Ave and see local people working and eating there. Not touristy at all!
author: ashley m.

description: Dangerously addictive. Tenderest lasagna with most flavourful bolognese meat sauce comes with naked pizza bread delicious for dipping. Perfect wood fired oven pizzas made at miraculous speed before your eyes. Heaps of fresh shaved cheese atop everything. Personable and attentive owner and staff. Pepper spray yourself with the hot peppers in oil, you'll be crying and laughing at the same time. Great open space and fresh decor, fun people watching and genuine non-touristy Italian food. Thank you Thank you Francesco, hard to cook dinner at home with a great neighbourhood pizza place like this.
author: Donna L.

description: Okay if you know me then you know I stay away from Italian restaurants. But THIS is a WIN. Okay it helps that we know the owner and he's the real deal. A true Napoletano from the old country. Yes, they have a wonderful pizza. The only thing missing is the Real Buffalo mozzarella but other than that, this place is a win for me. I try to go and have lunch there anytime I'm in North Beach.
author: Gabriella S.

description: Great pizza, comes quick, and the prices are reasonable. Good service, and a solid reasonably priced wine list. Just far enough from Fisherman's Wharf that it doesn't pull all of the tourists.
author: Derek D.

description:
These guys were great. My sister, 2 year old nephew and brother in law were visiting from Chicago and we were in the city around little Italy. This was one of the few places in north beach/city area that let us bring in a stroller (nephew was already asleep and wasnt a cause for concern to other diners) and didn't scoff at us for doing so - pleasant experience to start with.

While it was a weeknight, the place was still fairly packed with the afterwork/midweek dinner crowd. We were told 15 minutes wait time but they found a nice table for us much sooner. 

Now the dining experience-  overall, the food was fantastic. The host and our waitress were very knowledgeable (incidentally both seemed to be true blue Italians from Italy) about the menu and made excellent recommendations given the dietary restrictions/food allergy concerns we had. The service was great and food arrived within minutes of placing our orders. 

This is a nice place for a small group to dine or even a first date. The ambiance is cozy and casual but the food and service are top notch.

Based on our first and only visit to date, I will say there will be many return trips to Il Casaro in the future.
author: S S.

description: Pizza is just like a casa  (a Napoli)...the dough is how it should be...Light...very very good. I give it a 5 but I have to add that the Mozzarella Di Bufala was not as firm as it a should...good wine and beer selection too. In other words if are around here...go in and enjoy the dinner. Parola di italiano!
author: Alex C.

description: This place is delish! Had the burrata, prosciutto pizza, margherita pizza, and Norma pizza. The staff was wonderful and the food was great, can't ask for much more!
author: Sarah B.

description: Real, honest to god, Italian pizza.  Without flying to Calabria, this is the very best next thing.  The crust is exactly the right texture:  Soft and thin but with just enough flex.  Not the cardboard crust you get with Americanized pizzas.  The wonderfully fragrant toppings are all Italian down to the fiery Calabrian peppers.  It is sheer entertainment to watch the gifted pizza chefs practice their craft.  The atmosphere is fun and lively.  A truly great find!
author: V L.

description: Probably the best pizza I have ever had in a long time since I moved to Sf. The staff is also really friendly and efficient !
author: Carolina G.

description: Exceptional pizza - so good we had a second one as dessert!! Our one son doesn't like pizza and he had 2 slices and finished off the crust for his brother. The service was friendly, quick and our kids loved watching them make the pizza at the bar. It was the best meal we had in San Francisco.
author: Steve C.

description: Pretty much any place that provides me a freshly baked pizza within two minutes (seriously, 120 seconds) of me ordering is worthy of 4 stars. Add to that the fact that every such pizza I've ordered is delish, AND the owners/staff are friendly and adorable... then you've earned yourself a fifth star.
author: Connie S.

description:
This place is the best!! We didn't have a reservation on a saturday night, and they were able to get us seated within 20 minutes (and we were able to grab a drink while we waited). The burratta and prosciutto is to die for, it's literally the best thing ever. We also got a pizza, the prosciutto one... in retrospect, we should have gotten something different because it was basically the same thing we got as an appetizer... but it was still yummy. We topped off with some pistachio and strawberry gelato. 

Officially on my top 3 fave places in north beach now!
author: Margaret L.

description: The burrata margarita pizza was beautiful, with the best thinnest crust in town.  However, the appetizer of wood roasted cauliflower with capers was so completely delicious and unexpected.  We got delivery - which was quick and ordering via YELP was easy and no hassles.  I will definitely eat here again and can't wait to try the fresh burrata.
author: A M.

description:
My first visit here was good. I got a margherita which probably isn't as good as the one at Tony's or A16 but definitely good enough and very reasonably priced at $13 compared to $20 at Tony's. But it needs more basil. There were only 2 or 3 little pieces of it. In addition to the usual boring dry chilli pepper flakes, they have whole chillies marinated in oil which is delicious. Their tiramisu was also good. The slice was large enough for two people and had thinly-sliced strawberries on top. 

After several visits, my feelings about the place is mixed. The quality of pizza assembly is inconsistent. Instead of placing the cheese so that it melts into lilypad-like puddles across the pie, sometimes they put about 20 clumps of it mostly in the center which don't melt enough and slide right off when you pick up a slice. 

On several occasions, I put down a $20 for a $14 check and was asked "do you need change?" This has happened with two different servers and I'm not sure whether they were greedy or just boneheaded.

This could easily become a great place to sit down and have a neapolitan pizza if they had a better staff at the oven and at the tables.
author: keith s.

description: Delicious pizza!! And super friendly service! If you enjoy authentic wood fired pizza, then this is the place for you. Also, don't forget to try the burrata cheese! It is heavenly!! ;)
author: Ryan M.

description: I never thought I was going to give 5 stars to a restaurant that didn't serve us. We went to Il Casaro on Sunday night and upon arrival the owner told us that the dough had not met his standards and he'd rather not serve us pizza that night. He could have served us pizza but instead he chose not to serve a suboptimal pizza. His honesty deserves five stars, he has earned our trust and we will definitely come back.
author: Alex A.

description: People ask me all the time where to get good Italian food in North Beach. Il Casaro is going to be my answer going forward.
author: I_play G.

description: I can easily describe this as my favorite place for Pizza in San Francisco!
author: Valentina G.

description: Stop in to try this place for lunch. So good! one of the best pizzas I have ever had! I will be back soon!
author: Big B.

description: Fantastic food despite having no cheese on an anchovy pizza..DA FUQ?!? Service was poor
author: Joe R.

description: Had dinner here on a Friday, made a reservation on yelp (so easy and convenient) - this was great find for a chill and delicious evening. Great vibe, cool staff, delicious food and drinks!! Definitely recommend!!
author: Jessica M.

description: Went for the first time over the weekend and ohhhhh....myyyyyy.....gawd!  Really, really good food.  I've been to Italy several times and it really took me back to the small cafe's there. Prices are reasonable too.  It was a Sat night around 9pm and we walked right in and sat at the bar (preferable in my opinion). We were immediately greeted and in Italian style it was more than just one person helping us get situated.  One person on menu, another on water, another on utensils. It's like you're the only one that matters at that moment. The service was impeccable. Will definitely go back.  I live in Oakland but worth the trip.
author: Shelly S.

description: If you're looking for a prime spot in North Beach to get superb authentic wood fired Italian pizza, this is the place. Right on the charming Columbus St. with walls of glass that open up so you look right out on the street. Some interesting appetizers made with homemade cheese and good beer and wine too. Casual, yet tastefully stylish setting.
author: Edward D.

description: Go ahead, sign up on the waiting list, but they don't use it. They just choose whoever they feel like seating. What's more, the pizza is not that great -- inferior to Tony's, Tomasso's, Golden Boy.
author: W W.

description: This pizza is pretty sub par compared to what else is available in the area. The restaurant itself is very nice. A great place to have a glass of wine near the window. However, despite the nice wood oven, the pizza has a bland and undercooked crust, flavorless mozzarella cheese, and undercooked tomato sauce. The cheese is really the biggest disappointment given that they call themselves a mozzarella bar. I'm surprised by the overall high rating. I have to assume most of the high marks come from tourists.
author: John S.

description: What a step up from The Steps of Rome that used to be there.... As a former east coaster I'm hard to please with pizza, but this is the real deal. Fresh everything including house made mozzarella along with wines made by  the owner make this a great experience all around. Check it out.
author: Lance K.

description: Loved the fried mozzarella and authentic Italian pizza. Crust was chewy and perfect. Super high quality and flavorful ingredients, from the cheese to the prosciutto to the olives. Very friendly service. We will be back!
author: Steve S.

description: What a lovely addition to the neighborhood! Have only ordered takeout, but was really impressed with the quality, service, and price. I ordered the burrata and the broccoli & salsiccia pizza. Both were delicious and beautifully prepared, even as a to-go order. I couldn't believe how fast it was ready--I walked in, placed the order, and left with my food less about 8 minutes later! This will definitely become one of my weeknight staples. Looking forward to coming back to dine in the restaurant--it's a beautiful space and the staff is delightful.
author: Alison S.

description: My husband and I stumbled upon this place while walking around SF.  The place was busy but we were able to find 2 seats at the counter.  We had a front row view of the guys making pizzas... so fun!  We ordered a margarita pizza and buffalo mozzarella and 2 bottles of wine... OMG... everything was SOOO delicious.  The mozzarella was really amazing... really good!  This will definitely be a tradition on future visits to SF!
author: Gabriella G.

description: The food is good but no customer service at all....very rude, I walked in saying hi and the owner herself who was right there did not even acknowledge me.
author: Kalea R.

description: Wish I could have posted a video but the pizza was too good to be true. I've lived in many of different places (including Italy) and this joint definitely fulfilled my expectations. I have officially found my new pizza joint in the city and do not plan to turn away. The prosciutto pizza is to die for.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Located in North Beach, has a young and vibrant atmosphere. The prosciutto pizza has s generous amount of fresh mozzarella, arugula leaves, and thin curls of raspa dura. Fresh mozzarella is great! The tomato sauce is fruity. The pizza tastes very juicy. But I am not so favor of raspa dura. 

I read the classic margherita is also great, will try it next time.

Chef (and owner?) Salvatore Di Stefano used to work in Tony's Pizza Napoletana.
author: Emmy P.

description:
SO. DELICIOUS. 

I was visiting friends that live in North Beach and they took me out to dinner here, raving about what a great spot it is. Let me tell you friend, everything was excellent: food, wine, ambiance, service.

We had the burrata + calamari to start (both drenched in wonderful, nutty olive oil) and then ordered two pizzas: Buffalina and Norma. I was experiencing an awesome buzz from the yummy white wine I ordered by the time the pizza came out I was having a major hedonistic experience. The pizzas were flavorful, pillowy, crusty, warm, savory, a little sweet at times...I remember it like it was yesterday.

To make things even better than they already were, our waiter/host brought out a Prosciutto pizza on the house because he thought it had taken too long to bring us the other two pizzas. The prosciutto was amazing! And the fact that he was so considerate took it to another level. It's hard to find such attentive service.

Wish I lived in SF, I would come here all the time!
author: Penelope E.

description: Incredible.  In town for 5 days and I've eaten here twice.  Best lasagna I've ever had.  Fried Mozzarella and Burrata apps were great.  The pizza is doughy and perfect.  The staff is friendly and attentive.
author: Chris H.

description: I love this place! The pizzas are just as good as I had them in Rome and Florence, maybe better. Since the opening I'm a regular guest and they have never disappointed me. I often order the burrata which I can definitely recommend. By now I tried three different pizza's and they were all delicious! If you are into American pizza with tons of ingredients, this might not be the place for you. This is a place where they know how to serve european food. Staff is always very friendly and very flexible with difficult orders.
author: Heloise D.

description: Definitely get the burrata cheese appetizer. Trust me on this, you will not be sorry.  The pizza crust was pretty much perfect, the toppings were the highest quality.  I can't think of a single thing I'd change.  A well-earned 5 stars.
author: Bill J.

description: This place was great. Fresh pizza with good ingredients. Cooked well. Great customer service.  Beer selection is not bad either.  There could be more space for seating. But overall I would definitely come back.
author: D S.

description:
Ordered two pizzas. The salami and marguerita pizza and both came out pretty fast. 

Their frier was broken so couldn't order one of the appetizers. Which was disappointing. 

The pizzas were nice and thin and the flavors weren't overwhelming. Crust was over cooked. I wasn't amazed by either of the pizzas so will probably pass on this place next time. 

The entire time I was eating there was a huge fly next to the window. Whenever I see flies at any establishment I automatically knock down a star. Just so unsanitary and uncomfortable to eat in an environment that has flies.
author: Linda J.

description: I am a delivery driver eat24 and I picked up an order from this place when I got to my customer's they said it was completely the wrong pizza so I called the restaurant and let them know. They said they were going to talk to their manager and get back to the customer to fix it. I came back later on that evening to pick up another order and the manager was there so I checked in with him to make sure that he knew what happened earlier.  I'm a little codependent as well as a former restaurant manager so I thought I would just see if everything worked out for my customer.  I presume it didn't because this manager was a complete tool!!!! He was rude to me!! He didn't want me to wait inside the restaurant for the order that I was picking up and even though it was freezing cold outside he wouldn't tell me how long it was until the order would be ready!!
