I saw another driver come pull up looking for their order. I got the name for their order and went back in to tell them so they knew that driver was there too. Of course the manager bit my head off and told me "I told you to wait outside!! Get out of my face"!!  So I went back to my car and swallowed my pride I was parked directly in front of the door and then he came out 12 minutes later to bring me the order and had the nerve to say to me "I told you to wait outside the door I don't have time to deliver things to your car!!  Its not my fault you're parked illegally!!" Yeah because the four feet extra are you had to walk to step off the sidewalk and walk directly out front of your door to my car window is so time consuming! !! Wow I don't know what kind of customer service skills he was trained with but I wouldn't talk to an ex that showed up at a restaurant I was managing that poorly!!! I'm  providing a service to them and I'm   not employed by them!!  So you would think he would be a little nicer! I work for sidecar who's given a lot of these small businesses an opportunity to expand their business and do deliveries without having to pay for a full time or part time delivery driver they can't afford! !! But the thanks we get is to be treated like that I wouldn't eat there if you paid me!!! Oh yeah by the way the second order I took was wrong too!!!
author: Shannon E.

description: Bland pizza, completely not worth it considering there are so many amazing pizza places in North Beach. We ordered the margarita pizza which stated it included basil - which meant 3 basil leaves on the pizza.
author: Diane F.

description: Pizza under cooked. Nothing to brag about. I have had better and the 51/2star review was a misrepresentation. Staff was cool though but had nothing to do. SF had better pizza than this.
author: Marcella T.

description: This is the best Italian food I've had in the bay area. Would recommend anything with mozzarella in it. Arancini and pizza were both immaculate.
author: Gabriel W.

description: Possibly the BEST burrata in SF, imported from Italy. The pizzas nice, but if you come here your first choice should be the mozzarellas' and prosciutto. The staff was very friendly. Ask questions, they have great advice.
author: Will F.

description: Great pizza! I've been passing by this place since the last place closed and was excited to find a new spot open now. We ordered 2 pizzas for 3 people and loved both of them. The mozzarella selection is fantastic and unique. The wine options are affordable but good quality. A  nice, casual pizza place in the neighborhood!
author: Amber M.

description: Our server was sweet and attentive and the food was great.   The pizzas are delicious.   Mozzarella in carozza was awesome.  Beer was cold.  All good!
author: Jodi S.

description: This fancy pizza parlor has potential, but it's a real work in progress. The pizza maker sure looks and plays the part, but the night I was there the crust on my $20.00 pizza was done, but the cheese was hardly melted. I noticed this on several pizzas coming out. The restaurant was busy, and it appears the pizza maestro was putting pies into an impressive, wood burning oven after it had cooled down too much. Very disappointing, but I see enough potential to give it another shot. Also on the night we were there they were out of sodas, and had no ice, and the house salad was mediocre for the price, so ...
author: stephen h.

description: No words. Well the words would be amazing, incredible, one of the best ever!  Didn't know what to expect. We went on the advice of the concierge at our hotel when we asked for good pizza.  This is NOT your typical pizza joint.  The wait was about 30 minutes and we decided to sit at the bar, which is mostly the pizza work station and wood oven. The pizza chief, from Italy was like a surgeon.  A couple of times he didn't like the way a pizza looked and threw it right in the trash and made a new one.  The taste of this pizza, the texture, the flavors all amazing!
author: Mark E.

description: I wish this place would stop getting so popular. Easily one of the best restaurants in North Beach, if not all of San Francisco. The staff is so friendly and the pizza is SO delicious. The ingredients are fresh and the pizzas are made quickly after you order. Even when there is a wait, it is worth it. I never feel rushed to leave, everyone is pleasant working there. I really love this place. If you are visiting, make sure to find time to stop, you won't be disappointed!
author: Victoria D.

description: Authentic as you can get. The dude who made our pizza literally put on a show, tossing and spinning the dough like I had never seen. Incredible food made by real Italians. Slab some mozzarella onto a piece of bread and top it off with a slice of hot coppa and you'll wish there was an option for 6 stars.
author: William N.

description: Excellent! Casual atmosphere and amazing food. Burrata was so yummy and we loved the meatballs. Service was excellent and tables turned quickly and efficiently. Would definitely recommend.
author: Tracy S.

description: This is a cozy restaurant for intimate groups. I came once with 12-15 people, which was awkward and hard to talk to everyone, given the seating arrangement. If you wanted to relax in a chic environment for a meal with 2-4 people, I would recommend getting a pizza. I've had better Burrata and Mozzarella Salad, and avoid any pizza that includes olives if you don't like it getting overly salty.
author: Nancy Y.

description: There is an abundance of good pizza in North Beach. Tommaso's brings you down into a cut of the old City, and never disappoints. Tony's and its sister Capo's are consistently spectacular, famous for a reason. Baonecci literally makes you feel like you're in Italy with its style and cuisine, the cheapest vacation you can take. Golden Boy is unique, and fits the bill for a starving slice need quite well. But il Casaro stands out as a wonderful and different take than any other in NB. Saying it's a welcome addition to the area is an understatement. The ingredients, the rare panuozzo, and the feeling you get talking to the people at the restaurant doesn't make it a must-try. It makes it a must-become-a-regular-at sort of pizzeria. I wish there was a sixth star. Bravo.
author: Marc M.

description: Small place, great service, the pizza was a little different than I'm use to. Pizza was cooked in a fire pizza oven. The crust was a little burnt and the middle wasn't cooked all the way. Vegetarian friendly
author: Karina R.

description: Reservations here are a joke.  I can't tell you what the food tastes like because we finally gave up and left.  Arrived on time and our table was no where in sight 45 minutes past our reservation time.  Went here based on the kid friendly reputation but I wouldn't call hanging out on a busy street with hungry kids for an hour family friendly.
author: Cris O.

description: This was fantastic!  Great hidden gem along columbus. The burrata was to die for and everything else was very tasty. They weren't trying to push us in,  but very happy when we walked in.  No wait,  very nice staff- definitely highly recommended.
author: Clare R.

description: This place is superb! Super busy but also super delicious. Pizza is simple as it should be and every bite is a treat!
author: Julia J.

description: I've lived in North Beach for nearly 5 years and have relished in the artisan pizza of Tony's because no other Italian pizza in the area came remotely close...until Il Casaro. This place blew my mind and tastebuds away, hopefully they will come back. I just came back from Naples, Italy and literally had the best pizza in my life. It was a struggle coming back to the states knowing the same pizza would be difficult to find. But Il Casaro delivers - I had the Bufalina which is just tomato sauce, buffalo mozzarella, basil, and olive oil - plain and simple but that's what makes it so good is that the natural flavors of all these ingredients stand out so well. When it was served to me, I went straight for the middle which is how they do it in Italy because its supposed to be the soupy delicious part from all the sauce. It passed the test. I seriously think this place is nearly the same as what they serve in Naples and can't wait to go back.....probably tomorrow night. Thanks Il Casaro, you showed the world that you can bring Naples pizza outside of Naples.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: After reading all of the amazing reviews on Yelp, we chose Il Casaro out of the many restaurant choices in SF. We waited 30+ minutes to get a table and then received mediocre service from our server. The whole thing felt like we were being treated as if we should be so thankful that we had the privilege to eat there. We ordered the fried mozzarella and the marinara that came with it tasted like straight up tomato sauce (or soup for that matter) no flavor whatsoever. My husband had the diavola pizza and I had the Pesto pasta. My husband's pizza arrived and my pasta was nowhere to be found. Our server did not even acknowledge that my pasta was on its way or apologize for the delay. My pasta arrived 12 minutes later after my husband was completely done with his meal. The pasta was such a disappointment...it was nothing but pesto sauce and pasta noodles. And extremely bland! No spice or flavor. It was barely edible until I added red pepper flakes (intended for the pizza)...my makeshift attempt at actual seasoning. The whole experience was a complete disappointment...and not exactly an inexpensive one. Can't believe we wasted one of our few meal opportunities in SF on this place. There were several other Italian restaurants down the street that looked way better! Don't make the same mistake we did.
author: Tabby P.

description: Absolutely in love with this place. What a great find! Everything about the pizza here is delicious - from the fresh meat to the tasty cheese. You can't go wrong with the Arugula/Proscuitto!
author: Ange M.

description: The burrata cheese with the bread is so delicious. Best I've ever had. The pizzas were perfection. I could 100% recommend this place to everyone, you can't be disappointed.
author: Anna A.

description: Amazing pizza - this place might have ruined all other pizza for me
author: Adam C.

description: Delicious really Italian pizza!! I loved the place and the whole staff, everybody was so nice! You definitive won't go wrong if you order prosciutto pizza and Tiramusu!!
author: Vanesa F.

description: Can I just say how happy I am that Yelp! took over Eat24?! I love all the new food delivery options. Like this pizza place. The wood fired pizza was amazing quality and even more so to get that yummy taste delivered to our home. The reason I am giving this place 4 stars instead of 5 is just based on the delivery time. It easily could have been traffic since the Warriors game 1 was on but it was about an hour late and so the pizza was cold. But this won't detour me from ordering delivery from them again simply based on taste and quality of the food. We ordered 1 margarita and one diovolo for 2 people. We both had about 6 slices leftover and easily could have just ordered one but decided to order two. The pizza is thin so I guess it depends how hungry you are. Prices are definitely up there(about $36 with tip for delivery) but again, it was just nice to order an elevated authentic italian pizza :)
author: Whitney S.

description: amazing fresh mozzarella bar, only one in north beach.  space is open and filled with light.  waitress was awesome.  sister restaurant to vicolletto nearby.  great fra diavalo pizza w salami too!
author: seth g.

description: We stopped here by walking by and seeing an open table and am glad we found this place.  The pizza came out very fast and was cooked perfectly.  We had the quattro fromage pizza.  It reminded BME of pizza I had in Europe but better.   Will definitely come back here.
author: Dale C.

description: Walked from the Omni Hotel.  small, but VERY lively, pizza plus kind of place.  Wines were excellent..Augustina, our server, went above and beyond in the packed restaurant helping us with wine selection..... Let us taste 3 different kinds.  We got the Aracini as an appetizer.... Yummy!  Then, we shared the lasagna made with homemade noodles.... Fabulous..... And the Norma pizza.... The only suggestion for improvements I would make is spicing up the sauce on the pizza a bit.... The crust was outstanding! For dessert.... Pistachio gelato was creamy and smooth. We took a 4 cheese pizza with broccoli rabe to go. Also delicious.
author: Carol B.

description: Yes the pizza is AMAZING. Better than any other place in SF. But what really makes it the best, at least for me, are the chillies in marinated in olive oil. I wish they would sell those!! Maybe they do...?
author: Alexandra V.

description: Out of town and stopped here on a whim on my walk back to my hotel after getting my nails done. It was fantastic! I got the margherita pizza and the crust was delicious- light and airy, the mozzarella was amazing as was the fresh basil. Plus my pizza was done in about 5 minutes.  I think I ate it that quickly as well since it was so good. I would Definitely recommend this place. Also seemed like a nice place to eat alone too at the bar.
author: Leah P.

description: Amazing wood-fired pizzas and incredibly fresh mozzarella. The owners and staff are extremely friendly and open to make suggestions. If you're up for something different but delicious try the Norma. So. Good.
author: Liz W.

description: My husband and I are visiting from out of town and saw good Yelp reviews so we decided to try it out. There 100's of Italian restaurants around. We sat down and were offered water. After 10 minutes the waitress finally came over and told us the three things they were out of and out of the three, 2 were items we were gonna order. So I ordered a pasta with pork in it. It did NOT come with bread or salad, just pasta. She dropped it off and right away I could smell it was spicy, my husband can't do spicy bc he has a stomach condition. After 10 min she returned and asked how it was and I told her it was too spicy. She just looked at me and walked away. Overpriced, overrated, and didn't care about customer experience.
author: Anne D.

description: I'm sorry to say we arrived at Il Casaro during their posted open hours to find they weren't open. The restaurant had patrons but a hand written sign posted outside said they were closed and would reopen at 3:00. We went up the street for a glass of wine and returned at 3:00. Now there was sign stating they would reopen at 5:00. Ok, I get staffing issues and who knows what gets in the way but what really got me was the attitude of the staff. We tried to talk with them through the open window on the street. They just blew us off. Not so much as an I'm sorry, things changed. Nothin. They just ignored us.    Incredibly rude. Now mind you, I had also called for a reservation earlier and they never called back on that either. Maybe a little full of themselves.
author: Maria T.

description: You cannot go wrong!!! Just go!!! It's really hard (esp in this hood) to find a small, delicious place that's reasonably priced and has an updated vibe. This is all of those things! Great interior, great food. Not much more to it. Oh, GET THE BURRATA. You'll walk out of here painfully full if you get some cheese + some meat + a pizza. This is everything you want in a vibey neighborhood joint. And we've never had to wait. Just go and bring friends.
author: Sam A.

description: Amazing space with a friendly waitstaff, and delicious food. The ingredients are fresh, pizza hot, and the ambiance even better. If you're in North Beach or a near by neighborhood, definitely worth stopping by.
author: Frank T.

description:
Solid gourmet pizza in SF.

The wood-fire oven is a bonus, and they are clearly doing something right with the dough because it's the only moist, chewy crust I've had since coming here (the rest are a consistency of thick, dry, stale bread). My girlfriend and I had the olives (amazing), house-made buffalo mozzerella (really good), a margherita pie (delicious) and a marinara pie (also tasty). 

Everything was good. I only gave 3 stars for a couple reasons:

1. Pricey--13 bucks for a small pie is too much
2. Although the dough was great, it was a bit undercooked in the crust of our first pie. I'd totally take that over having it over done, and it was still delicious, so it's not a big deal.

All in all, it was a great experience. We'll likely be back.
author: Steve B.

description: Tried 3 pizzas and they were all delicious! Just like Napoli, only the owner is Calabrese.  I was very impressed...pizza just like my dad makes! Authentic! You must try! We had the Margherita,  Diavola and Prosciutto...all to die for!
author: Ame B.

description: Great place. Super friendly staff, food prepared right in front of you. Very reasonably priced too. Highly recommended
author: Stephen O.

description: Amazing authentic pizza! We frequently travel to Italy and this is it. Living in the neighborhood it's hard to distinguish good new restaurants from the typical tourist- predatory places that line Columbus Ave. This is our favorite that has opened up in the past 5 years. We hope we can be regulars.
author: deborah c.

description: Great food and great service! My boyfriend and I went in on a Tuesday afternoon when they weren't too busy and we're sat immediately. Unfortunately the waitress made a mistake on our order and thought we wanted two pizzas instead of one and the mozzarella plate but they handled it perfectly. Not only did they bring out the mozzarella right away but they also gave us the pizza for free! They really know how to turn around a bad experience. I don't normally yelp but I felt this deserved a great review as well as a nice tip lol
author: Ariel K.

description:
This place was packed...for a good reason! The waitress and cooking staff handled the rush gracefully and with a big smiles...and did I mention the food? The ingredients are ridiculously fresh and the pizza, buffula mozz and the cold cuts were delicious! Good wine too. 

It is a cool atmosphere. Kind of like a bar and you can watch the cooks make the pizza.
author: Kelly D.

description: Nice place.  We had the pizza with sausage, broccolini, and mozzarella.  Different from what we're used to,but good.  Pizza was just the right size for two people and cost about $16.00.  We got a half bottle of wine for $20.00.  Service was good and we enjoyed the meal.
author: Susan P.

description: Feeling like I'm back in Italia!  A warm welcome by Paulo & Lucie and my tummy is happy! Grazie!
author: Kelly L.

description: The best Italian pizza in the city. If you wanna try a real European pizza, this is the place to come.
author: Nebojsa R.

description: Best pizza ever. The sauce is a little runny but when it taste like that who cares. I would love to be able to bottle that sauce up and take it home.
author: Chris B.

description: While searching for an Italian pizzeria me and my colleagues spotted this hidden gem in the heart of Little Italy. The service was fantastic with very friendly waiters! When our pizza arrived we were shocked by the very authentic Italian look but we were even more shocked by the fantastic taste. It's a a pizzeria you have to visit when in San Fran!
author: Jad H.

description: Wonderful food, would probably have given it 5 stars but they forgot my pizza, so there was a long wait. The buratta was wonderful and the pizza was also delicious.....cooked in only a few minutes in the 900 degree oven.....staff was very friendly enjoyed the casual atmosphere
author: Steve S.

description: I went here with some Italian friends of mine, one of which who is from Naples... and he can vouch for the authenticity of the pizzas here: While I am not Italian, I recently returned from a trip to Naples and the pizza here is virtually identical and of amazing quality!  I had the margarita  and devoured every bite!  So fresh, so flavorful... this is now my favorite pizza in SF, and quite possibly the best pizza I've ever had.
author: Steve N.

description: I was in San Francisco 2 weeks ago with my fiancé and friend for the night. As we approached there was a short line. When we asked we were informed that there was about a 30 minute wait so we put our names on the list. Reviews were good and 30 minutes didn't seem that long. However, we waited almost an hour outside. We inquired twice and we're told only a few more minutes.  There were limited options around so we were pretty limited. That's why we waited. After being sat, 52 minutes later, the hostess took our drink order. We then waited another 10 minutes with not even water delivered. I then inquired about the mozzarella and was told she needed to ask another employee. We waited another 5 plus minutes before we just walked out. On a late Monday night I'm sure this place was busy for a reason, but I'll never know due to the poor customer service. When you watch 2 men that seem to either work or own the place just walking around laughing and drinking instead of helping the staff you tend to get impatient and irritated. After smelling pizza for more than an hour and that, this place gets 1 star only because you have to pick at least 1.
author: Sheena W.

description: Me and my family picked this place over the Stinking Rose while in SF. They're both on the same street. I was happy with this place (Lowen not so much). We ordered the Fior Di Latte mozzarella for starters - tasted fresh but the bread was a bit too hard. For the main course, we ordered two Diavola pizzas and the lasagna. The pizza was awesome - the sauce is tart, fresh and light while the salami adds a spicy kick. But man, that lasagna! That was THE BEST lasagna I've ever had! Topped with freshly shaved parmesan chips, perfect!
author: Martin A.

description: As an East Coast native, I can certainly appreciate a good pie and this place has it. I ordered the margarita pizza and was not disappointed, from the sauce to the fresh mozzarella balls it was superb. Crust was crisp and not soggy. Excellent prices and has certainly retained a new fan.
author: Max L.

description: Very good pizza and in a neat area of sf. We had the wood fired margarita with sausage. Would be better if they provided garlic toast or breadsticks. But very good pizza and the cauliflower bites were great.
author: Burt D.

description: Awesome Pizza, if you know Viciletto Restaurant on Green street, these same owners who are so talented have done a  beautiful renovation in the Steps of Rome space with wood fired ovens and elegant  marble counters . A great asset to North Beach. I will definitely  be a  Regular . Congratulation's! For having two great restaurants .
author: daniel l.

description: The burrata is delicious. The pizza was pretty great, but quite salty and missing some sweetness in the sauce, perhaps because this particular one lacked enough. In any case, they are made so quickly and you can watch each pizza enter the oven. Each ingredient is imported from a specific region of Italy. The quality is excellent, especially the cheese. My pizza wasn't as crispy or as saucy as I wanted, but the one next to mine looked perfect! The panda cotta was great!
author: Julia B.

description: My tummy was a rumblin' on one fine afternoon so I slid inside this lovely place they call Il Casaro. Barely understanding the Italian being who was my waitress, I successfully ordered a range of items. And to my surprise (but not really cause this place has 4 & 1/2 stars) ..... THE BURRATA CHEESE WAS FIRE, LASAGNA WAS SEMI-FIRE, CANNOLI WAS FIYA BUT MEATBALLS WERE SUPER HOT FIYAAAAAA
author: Rhiannon H.

description: I ordered delivery from this restaurant.  Not only did it take 2 hours to get my delivery it was ice cold when it arrived.  Sadly, to make matters worse, the pizza was under cooked and the crust was soggy and doughy.  It was just gross and inedible.
author: Liz M.

description: We are Brazilians. We live here about 1 year and we were uses to eating good Italian pizza kind of this in Brazil! Here we find the best crust. Would only eat it! Best pizza ever! Very good!
author: Daiana O.

description: This place is unbelievable! Customer service was great and the pizzas were even better.. I had to order my own pizza because my boyfriend said he was going to eat a whole one.. Which he did.. And he even had some of mine.. Place is pretty busy.. There was a line out the door when we were leaving.. But it would be well worth the wait if I had to wait..
author: Mrs R.

description: if you like chicago style pizza this is not for you,but if you like authentic thin,tasty,healthy and filling italian pizza then,make sure to visit this gem of a restaurant.
author: William B.

description: I have to start by saying that the pizza crust is the most delicious and perfectly textured that I have had in a LONG time. It's thin crust, light, chewy and soft but with the perfect amount of crunch on the outside. The toppings are flavorful and fresh, you can not go wrong with the Margharita, it's simple yet mouthwateringly good.  The others are just as amazing, as well as the cheese they serve. I have been there multiple times recently, and I still want to go back for more!
author: J K.

description: This was the best pizza I've had in a long time!  We ordered the one with eggplant, and my boyfriend doesn't even like eggplant, and we both loved it!  The dough is perfection.  The fried mozzarella comes with a delightful side of arugula greens and tomatoes, so you can build the perfect bite, and we also enjoyed the asparagus.  It was cooked perfectly.
author: Courtney M.

description: We got the burrata plate, Diavola Pizza, and panzanella salads. All around fantastic.
author: Stuart K.

description: The Margherita Pizza w/ crushed red pepper blew my mind. Tremendous, highly recommend. The prosciutto and mozzarella are flames as well. Great service, awesome place. Also get the tiramisu
author: Alex S.

description:
Great pizzas, fresh cheeses, lovely wines.  What else could I have asked for?
May be more options for vegetarians?  The margherita was incredible with just the simple and basic ingredients.
author: sundar v.

description: Greta little spot. The service was excellent as well as the cleanliness. It serves very good lasagna. Very convenient  spot. Prices are fair.
author: Cody M.

description:
5-stars across the board

Best Napoli style pizza in San Francisco.
author: Nathanael C.

description: I had an excellent lunch here. I sat at the bar and watched the pizza master at work. This is a man who cooks with love. I was told he used to spin pizzas in Washington Sq., Park the delight of the crowds. I'd wanted simply a very light lunch and it ordered the imported Burrata and the asparagus cheese. With these I had a glass of Pinot Grigio. But as I watched the pizza master twirling pizza dough and nurturing pizzas through the cooking process, I just had to order one myself. For this course I ordered a glass of the Etna Russo red wine. I enjoyed two slices and took the rest home. Fantastic. The room is great, the service very well done, and I found the food excellent. This is a very good addition to North Beach cuisine, and an excellent replacement for the Steps of Rome. Enjoy!
author: Jerry H.

description: Great little pizzeria.  Food was fresh, service good, and generous wine pour.  Don't pass up the the cheeses and mortadella.  Perfectly sliced.  Definitely come back when in Little Italy.
author: Tom K.

description: Worst experience ever. Never coming back There are plenty other pizza places nearby, such as Firenze, Sotto Mare, etc.
author: T T.

description: I'm an SF local and have been meaning to come here since they opened (probably almost two years at this point) and have somehow never been. Had a craving for pizza Napoletana tonight so we went to Tony's to see what the wait would be...2.5 hours. So decided to give this place a try. Quickly discovered why there was a line out the door here. The owner/manager was so nice and got us in as fast as possible (probably a 25 minute wait on a busy Saturday night). The staff was so attentive and nice and authentic (our waiter was 100% Italiano and recommended our wine). Got a bottle of great wine, the olives, burrata, croquettes (because they ran out of arancini - understandably) and the Calabrese pizza all for $84. Not only is that an incredible deal but the food was phenomenal. Everything we ate tasted better than than the last. Would put this place at the level of A16 and Cotogna only without the wait time and at 50% the price. My only regret is that it took me this long to come. Fantastic all around. Cannot wait to go back.
author: Jeff T.

description: We just got back from Italy and my son Max (who now goes by "Massimo") is determined to recapture the culinary delight of his newfound spiritual homeland. We sat at the bar and watched the pizzas being made (which is always fun). We ordered two Margherita Pizzas, the asparagus and the cauliflower. Everything was delicious! My son noted that it had "the most perfect leopard-spotted crust" he'd ever seen (one of the telltale signs of authenticity). The waitstaff was very friendly, entertaining our son's pidgin Italian with patience and encouragement. We've only just begun our tour of Neapolitan-style pizzerias, but this place is a definite winner!
author: Elana R.

description:
The staff is friendly and kind.  The pizza crust amazing... Francesco (the owner) deserves your business.  
You need to go here!  You won't be disappointed:)
author: N H.

description: It was our last night in San Francisco, and my husband and I wanted to grab dinner in North Beach before heading back to our hotel.  Thanks to Yelp, we found Il Casaro Pizzeria & Mozzarella Bar.  We started with the Imported Burrata and then moved onto the Margherita Pizza.  Both were delicious!!  I've never had burrata.  What is not to love?!?!  It is super soft mozzarella that you can spread on the toast provided.  YUM!  The pizza crust was fantastic with that brick oven taste, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful.  It was a Thursday night so less than half of the restaurant's tables were occupied.  The service was both fast and friendly.  My husband and I especially liked the bus boy.  He was super friendly and attentive.  Prices are reasonable with our tab including tip hovering right around $30.00.  We chose the table next to the front window so that we could "people watch" as we ate.  I highly recommend Il Casaro if you are looking for a great casual dinner with top notch service.  Oh, and it's great for kids.  We don't have any, but the little girl at the table next to ours seemed to really be enjoying herself.
author: Danielle A.

description: The Margherita here is on point. The dough is superb, and tastes good on it's own with just a tad bit of olive oil. It's almost kind of like naan. It's not hard like some other American joints', and serves as an excellent base for the fantastic ingredients they place on top. It's very well-balanced, and allows allows it's ingredients to shine. A lot of other pizza joints, particularly American pizza places, love piling on the toppings. Sometimes that works and sometimes you may crave a pizza like that, but overall I feel like that style of pizza is overpowering and takes away from the fine balance that pizza should have. Il Casaro does an amazing job of showcasing it's excellent mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil on an even more excellent crust. Also, I love the little spicy peppers they give you. Adds a nice *kick* to the meal. Pizza connoisseurs, please come and experience this gem in Little Italy!
author: Andrew S.

description: Great spot. Amazing food and fantastic hosts. I can't say enough about this place. Real pizza made in a wood fire oven, you won't find any place like it to have pizza like this. If you ever in the area you gatta stop by and get yourself a pie. Also try the breaded mozzarella with a side of their warm marinara sauce.
author: Soheil V.

description: Food is out of this world. I was blown away by their margarita pizza and by burrata. The place is small, waitress was super friendly and food was as fresh and delicious as it gets. This was the best pizza I has in States and better than many I had in Italy. I will make sure to be back to this place once in SF again.
author: Timur F.

description: Quattro formagio pizza was wonderful...waiter was very accommodating when I asked for a side salad with shaved mozzarella. Everything was very well prepared and delicious...Enjoy!
author: Michael M.

description: Awesome, best pizza I have had in yrs! Cant wait to try more off their menu when I come back to town. As authentic Italian as you can get this side of the Atlantic!
author: Dan V.

description: The raspberry panna cotta alone would make it worth a trip!  Wonderful place!
author: Bryce T.

description: Wonderful food, good value. It's known for mozzarella and pizza; that is what is good.
author: Matthew P.

description: I have had Italian Pizza in other places before and it would not be fair if I give more than two stars to IL Casaro! I tried the Mozzarella plate and two of their Pizza. The cheese was just OK. The pizza was too juicy (no surprise though! the pizza was ready 10 minutes after I ordered; I think it should have been cooked a bit more). AND it's over priced in my opinion.
author: Setan J.

description: This is an awesome new restaurant in north beach! The food is authentic and the service is great! Would definitely recommend.
author: Lauren C.

description: You can tell that these folks love pizza and take great pride in what they do. Just happened to wander into Il Casaro on a business trip recently and will definitely be back when I'm in town.
author: Peter S.

description: Great location.  Fun atmosphere.  Cozy and friendly.  Could you get any more prosciutto or parmesan on our pizza?  DELISH!  Make a friendly reservation during busy hours and you won't be sorry.  This is a hot ticket - and rightly so!
author: Dee R.

description: What a great find!  I made reservations via Yelp for a large group (12 people), based only on the Yelp reviews alone (I don't live in the city, so I don't know many restaurants).  My faith in online reviews was rewarded with delicious food and quick, friendly service.  The restaurant was very busy, so we had to wait about 10 minutes for our table, but we didn't mind.  Our servers were very helpful, and our orders came out very quickly.  We ordered several kinds of appetizers, pizzas and deserts.  The rice balls and the calamari were the biggest hits, as were the Capricciosa and Norma pizzas, and finally, the panna cotta and tiramisu.  My friends run the gamut of random diet restrictions and preferences, and everyone was pleased!
author: Arianne M.

description: Great, authentic, no-nonsense pizzas with excellent tomato sauce and toppings. Buratta is tasty. Host/owner warm and charming.
author: David S.

description: This place has an identity crisis. Really really good, authentic thin crust Italian pizza, indie soundtrack and basketball on the three TVs. Maybe that's why there's never a wait? Can't complain, it has become our go-to North Beach restaurant. The proscuitto pie is one of the best in the city. Grab a seat at the bar to watch the pizza action!
author: Laura B.

description: The waiter was rude. The mozarella starters were fantastic but the pizza was doughy and undercooked. Plus the room was stuffy and hot. Good starters, but in the end, a stuffy, doughy and rude experience.
author: Fredrik N.

description: Friendly service, great pizza (I favor the Diavola), fair prices. I come here often. This place easily stands out among the sea of mediocre touristy Italian places in this neighborhood.
author: Jon G.

description:
3.5
I

**simple space; pretty simple menu; enjoyed the counter action; ok prices.
**service - slow but friendly - inconsistent - I know they're new-ish --- so....
**pizza - dough was a little thick for me - I could taste salt in the dough which I dug; **pizza sauce was pretty good - not too tomato-y; topping/cheese/sauce ratio - good for me - I don't like a lot of cheese and a handfuls of toppings work for me - I had the Norma Pie - which was cheese and fried eggplant - I'd say eggplant was more sauteed than fried but still good- I'd put ricotta with the eggplant instead of mozzarella
**chili oil - request this for your pizza -house-made - way better than pepper flakes
**wines by the glass -- good pizza wines - excellent pour - decent price points 
**baccala - was not baccala - I was bummed as I love baccala - this was just plain cod batter-fried with zero flavor albeit the fish was cooked perfectly - the aoli condiment was flavorless (the menu said it was baccala but did just say it was cod versus salt-cod - I sought clarification -  but alas t'was not like my Grandma's baccala)
**tiramisu - pretty good considering I don't care for tiramisu - creamy - not overpowered by any one flavor 

Not the best pizza pie I've had; not the worst.  Might come back if I am in North Beach...would like to try the cheeses and give another pie a shot
author: Carson R.

description:
oh yeah...these guys are on it.

the pizzas here are very authentic if you have ever had the opportunity to eat pizza in Naples Italy.  This is as good as you're going to get in the US if you like pizza Napoletana.   i grew up in NJ/NY and pizza is my favorite food item.

my favorite pizza here is the Norma.  the staff is super friendly and the owner is refreshingly gracious.
author: eshwar k.

description: Outstanding food and wonderful service for a brand new place.   Very thin pizza and wonderful fresh cheese along with outstanding wine.
author: Coraleah N.

description: The best pizza of North Beach. So welcoming host, we love the atmosphere each time we go there... Thank you and keep up the good vibes!
author: Adrien M.

description: It's a simple place with amazing food and lovely people! The proscuitto pizza is so so so good!
author: Atena C.

description: This place is a find for people who love pizza. Outside of maybe Redd Wood in Yountville, this is the best pizza in the Bay Area. Trust me. Go there. Atmosphere and warm, friendly service also 5 stars. Yes.
author: Sarah M.

description: Absolutely fabulous, authentic Italian pizza. As a local, this is definitely one of the best spots.
author: Alex K.

description: Yum. Warm and friendly atmosphere, super fresh toppings and mozzarella bar. Attentive  and well paced service. Superb pizza crust!!!
author: Marianne T.

description: Best pizza outside of Rome! This is now my go-to pizzeria in the City. The uovo plus speck was insanely delicious. The crust was cooked to perfection. They have a Ferrara oven which makes this place super legit. In the world of wood-burning ovens, this would be the Ferrari of ovens. The tiramisu is also a must. I also highly recommend the burrata which is imported from Puglia. Just try it and sit at the bar and watch all the action. Customer service was outstanding. What's not to love? Buon Appetito!!!
author: C N.

description: Visiting San Francisco from our hometown of Santa Barbara always provides  thousands of new restaurant options.  Our favorite neighborhood is North Beach so we usually end up eating Italian food several times during our stay in the city.  Imagine our surprise when we found  that our two new favorite Italian restaurants are owned by the same people.  (I will review the other restaurant, Vicoletto, on the Yelp page for that restaurant.)  In this restaurant on our last night in SF, we had a fantastic dinner of creamy, fresh Burratta served on dressed arugula with wood fired, crispy bread, castelvetrano olives, roasted asparagus with shaved Parmesan, and a margherita pizza, all greedily washed down with icy cold Peronis.  This dinner couldn't have been better.  It's the first pizza we've had that is equal to Gusto's pizza in Florence, Italy.  Piping hot, the fresh mozzarella perfectly melted, the crust charred and crispy on the outside but chewy and delicious inside.  It was just the absolute best pizza we've eaten in the US.  Service was excellent, too.  Our waiter checked on us a number of times while we were eating to make sure we didn't need anything.  Do yourself a favor and go here.  It will become a favorite of yours too if you know good pizza.
author: Susan G.

description: We were seated quickly, which was nice as we found that most quality restaurants in North Beach fill up fast. We placed our wine order, which came out in a timely fashion and was pretty good, but when we put in our pizza order, they forgot to make it....twice. After about 40 minutes or so, we asked the server (who was also the hostess) how much longer it would take. Since the kitchen is open air so everyone can see in, we witnessed a brief, yet terse argument between our server and the kitchen staff. She came back and said it should be only a few more minutes, but it was pretty obvious they forgot to make it. After about another 30 minutes or so, still no pizza. We flagged down our server and asked AGAIN how long it would be. She went back for fight-with-kitchen-staff #2, which was in plain view. She came back and said it would just be a few minutes, but they clearly forgot to make it....again. It finally came out about 5-10 minutes later and the dough was clearly undercooked. If you're going to take over an hour to make a damn pizza, at least make it right. This place could be a good pizza joint; the chef knew what he was doing with the dough and the pizzas certainly had potential, but there was a severe lack of communication between the serving staff and the kitchen staff that makes this place a real mess. To make matters even worse, the server didn't offer to comp anything. She didn't even apologize. There is no excuse for that.
author: Mike L.
